description: If youre a bank executive, its never going to be easy to tell your shareholders: Oops, we made a $4 billion mistake!

title: Ron Kaplan of Trex, on Making Judgments Instead of Decisions
description: This interview with  Ron Kaplan, chief executive of Trex, a manufacturer of outdoor decks, was conducted and condensed by  Adam Bryant.

title: The Chatter for Sunday, May 3
description: I knew we could do this. Every week I got more and more confident, even through the toughest of times.

title: Behind the Masks in Ukraine, Many Faces of Rebellion
description: SLOVYANSK, Ukraine  The rebel leader spread a topographic map in front of a closed grocery store here as a Ukrainian military helicopter flew past a nearby hill. Ukrainian troops had just seized positions along a river, about a mile and a half away. The commander thought they might advance.

title: Dripping and E-Cigarettes
description: Trey Hudson of Oklahoma City, Okla., demonstrates how he drips nicotine solution onto the heating element of his tank-system e-cigarette.

title: Safety Sometimes Prevails Over Accuracy in Calling the First Out of a Double Play
description: Runner on first, one out. Ground ball to the second baseman. He flips the ball to the shortstop, who seamlessly catches it, leaps above the sliding runner and fires to first base for a double play.

title: Some E-Cigarettes Deliver a Puff of Carcinogens
description: Electronic cigarettes appear to be safer than ordinary cigarettes for one simple  and simply obvious  reason: people dont light up and smoke them.

title: For Florida Grapefruit, One Blow After Another
description: VERO BEACH, Fla.  In the nearly 100 years that Rusty Banacks family has been growing Floridas world-famous grapefruit, the industry has lurched from years of bumper crops to the devastation of tree-toppling hurricanes.

title: China Upends the Global Economy
description: Uncle Sam faces a new heavyweight.

title: After a Few Stumbles, the Blackhawks Regain a Champions Swagger
description: CHICAGO  There was a championship parade for the Blackhawks in June through the streets of downtown Chicago. By October, as this season began, there was talk of a dynasty. Then came a 20-4-4 start followed by the selection of 10 Blackhawks from five countries for the Sochi Olympics in February. No other N.H.L. team sent more players.

title: Race and Politics in Oklahoma
description: If he can earn the Republican nomination in Oklahomas June primary, T.W. Shannon could be the second enrolled Native American elected to the United States Senate in nearly 100 years.

title: Behind the Masks of Pro-Russian Militants in Ukraine
description: A deeper look at one group of rebels in eastern Ukraine offers a murky picture of their aims, motivations and connections.

title: N.B.A.s Coveted Trait: Well-Tuned Ears
description: Its no secret that rap and the N.B.A. have a long history, from Shaq and the Fu-Schnickens to Iman Shumpert rapping Migos street hit Versace to Drake and Jay Z sitting courtside with team owners.

title: G.O.P. Hopeful Finds Tribal Tie Cuts Both Ways
description: BARTLESVILLE, Okla.  T. W. Shannon will be Oklahomas first black senator if he wins the Republican nomination and is elected this November, but the quiet campaign stirring here about Mr. Shannons racial loyalties is not aimed at the African-American branch of his family tree.

title: Falling Behind in N.H.L. Playoffs Is No Reason to Lose Hope
description: The Stanley Cup playoffs wild first round was a reminder of just how improbable hockey can be. San Jose trounced Los Angeles in their first three games, and then the Kings trounced the Sharks in the last four. The Pittsburgh Penguins advanced, even though Sidney Crosby did not score a goal. The Rangers extended their 12-game losing streak while holding a series lead, but then won their fourth straight Game 7.

title: Gardening for Climate Change
description: COLUMBIA, S.C.  THIS past winter was a tough one in our backyard. Where we live, about a hundred miles inland from the South Carolina coast, winter is normally a good time to make changes, like the swath of turf I removed from our front yard this year and replaced with perennial flowers and small tufts of native grass. But what is normal now in the garden? One week Im sweating, the bees are buzzing, buds are breaking; the next, the birdbath is frozen and theres snow on the ground.

title: English Class With Mr. Roth
description: MALVERN, Pa.  DO you want to know what it was like to have Philip Roth as a professor?

title: Energy Incentives
description: Readers discuss an editorial criticizing efforts to impose surcharges on solar installations.

title: Going Mobile
description: Few stereotypes are as well entrenched  and wrongheaded  as the perception of mobile homes as the marginal housing choice of the destitute and downtrodden.

title: Why People Dont Donate Their Kidneys
description: WASHINGTON  THE national transplant list just passed a morbid milestone: More than 100,000 people now wait for kidneys.

title: Do Our Kids Get Off Too Easy?
description: THE conventional wisdom these days is that kids come by everything too easily  stickers, praise, As, trophies. Its outrageous, were told, that all kids on the field may get a thanks-for-playing token, in contrast to the good old days, when recognition was reserved for the conquering heroes.

title: Beyond the Damaged Brain
description: UNTIL the past few decades, neuroscientists really had only one way to study the human brain: Wait for strokes or some other disaster to strike people, and if the victims pulled through, determine how their minds worked differently afterward. Depending on what part of the brain suffered, strange things might happen. Parents couldnt recognize their children. Normal people became pathological liars. Some people lost the ability to speak  but could sing just fine.

title: President Obama and the World
description: Two years after winning an election in which foreign policy was barely mentioned, President Obama is being pummeled at home and abroad for his international leadership. The world sometimes seems as if it is flying apart, with Mr. Obama unable to fix it. Through a combination of a few significant missteps, circumstances beyond his control, unreasonable expectations and his maddeningly bland demeanor, Mr. Obama has opened himself to criticism that he is not articulating a strong, overarching blueprint for the exercise of American power and has not been able to bend authoritarian leaders to his will.

title: When Sources Set the Ground Rules
description: SOMETIMES a single sentence can be a window into a world.

title: Gary Beauchamp
description: Gary Beauchamp is a biopsychologist and the director of the Monell Chemical Senses Center in Philadelphia, which is a nonprofit scientific institute dedicated to basic research on the senses of taste and smell.

title: Clear Rules Eyed on Church Sex Abuse
description: VATICAN CITY  The Vatican commission advising Pope Francis on sexual abuse policy will develop clear and effective protocols to protect children from pedophile priests, including procedures to hold church authorities accountable if they neglect to act on cases of abuse, Vatican officials said Saturday.

title: America the Shrunken
description: NOT long ago I asked a good friend of mine  one of the smartest men I know, and one of the most devoted dads  if he thought that his children would live in a more prosperous America or at least enjoy the same bounty of opportunities that we had.

title: Its Not Just About Obama
description: THERE has been a festival of commentary of late bemoaning the pusillanimous foreign policy of President Obama. If only we had a president who rode horses shirtless, wrestled a tiger or took a bite out of a neighboring country, wed all feel much safer. Your Honor, I rise in  partial  defense of Mr. Obama.

title: 42 and 45 Overpower 44
description: WASHINGTON  THE First Family is all over the news, discussing the management of the economy, income inequality, raising the minimum wage, the vicissitudes of press coverage and the benefits of healthy eating.

title: College, the Great Unequalizer
description: NO doubt by now youve finished last months assigned reading, Thomas Pikettys Capital in the Twenty-First Century, for our spring-semester course on Stratification in America. Im sorry about the length (and the Amazon back-order problem), but Im sure that the 696 pages of inheritance-data analysis and mile Zola references flew by. And the good news is that you dont need to worry about the term paper, because my fellow Elite Media Pundits and I have written about 330,000 words on the book that you can just crib, copy and repurpose.

title: Bring Back Our Girls
description: DOZENS of heavily armed terrorists rolled into the sleepy little town one night in a convoy of trucks, buses and vans. They made their way to the girls boarding school.

title: In Spite of the Law, Afghan Honor Killings of Women Continue
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  An 18-year-old runaway named Amina agreed two weeks ago to leave the womens shelter in which she had taken refuge in northern Afghanistan and go home with her brother and her uncle.

title: Out of Print, if Not Off Clock
description: I have been bracing myself for this news for some time. Despite considerable evidence to the contrary, Mel Kiper Jr., ESPNs lead N.F.L. draft expert, is, after all, only human. Kiper has produced his N.F.L. draft report since 1979, and I always knew that at some point, he would type his last word, hit send and that would be that.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Sports Editor:

title: 2,000 Feared Dead in Afghan Landslide
description: Officials were expected to designate the site, in earth nearly 30 feet deep, a mass grave.

title: Students and Data Privacy
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Sunday Breakfast Menu, May 4
description: An email released this week put the spotlight once again on the 2012 attack in Benghazi, Libya, showing that the White House wanted to shape the way Susan E. Rice, then the ambassador to the United Nations, would discuss the violence. In response, House Republicans announced plans to form a committee to examine whether the Obama administration misled Congress about the attack.

title: Fairways From the Air
description: ABOARD SNOOPY ONE, above Charlotte, N.C.  Like scores of other golf spectators at a PGA Tour event, Andrew Murray chooses where to position himself by consulting a course map. By the end of the week, his legs are leaden from the effort of tracking the leaders.

title: Partial Service Resumes After Subway Derailment in Queens
description: Partial service was temporarily restored to subway lines running along Queens Boulevard on Saturday afternoon, a day after 19 people were injured in the worst derailment in the New York City subway system in over two decades.

title: Study Reveals Sizable Increase in Diabetes Among Children
description: For years doctors have warned of a rising epidemic of diabetes among children. Yet there has been surprisingly little firm data on the extent of this disease among younger Americans.

title: Standing with the Kidnapped Girls in Nigeria
description: My Sunday column is about the girls kidnapped from their school in northeastern NIgeria nearly three weeks ago. I wrote the column partly to apply more pressure on the Nigerian authorities, who seem uninterested in the case, to try to rescue these girls, and partly because Im offended by the contrast between the global media focus on the missing MH370 flight and the uninterest in the even greater number of missing schoolgirls in Nigeria. Its also important to note that whats at stake isnt just these girls: If theyre not recovered soon, then no parents are going to send girls or boys to school in the area again. And the area, where as it is only half of adults are literate, will slide into greater illiteracy, economic difficulty and backwardness. Education isnt just about building schools, its also about ensuring security so that parents feel safe sending their children to school.

title: Islamic Jihad on Defending Gaza
description: Abu Malek, 25, the commander of a band of Al-Quds Brigades  the armed wing of Islamic Jihad  discusses his troops readiness to respond to any Israeli incursions.

title: Islamic Jihad Gains New Traction in Gaza
description: GAZA  Shortly before midnight, seven black-masked young men in camouflage stood in a field of waist-high weeds, Kalashnikov rifles pointed toward the Mediterranean Sea a half-mile away.

title: A Predecessor of Hamas Asserts Itself
description: Islamic Jihad has long shunned electoral politics to focus on military resistance against the Israeli occupation, and it has gained the support of Gaza residents.

title: A Clinton In-Law Seeks Office, but Where Are the Clintons?
description: To hear Marjorie Margolies tell it, she essentially gave up her seat in Congress to cast a tiebreaking vote that saved President Bill Clintons 1993 budget. But it is unclear whether the Clintons will be able to save her as she tries to win it back some 20 years later.

title: Game 7s Abound in the First Round of N.B.A. Playoffs
description: When the Nets step onto the court to face the Raptors on Sunday in Toronto, they will be taking part in one of five Game 7s during the opening round of the N.B.A. postseason.

title: Fight Against Sexual Assaults Holds Colleges to Account
description: Emma Sulkowicz said she knew it would be awful to go before a disciplinary panel and describe being raped by a fellow student, but nothing prepared her for what came next. She said one of the two women on the panel, a university official, asked her, repeatedly, how the painful sex act she described was physically possible.

title: Highlights and Analysis: California Chrome Wins the Kentucky Derby
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  California Chrome, the speedy colt who established himself as the 5-2 morning-line favorite after winning four straight races by a combined 24 1/4 lengths, blew away the field in the 140th running of the Kentucky Derby on Saturday under blue skies and 70-degree weather at Churchill Downs.

title: At Peace With a Certain Level of Renown
description: Smiling serenely and speaking in modulated tones, Anthony Newman looked back without anger at his lifes course. The keyboardist and composer, who will be 73 on May 12, did not dwell on how his vibrant readings of early music, once criticized in certain quarters, were now widely copied. Nor did he ponder how fame  the recording mogul Clive Davis once enlisted him to bring Bach to the counterculture masses  in the end proved a bit of a mirage.

title: Groggy Yankees Lean on Tanaka Until Their Offense Ends Its Slumber
description: When Masahiro Tanaka left Yankee Stadium in the second inning of Friday nights game, he could not have known how important his job would be Saturday.

title: A Barnlike Haven for Meat Lovers
description: The South Shore BBQ Company looks just as it should: a casual place with wood-plank and brick walls, sturdy wooden chairs and bare wooden tables holding rolls of paper towels and squeeze bottles of assorted barbecue sauces. The barnlike spot, which opened in Patchogue in March, also resembles the sports bar it replaced. A big U-shape bar with 28 stools and 16 overhead TV screens dominates the restaurant.

title: Joined Sides
description: SUNDAYS PUZZLE  Hands up if youve ever had a RAMOS gin fizz. Neither have I. Ive had a sloe gin fizz, which also fits, not that Im bitter. Im not sure Id want to try a RAMOS gin fizz because the recipe calls for an egg white, which I typically eschew in my adult beverages for the slime factor. In my head, eggs belong on a plate, fizzes belong in a glass. And no, Im not a nog drinker either.

title: Call of Nature Becomes a Call to Arms in Hong Kong
description: HONG KONG  A mainland couples decision to let their child urinate in public last month set off a video-recorded tussle on a street here, igniting a social media uproar that became a proxy battle for a larger question: Is Hong Kong, a former British colony, now being colonized by mainland China, whose visitors increasingly flood the territory with their money and alien manners as Beijing seeks to impose its political control?

title: Lebanese Comfort Food on a Budget
description: Kibberia Restaurant and Cafe opened in Westport in late August 2013. This modest Lebanese place, more of a cafe than a restaurant, fills a need for falafel, hummus, kibbe (the ground meat and bulgur wheat patty from which the cafe derives its name), kebabs and other Mediterranean and Middle Eastern favorites  all while keeping prices low enough to entice families on a budget.

title: Coming From Humble Beginnings, a Favorite Defies the Odds
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  There are few rules in racing, but one that is considered inviolable is never to turn down a suitcase full of cash. Steve Coburn and Perry Martin understood that, but two months ago, when one of the sports far wealthier owners offered them $6 million for 51 percent of the first horse they had bred, the offer just did not sit well.

title: Embrace of Atheism Put an Indonesian in Prison
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  Growing up in a conservative Muslim household in rural West Sumatra, Alexander Aan hid a dark secret beginning at age 9: He did not believe in God. His feelings only hardened as he got older and he faked his way through daily prayers, Islamic holidays and the fasting month of Ramadan.

title: Dumplings to Sip From
description: Youve got to be looking for Shanghai Bun to find the place, set unobtrusively in the far corner of a modest strip mall in spitting distance of New Jersey Transits Princeton Junction station  unless you are in the market for bath fixtures, and stumble upon it. In that case, lucky you.

title: Winter Survivor, Sunbathing
description: The dark maroon wings of the mourning cloak butterfly match the vast and subtle browns of the early spring woods. Velvety and saturated with color, the wings are bordered with a warm yellow band and dotted with a row of unexpected iridescent blue spots. This butterfly is both handsome and cryptic; while resting or feeding, it folds its wings to create a gray, ragged-edged silhouette  the perfect imitation of a dead leaf.

title: In Azerbaijan, Carlsen Wins When It Counts
description: In winning the Shamkir 2014 chess tournament in Azerbaijan, Magnus Carlsen was able to exact revenge in the last round against Fabiano Caruana, one of two players who defeated him earlier in the event.

title: On Top at the Derby
description: At the Kentucky Derby, outrageous hats are as much of an attraction as the horses.

title: Gerald Guralnik, a God Particle Pioneer, Dies at 77
description: Gerald Guralnik, one of six pioneering physicists who in the 1960s came up with a theory that nearly 50 years later would lead to the discovery of a subatomic particle that helped explain a perennial mystery about the universe  why it contains life and diversity  died on April 26 in Providence, R.I. He was 77.

title: Rabbi Myer Kripke, Early Buffett Friend and Investor, Dies at 100
description: When they were younger men, Rabbi Myer Kripke and Warren E. Buffett belonged to the same Rotary Club and lived a few blocks from each other in the Happy Hollow neighborhood of Omaha. They played bridge together with their wives. The Buffetts would invite the Kripkes over for Thanksgiving.

title: When Hitting Find My iPhone Takes You to a Thiefs Doorstep
description: WEST COVINA, Calif.  After a boozy Saturday night, Sarah Maguire awoke the next morning to find that her iPhone was gone. Her roommates phone was gone, too. Were they at the bar, she wondered, or in the cab?

title: Video Notebook: Game 7 for Nets-Raptors
description: Alan Anderson talks about the expectations of the Nets playing the Raptors in Toronto for Game 7.

title: At Berkshire Annual Meeting, Questions for Buffett About Coca-Cola and Deals
description: OMAHA  Every spring without fail, tens of thousands of investors flock to Berkshire Hathaways annual meeting here, hoping to ask just one question of its famed chief executive, Warren E. Buffett.

title: In Cases of Smuggled Cellphones, Few Prosecutions
description: Armed with shovels, corrections officers at a prison in East Texas last summer unearthed a cache of hundreds of smuggled items, including 45 cellphones and 52 chargers. Nearly a year later, no arrests have been made in the elaborate trafficking attempt.

title: Rangers, Stuck in 0-for-25 Drought on Power Play, Consider Lineup Changes
description: PITTSBURGH  Although a productive power play is not mandatory for victory in the playoffs, it certainly helps. With that in mind, Rangers Coach Alain Vigneault said Saturday that he might change the personnel on the teams lackluster power play despite a Game 1 win over the Penguins.

title: Music Shift Fuels Effort to Preserve a Tradition
description: One recent Sunday afternoon, Dale Watson, the Austin country singer and guitarist with a signature white pompadour, zipped along winding wooded roads near Dripping Springs in his 2012 Mini Cooper.

title: For Legislators, Race Correlates to Party, Mostly
description: Ross Ramsey, the executive editor of The Texas Tribune, writes a regular column for the Tribune.

title: Dominant Stretch and Touch of Bravado Bring Mickelson Close to Ending Drought
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  Phil Mickelson and his caddie, Jim Mackay, have a telepathy that comes from having spent 22 years  nearly half their lives  working together. So Mackay assumed he and Mickelson were thinking 6-iron Saturday for a downwind, 216-yard tee shot on the par-3 13th during the third round of the Wells Fargo Championship at Quail Hollow Club.

title: Some Time Away Helps the Old Teixeira Return
description: When Mark Teixeira squarely makes contact, his swing appears tight and compact, and it often sends the ball high and far. He looks like the old Teixeira and not like an old Teixeira.

title: Easily Dismissed, Democrat Who Criticizes Obama Runs On
description: Addressing a group of veterans recently in El Paso, David Alameel spoke like a candidate with only one opponent: United States Senator John Cornyn, Republican of Texas. It was only after Mr. Alameel was asked about Kesha Rogers, his opponent in the May 27 Democratic primary runoff, that he spoke directly about her.

title: Scenes From the Finish Line
description: The race favorite California Chrome won the 140th Kentucky Derby on Saturday. He is the fifth California-bred winner of horse racings most prestigious event.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for May 3, 2014
Hibbert Goes From Scoreless to Relentless, Helping Pacers Win Game 7
description: INDIANAPOLIS  Roy Hibbert wanted the ball early in Game 7. Hibbert camped out in the post, his arms in the air to signal to his teammates. Then he yelled at them for the ball, and they obliged.

title: Coors Field Lifts the Rockies Already Potent Lineup
description: DENVER  Opposing pitchers have always dreaded, in some cases even feared, taking to the mound at 5,280 feet above sea level at Colorados Coors Field.

title: Orphan Black Recap: Please, Lets Not Imagine the Worst
description: For this weeks recap of Orphan Black on BBC America, lets fast forward to the last part of the episode, where, in a fairly disturbing scene, a drugged Helena (Tatiana Maslany) is an unwilling participant in a marriage ceremony with Henrik (Peter Outerbridge), the leader of the Proletheans. After the two characters are joined in matrimony, Henrik carries Helena over the threshold to an unknown room, with the tone of the scene strongly suggesting she is about to be raped or violated in some way.

title: Teenager Who Fell Asleep on Subway With Gun Visible Is Arrested, Police Say
description: A teenager was arrested on Saturday morning after a woman saw him holding a handgun while asleep on a subway train in the Times Square station, the police said.

title: Derby Winner Gives Co-Owner a Birthday Gift to Remember
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  Steve Coburns co-workers held an early birthday party for him a week ago. There was pizza and a cake, which bore the words Happy Birthday as well as California Chrome, 2014 Kentucky Derby.

title: League Is Set to Appoint a C.E.O. for the Clippers
description: LOS ANGELES  The N.B.A. announcedSaturdaythat it would soon appoint a chief executive to oversee operations of the Los Angeles Clippers in an attempt to create stability in the wake of the Donald Sterling scandal.

title: Winning Day in Kentucky for California Chrome
description: The jockey Victor Espinoza rode the favorite to a convincing victory on Saturday in the 140th Kentucky Derby at Churchill Downs.

title: Comedian in Chiefs New Punch Line: Obamacare
description: WASHINGTON  Five and a half years into President Obamas time in office, the jokes are getting a bit stale: Fox News is a shadowy right-wing organization. The 47 percent called Mitt Romney to apologize. The whole Kenyan president bit.

title: Tanne Gabler, Braden Beard
description: Tanne Bailey Gabler, a daughter of Christina Gabler and Neal Gabler of Amagansett, N.Y., was married Saturday to Braden Alexander Beard, a son of Deborah Elliott Beard and W. Clayton Beard of Houston. Joshua A. Rocha, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life Church minister for the occasion, officiated at the Inn at Wild Rose Hall in Austin, Tex.

title: Francesca Butnick and Clifford Silverman
description: Francesca Caroline Butnick, a daughter of Elyse Rothaus Butnick and Howard J. Butnick of Old Westbury, N.Y., was married Saturday evening to Clifford Michael Silverman, a son of Marilyn Silverman and Steven E. Silverman of Tampa, Fla. Rabbi Dr. David M. Posner officiated at Cipriani 42nd Street in Manhattan.

title: Megan Schmidt, Scott Wolin
description: Megan Foran Schmidt, a daughter of Margaret M. Foran and David H. Schmidt of Manhattan, was married Saturday evening to Scott Justin Wolin, the son of Sandra B. Wolin of Buffalo Grove, Ill., and Kenneth J. Wolin of Wheeling, Ill. Steven L. King, an uncle of the bride and a minister of the American Marriage Ministries, officiated at the Brooklyn Botanic Garden.

title: Amanda Graber, Brian Rosenberg
description: Amanda Rachel Graber and Brian Scott Rosenberg are to be married Sunday at the Rosewood, a hotel in London. Rabbi David Mitchell is to officiate.

title: Jacqueline Patzelt-Russo, Jeffrey Curtin
description: Jacqueline Marie Patzelt-Russo and Jeffrey Urso Curtin were married Saturday at the Church of St. Saviour in Brooklyn. The Rev. Daniel S. Murphy, a Roman Catholic priest and the pastor of the church, performed the ceremony.

title: John Kimble and Adam Banks
description: John Graham Kimble, the son of Barbara Bryant Johnson of New Orleans and Dr. John G. Kimble of Metairie, La., is to be married Sunday to Adam Baker Banks, a son of Margery F. Baker and Robert D. Banks of Potomac, Md. Judge Marsha S. Berzon of the United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit, for whom Mr. Banks was a law clerk, will officiate at the home of Mr. Bankss parents.

title: Sarah Horstmann, Stefan Kolata
description: Sarah Larkin Horstmann, the daughter of Megan T. Horstmann and Stephen F. Horstmann of West Chester, Pa., was married Saturday to Stefan Matthew Kolata, the son of Gina Kolata and William Kolata of Princeton, N.J. The Rev. Laurence J. Gleason, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at St. Agnes Church in West Chester.

title: A Friendship Has Designs of Its Own
description: Jeremiah Brent and Nate Berkus were married Saturday at the New York Public Library. Sheri Salata, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated.

title: Kimberly Seedor, Steven Thompson
description: Kimberly Anne Seedor, a daughter of Denise M. Seedor and Dr. John A. Seedor of Larchmont, N.Y., was married there Saturday to Steven John Thompson, a son of Ellen F. Thompson and John B. Thompson of Mamaroneck, N.Y. Msgr. Thomas R. Kelly performed the ceremony at the Church of St. Augustine in Larchmont, N.Y.

title: Haley Lieberman, Michael Friedman
description: Haley Sarah Lieberman and Michael Scott Friedman were married Saturday night by Rabbi Matthew Gewirtz at Central Synagogue in New York, where the groom is an associate rabbi.

title: Alexandra Della Rocchetta and James Tripiano
description: Alexandra Della Rocchetta and Lt. James Frank Tripiano were married Saturday in the chapel of the United States Naval Academy in Annapolis, Md.

title: Sheryl Wright and Vincent Smith
description: Sheryl Margaret Wright and Vincent Otis Smith were married Friday at Riverside Church in New York. The Rev. Dr. James A. Forbes Jr., an American Baptist minister and the churchs former senior pastor, performed the ceremony.

title: Megan Horn, Kamal Essaheb
description: Megan Elizabeth Horn and Kamal Essaheb were married Saturday at the Islamic Cultural Center of New York in Manhattan. Imam Chernor S. Jalloh performed a Muslim ceremony.

title: Sonya Thomas, Daniel Blizzard
description: Dr. Sonya Thomas, the daughter of Harpreet Thomas and Jacob K. Thomas of Woodbridge, Conn., was married Friday to Dr. Daniel John Blizzard, the son of Ann L. Linscott of Salem, Ore., and Dr. Daniel R. Blizzard of Sunset Beach, N.C. Derek Taylor, a friend of the groom and a former youth pastor at Valley Bible Church in Spokane Valley, Wash., officiated at a nondenominational ceremony at Barclay Villa in Angier, N.C., a former inn that is now a banquet facility.

title: Morgan Kennedy and Tobias Loss-Eaton
description: Morgan Rucker Kennedy, a daughter of Altomease Rucker Kennedy and Judge Henry H. Kennedy Jr. of Washington, was married Saturday evening to Tobias Samuel Loss-Eaton, a son of Sandra C. Eaton and Robert S. Loss, both of Lexington, Mass. Judge Paul L. Friedman of the United States District Court for the District of Columbia officiated in the ballroom of the Park Hyatt Washington.

title: Julie Ingalls, Justin Overdorff
description: Julie Elizabeth Ingalls and Justin Michael Overdorff were married Saturday at Le Mridien Hotel in Philadelphia. John Walkley, a cousin of the bride who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated.

title: Alison Laufer, Sean Halpin
description: Alison Sheehan Laufer and Sean Nathaniel Halpin are to be married Sunday at the Bristol Harbor Inn and DeWolf Tavern in Bristol, R.I. The officiant will be John P. Normoyle, a friend of the couple who received temporary permission from the Rhode Island Senate to marry the couple.

title: Jennifer Brod, Jeffrey Bernstein
description: Jennifer Eloise Brod, the daughter of Betsy Brod and John B. Brod of New York, is to be married Sunday to Jeffrey Daniel Bernstein, the son of Nancy Golden Bernstein and Dr. Guy T. Bernstein of Bryn Mawr, Pa. Rabbi Matthew D. Gewirtz will officiate at the home of the brides parents.

title: Kelly Faircloth, Nicholas Webb
description: Georgia Kelly Faircloth and Nicholas Beale Webb were married Saturday evening at the Yale Club of New York City. Judge William J. Corbett, who retired as the acting village justice of Floral Park, N.Y., officiated.

title: Christopher Kissel, Donald Nienas Jr.
description: Christopher Bengt Kissel and Donald Patrick Nienas Jr. were married Saturday at the Brooklyn Botanic Garden. Eric Benn, a friend of the couple and a Universal Life minister, officiated.

title: Kendall Fitch, Jonathan Bailey
description: Margaret Kendall Fitch, the daughter of Margaret Holloway Fitch of Aiken, S.C., and Paul V. Fitch of Charlotte, N.C., was married Saturday to Jonathan Henry Bailey, a son of Carol Jenkins Bailey and Michael W. Bailey of London. Jim DeKornfeld, a Universal Brotherhood minister, officiated at the Green Boundary Club, a private dining club in Aiken.

title: Brigid Ryan and Jyoti Chowdhury
description: Brigid Julia Ryan and Jyoti Bhasker Chowdhury were married Wednesday at the Superior Court of the District of Columbia. Avrom D. Sickel, the director of the Family Court Operations Division in Washington, officiated.

title: Lillie Werner, Arun Singh
description: Lillie Ashton Werner, a daughter of Marie A. Friend and Peter H. Werner, both of Los Angeles, was married Saturday to Dr. Arun Sayram Singh, the son of Haymwantee P. Singh and Seeram Singh of Sayreville, N.J. Pandit Harry Persaud, a Hindu priest, officiated at the Newhall Mansion in Piru, Calif.

title: Dana Price, John Wainwright
description: Dr. Dana Elyse Price, the daughter of Linda A. Price and Dr. Barry H. Price of New York, is to be married Sunday to John Varma Wainwright, the son of Kitty Varma and John E. Wainwright of Bethesda, Md. Rabbi Steven Blane is to officiate at the Loeb Boathouse in Central Park.

title: The Long Hello
description: Sophie Dora Waskow and Drew Harris Rifkin were married Saturday evening at City Winery in Manhattan. Rabbi Bruce Elder officiated.

title: A Ninth-Inning Blast Trumps the Mets Powerful Night
description: DENVER  After two lifeless losses to open their four-game series against the Colorado Rockies, the Mets endured their most deflating defeat this weekend at Coors Field, watching a 6-0 lead turn into an 8-6 deficit and two late rallies go for naught as pinch-hitter Charlie Culberson hit a two-run homer in the bottom of the ninth to give the Rockies an 11-10 victory Saturdaynight.

title: Corrections: May 4, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Mayweather, Bloodied but Still Unbeaten, Defeats Maidana by Decision
description: LAS VEGAS  Floyd Mayweather Jr. has made such an art of dominance that anything less is quite puzzling. And his opponent Saturday night was not expected to challenge that mastery.

title: Sometimes, the Video Doesnt Have to Go Viral
description: In the early days of my company, RJMetrics, we didnt have much to stand on: no funding, a fledgling product, and about 50 square feet of space in my attic. So we did what any self-respecting Internet start-up would do: We made a rap video.

title: In Our Pages: May 5
description: 1914: Suffragette Hacks Academy Picture

title: Reasons for Hope While Applying to College
description: The bad news for students applying to selective colleges is that getting accepted to any one of them really is harder than it used to be. Many colleges have reduced the number of American teenagers they accept (in order to globalize their student bodies) at the same time that the American teenage population is growing, as I wrote last week.

title: As Traffic Deaths Fall, Pedestrian Deaths Do Not
description: The decline in vehicle-accident deaths in recent years has been nothing short of remarkable. But there is one disturbing exception to the trend: pedestrian deaths.

title: Lackeys of Youth Soccer, That Arrogant Sport
description: The edict from my daughters soccer team manager arrived Monday morning: A state cup match had been rescheduled for 2 p.m. Sunday in Vancouver, Wash., a two-and-a-half hour drive from our home in Seattle. Families were expected to travel and check into a hotel Saturday night. Players were required to appear at a breakfast and pregame strategy session with the coach at 9 a.m. on Sunday.

title: Incumbents Party Loses Presidency in Panama
description: MEXICO CITY  Panamanians, enjoying one of the fastest-growing economies in the hemisphere but wary of corruption and growing executive power, rejected the governing partys choice for president on Sunday  on a ticket with the presidents wife for vice president  and instead hewed to tradition by electing an opposition candidate.

title: Devices That Know How We Really Feel
description: Admit it: Sometimes you just want to punch your PC, or slap your smartphone, or knock your notebook.

title: Clippers Regroup After Tough Series and Off-Court Maelstrom
description: LOS ANGELES  The buzzer had not sounded. There was still two seconds left, but the Golden State Warriors needed more than one basket, so Los Angeles Clippers Coach Doc Rivers finally let loose. He stood near midcourt and shook his fists. He waved his arms. He smiled.

title: Obama Jokes at Correspondents Dinner
description: President Obama joked about the Healthcare.gov rollout and Republican praise of President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia in his comments at the White House Correspondents Association dinner Saturday.

title: Bloomberg Gains 2 Veteran Political Journalists
description: John Heilemann and Mark Halperin, political journalists known for their detailed, gossip-filled books on the past two presidential campaigns, will join Bloomberg in the coming days to start a new site that will focus on American politics and policy.

title: U.S. Urges Congo Leader Not to Run for Third Term
description: KINSHASA, Democratic Republic of Congo  Secretary of State John Kerry on Sunday publicly urged the president of the Democratic Republic of Congo to respect his nations Constitution and not run for another term in 2016.

title: Whats On Sunday
description: 9 P.M. (Discovery) EVEREST AVALANCHE TRAGEDY On April 18 an NBC News team waited at the base camp on Mount Everest as it prepared to produce Everest Jump Live, a special about the climber Joby Ogwyns attempt to make the first wing-suit flight off the 29,029-foot summit of the worlds tallest mountain. That morning an avalanche struck the Khumbu Icefall, killing 13 Sherpa guides and leaving three missing  the highest death toll in a single day in the mountains history. This documentary covers the weeks leading up to the tragedy and the subsequent rescue and recovery efforts through real-time film footage and witness accounts. Among those interviewed are Mr. Ogwyn, above; Garrett Madison, the expedition leader; and Todd Burleson, the president of Alpine Ascents International, which lost five guides. It also pays tribute to the Sherpas and their families; the network will make a contribution to the American Himalayan Foundations Sherpa Family Fund, from which all donations will flow to relatives of the deceased. In Bear Grylls: Man vs. Everest, leading in at 8, Mr. Grylls presents stories of the greatest Everest attempts, using archival footage and interviews with climbers and support crews. In Bear Grylls: Everest After the Avalanche, at 10:30, he draws on his own experience  scaling the peak in 1998 at the age of 23 to explain the allure of the mountain, and the danger.

title: Stranded for Hours in Hudson, Cruise Ship Docks at Manhattan Pier
description: A cruise ship that was stranded in the Hudson River for several hours made it to shore on Sunday morning, docking at Pier 88 on the West Side of Manhattan, officials said.

title: Young Blood May Hold Key to Reversing Aging
description: Two teams of scientists published studies on Sunday showing that blood from young mice reverses aging in old mice, rejuvenating their muscles and brains. As ghoulish as the research may sound, experts said that it could lead to treatments for disorders like Alzheimers disease and heart disease.

title: No Charges as Leader of Sinn Fein Is Released
description: LONDON  Gerry Adams, the leader of the Irish political party Sinn Fein, was released from police custody without charges on Sunday after four days of questioning into a gruesome 1972 Irish Republican Army murder of a widow with 10 children. But the police will hand over a file of potential evidence against him to prosecutors, police officials said.

title: Break Found in Queens Subway Track; Normal Service for the Morning Rush
description: The Metropolitan Transportation Authority expected to resume normal subway service from Queens into Manhattan at 5 a.m. Monday along the four lines  the E, F, M and R  affected by a derailment  on Friday, officials announced on Sunday night.

title: Train Derails in India, Killing at Least 18
description: NEW DELHI  A passenger train traveling through the Western Ghats mountain range on a route connecting Mumbai and Goa in western India derailed on Sunday, killing at least 18 people and injuring more than 125 others.

title: Signaling Interest in 2016, Perry Talks of Second Chances
description: WASHINGTON  Gov. Rick Perry of Texas on Sunday sent some of his clearest signals of interest in a 2016 presidential bid, joking wryly about his botched run in 2012 but then adding that I think America is a place that believes in second chances.

title: Rangers Crumbling Power Play May Have a New Piece
description: PITTSBURGH  The Rangers hope defenseman Anton Stralman is the tonic that restores their ailing power play to health.

title: Spreading the A.P. Gospel to Nurture Scientists and Engineers
description: PITTSBURGH  Even before the first day of class in August, Maura Fritzley had second thoughts about taking Advanced Placement physics.

title: Twin Faces of Desire in Movement
description: By the sound of it, Nrityagram, a village in southern India dedicated to the study, practice and teaching of the classical form Odissi, is a dance paradise. There live the incomparable Surupa Sen  the first student to graduate from Nrityagram, she is now its choreographer and artistic director  and Bijayini Satpathy, its spellbinding veteran dancer.

title: A Minimalist Master Returns
description: Carl Andre is one of Americas greatest living sculptors. He has been mostly absent from the American art scene for decades, but recently returned to oversee the installation of a new retrospective.

title: Ask Me Anything
description: Ill be taking reader questions this week on any topic. Simply post your question in the comments section here and Ill sift through and choose the most interesting and relevant ones to answer (Ill probably pick 10 to 15). Well notify you by email if your question was chosen, and all my answers will be posted later this week.

title: In a Flourishing Queens, Prosperity Eludes Some Asian Families
description: By now, you may have heard the buzz about Queens. You may have marveled at the gleaming new high rises and the pricey penthouses, at the influx of young professionals and the blossoming post-recession economy.

title: A Desert Spider With Astonishing Moves
description: A spider newly discovered in the Moroccan Sahara can do powerful, acrobatic flips through the air.

title: ScienceTake | Tumbling Spider
description: For one desert species, doing flips is a way to escape predators.

title: Nets Move On With a Swat at the Buzzer
description: TORONTO  As precious seconds ticked off the game clock here Sunday afternoon, Kyle Lowry was scampering away from Deron Williams and Kevin Garnett, desperate to find any free space to fling up a final shot.

title: Fans Boo Sabathia; He Cant Blame Them
description: Last week, C. C. Sabathia was asked if he thought fans had been too harsh in booing the former Yankees star Robinson Cano during his return to the Bronx. Sabathia simply responded, Its New York.

title: A Show About Nothing Begets Something You Can Play Online
description: What if new episodes of Seinfeld were still on television?

title: Music That Must Speak for Itself, Now That Its Composer Is Staying Quiet
description: The musical life of William Onyeabor has had at least three measurable and increasingly breathless stages of afterlife.

title: Can You Hear Me Now? Turn That Thing Off!
description: Despite continuing efforts to ward off the problem, the intrusive ringing of cellphones at concerts has become almost commonplace. Institutions do what they can to remind audiences to turn the things off. I am usually reluctant to mention a cellphone incident, since I dont want to suggest that a passing disturbance can ruin the overall experience of a great performance.

title: Insanely Pursuing Love, Be It Opera or Reality Show
description: To a listener familiar with Haydns opera Orlando Paladino only from recordings  a 1977 Philips release conducted by Antal Dorati and a 2006 Deutsche Harmonia Mundi release led by Nikolaus Harnoncourt  it has never been clear exactly how well the opera could be made to work onstage. A new production by the Manhattan School of Music Opera Theater, which opened on Wednesday evening in the schools John C. Borden Auditorium, does little to provide answers.

title: Playwrights Know That Kinfolk Are Such Characters
description: Its weird to become a part of someone elses family, a man complains after a visit with his girlfriends parents.

title: Not Quite Amazing, but Spidey Does Swing
description: LOS ANGELES  The Amazing Spider-Man 2 took in $92 million over the weekend, ushering in Hollywoods all-important summer blockbuster season and validating a sizable gamble by its maker, Sony Pictures Entertainment.

title: This Way Back to His Discomfort Zone
description: Comedians keep pushing at the boundaries of offensive humor. Louis C.K. tests the limits of sensitive humor.

title: Minimalist Retrospective Gets a Masters Touch
description: Carl Andre, a father of Minimalism and one of the greatest living American sculptors, decided to retire a few years ago, in his mid-70s. And for an exacting artist who usually insisted on arranging and installing most of his pieces himself, on site, retirement had a special ring of finality.

title: Three Stars Who Navigate on High Cs
description: The Three Tenors are back.

title: 9 Circus Performers Injured in Fall in Rhode Island
description: As thousands of parents and children watched, eight women dangling high above a ring at a Ringling Brothers and Barnum & Bailey circus performance in Providence, R.I., on Sunday crashed some 30 feet to the ground when the harness from which they were hanging suddenly collapsed.

title: Theyre Really Into Dylan, Maybe a Little Too Much
description: Bob Dylan said it best, in a 2012 Rolling Stone interview timed to the release of his Tempest  album: Why is it when people talk about me, they have to go crazy? More than 50 years after he first started attracting fanatical followers, Mr. Dylan was facing down a more brutal and dangerous species of devotee than he had seen before. The fans had social media, and the scholars had computers; en masse, they could track every move he made and every word he wrote, said or sang. Dylanologist, once a derisive term for the self-styled expert who sifted through the Dylan familys garbage cans, was now a word with wide colloquial meaning, if not yet a dictionary definition.

title: Whats the Deal With This Puzzle?
description: MONDAYS PUZZLE  I have a long-standing theory that for all experiences in life, there is an equivalent Seinfeld Moment. Anything you might go through has probably been covered at least once in the sitcom Seinfeld. The only exception I can think of is solving a puzzle about NOTHING that is clued to the sitcom itself. Thats way too meta even for the television show.

title: What Do Guns Say?
description: Earlier this month, in Bunkerville, Nev., representatives of the Bureau of Land Management withdrew from a tense standoff with supporters of Cliven Bundy, a rancher who owes the federal government over $1 million in unpaid fees for allowing his cattle to graze on public land. The hundreds of self-appointed militia and states rights activists who flocked to support Bundy, many in full tactical gear and openly carrying assault rifles, blockaded a federal interstate and trained their weapons on B.L.M. employees who sought to negotiate with the rancher and his family. Fearful of a pitched gun battle, the B.L.M. departed, leaving Bundy and his supporters to celebrate, emboldened, with a barbecue.

title: An Impressive Defensive Move Online
description: As mentioned in Saturdays column, the International Bridge Press Association hands out annual awards. The diagramed deal will probably make the defense shortlist. It was played online and was described by Ron Klinger after he was shown the deal by David Wiltshire, both from Australia.

title: Buoyed by Exports, Portugal Chooses Clean Exit From Bailout
description: LISBON  Portugal on Sunday announced its exit from a three-year bailout program that has forced deep spending cuts and set off mass protests  but has also helped the country clean up its public finances and return to the bond markets after halving its budget deficit.

title: Footnotes
description: Rihanna, below, Pharrell Williams and Lorde were among the winners at the inaugural iHeartRadio Music Awards, which were presented by Clear Channel last week in Los Angeles. Rihanna was named the artist of the year, and her song Stay featuring Mikky Ekko won best song. Mr. Williams received the Innovator Award, and Lorde was named best new artist. ... The Glaad Media Awards honored the actor George Takei and named Netflixs Orange Is the New Black outstanding comedy series in a ceremony on Saturday in New York. Two films  Concussion, written and directed by Stacie Passon, and Philomena, directed by Stephen Frears  also received awards.

title: Picking a Winner: The 1998 N.F.L. Draft
description: After the 1998 N.F.L. draft produced one of the greatest busts in history, what have we learned about the science of evaluating human talent  on and off the field?

title: Manning or Leaf? A Lesson in Intangibles
description: Say the name Bobby Thomson and before long someone is sure to bring up his 1951 partner in baseball history, Ralph Branca. Ever since the 1986 World Series, Mookie Wilson and Bill Buckner have gone together like a hot dog and a beer (or perhaps more like oil and water, if youre a still-mournful Boston Red Sox fan). Mark McGwire and Sammy Sosa are forever joined in grace by their 1998 pursuit of a home-run record, and in disgrace by their reliance on performance-enhancing drugs. And what figure-skating fan can hear about Nancy Kerrigan without thinking of Tonya Harding, the two being linked by a bizarre episode of attempted kneecapping in 1994?

title: South Sudan Captures Stronghold of Rebels
description: BENTIU, South Sudan  Government troops in South Sudan launched a counteroffensive against rebel forces on Sunday to retake two important northern towns just days after South Sudans president told the United States that he would hold talks with his rebel opponent.

title: Let Slip the Dolphins of War
description: SOUTHAMPTON, England  Fifty years ago, at the New York Worlds Fair in 1964, the science-fiction writer Arthur C. Clarke spoke of things to come. He foresaw a 21st century that would witness the development of intelligent and useful servants among the other animals on this planet, particularly the great apes and, in the oceans, the dolphins and whales. Clarke saw this as a way of solving the servant problem, although he also imagined that the animals would form labor unions, and wed be right back where we started.

title: We Need Al Capone Drug Laws
description: EDINA, Minn.  AFTER a ruinous 30-year experiment in harsh sentences for narcotics trafficking resulting in mass incarceration, policy makers are having second thoughts. Many states, including Texas, have reformed their laws to shorten sentences. Congress is giving serious consideration to the Smarter Sentencing Act, which would do the same. The United States Sentencing Commission has just adopted a proposal to revise federal guidelines.

title: Finally, Some Optimism About Obesity
description: EARLIER this year, we got what seemed like the first good news on obesity rates: A study in JAMA found that there had been a 43 percent drop in the obesity rates of 2- to 5-year-old children in the last decade. But then, last month, that news was contradicted by researchers at the University of North Carolina who used the same data to find that obesity rates had remained flat after all.

title: The Different Way That Boys Learn
In California Race, a Latina Democrat Carries Hopes of Her Party and People
description: SANGER, Calif.  Ya es tiempo  you have a voice, Amanda Renteria, a Democratic candidate for Congress, declared one recent Saturday morning at a park in this little city southeast of Fresno. There was no need to translate the Spanish. The park was festooned with Amanda Renteria para el Congreso signs.

title: For Top Jobs, Qualified Women Are Everywhere
description: To the Editor:

title: Sane Gun Laws
description: To the Editor:

title: Ending Automatic Defaults
description: To the Editor:

title: Privacy in the Digital Age
description: To the Editor:

title: Arms Cache Most Likely Kept in Texas by the C.I.A.
description: WASHINGTON  In passing references scattered through once-classified documents and cryptic public comments by former intelligence officials, it is referred to as Midwest Depot, but the bland code name belies the role it has played in some of the C.I.A.s most storied operations.

title: Survivors Hopes Fade in Aftermath of Afghan Landslide
description: ABI BARAK, Afghanistan  With hope gone that the 2,100 people thought to be buried by a mountain of mud here could be rescued, most efforts in this remote corner of northern Afghanistan have turned toward keeping the rest alive.

title: Countdown to 2014 World Cup in Brazil: Day 39
description: The 2014 World Cup begins on June 12, when Brazil plays Croatia in the opening match. Reporters and editors for The Times will count down to the start of the tournament each day with a short capsule of news and interesting tidbits.

title: From Riots and Rebels to Juice Bars and Tapas, a New Brixton Emerges
description: LONDON  They came trotting through the southern entrance of Brixton market, waving handwritten signs to protest the yuppification of this notorious South London neighborhood.

title: Vermont School Districts Consider Consolidation
description: ROCHESTER, Vt.  Tucked into valleys and isolated by mountains and rural expanse, many of Vermonts 273 school districts serve just a smattering of children. It is an old system, borne of the states agrarian history and knotty geography, and many Vermonters like it that way.

title: Fresh Doubts Raised About Papyrus Scrap Known as Gospel of Jesus Wife
description: New evidence discovered by a skeptical young scholar has raised fresh doubts about the authenticity of the scrap of papyrus known as the Gospel of Jesus Wife, a relic that has provoked fascination and fury since it was unveiled nearly two years ago by an eminent historian of early Christianity at Harvard Divinity School.

title: Push to Put Brands in Video Content
description: AS an annual presentation of new digital offerings to Madison Avenue enters its second week, marketers and publishers are focusing on ways to work together to integrate brands and products into video programming in the same way they are woven into the plots of television shows.

title: More Dead in Colombia Mine Collapse
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  The death toll in a collapse at an illegal gold mine in western Colombia has risen to at least 12 as searchers continued to dig for bodies on Sunday, a local official said.

title: Libertarians Trail Meter Readers, Telling Town: Live Free or Else
description: KEENE, N.H.  In most places, the parking enforcement officer reflects the municipal compact. Armed only with a gadget that can spit out a ticket at the forgotten drop of a dime, the officer quietly serves civic and commercial life by ensuring that meters are fed.

title: Key European Forecast on Growth and Inflation
description: KEY EUROPEAN FORECAST ON GROWTH AND INFLATION

title: Mayweather Unleashes Jabs and Punch Lines
description: LAS VEGAS  Already annoyed that the discourse after his latest victory had veered toward a controversy over his opponents gloves, Floyd Mayweather Jr. shot a stiff glare at a man who shouted at him during his postfight news conference Saturday night.

title: Inventing a Failure
description: Last week, House Republicans released a deliberately misleading report on the status of health reform, crudely rigging the numbers to sustain the illusion of failure in the face of unexpected success. Are you shocked?

title: First Openly Gay Episcopal Bishop, Whose Election Caused a Stir, to Divorce
description: Bishop V. Gene Robinson, who made history as the first openly gay bishop in the Episcopal Church, has announced that he and his husband are planning to divorce.

title: After Failed Peace Talks, Pushing to Label Israel as Occupier of Palestine
description: JERUSALEM  More than a year after Palestine was upgraded to become a nonmember observer state of the United Nations, the attributes of statehood exist mainly on official Palestinian letterhead.

title: An Ever-Curious Spirit, Unbeaten After 111 Years
description: So what is it like to be pronounced the oldest man on earth?

title: How Should E-Cigarettes Be Regulated?
Libya Leader Finally Picked but Is Quickly Challenged
description: TRIPOLI, Libya  After a long search, Libyas transitional Parliament appeared to have finally selected a new prime minister on Sunday, choosing Ahmed Maitiq, a businessman, during a chaotic legislative session.

title: South Africa President Appeals for Ex-Backers to Return to Fold
description: SOWETO, South Africa  Battling an array of defectors from the African National Congress during a long campaign, President Jacob Zuma, speaking at the partys final rally in a vast soccer stadium here on Sunday, urged former supporters to return to the A.N.C.

title: Seavers Double Duty for the White Sox
description: CHICAGO  It was right around midnight on the South Side last month, and the White Sox were in trouble. They were tied with Boston in the 14th inning at U.S. Cellular Field, with two Red Sox on base and a rattled pitcher on the mound.

title: Cooperation With G.O.P. Puts Senator in a Primary
description: ALBANY  G. Oliver Koppell has spent four decades in politics, serving in the State Assembly, on the New York City Council and as attorney general for a brief stint at the tail end of Gov. Mario M. Cuomos final term. Through it all, he has been a Democrat  and a liberal one at that  with Republicans as his usual adversaries.

title: Hearing Help in Theaters
description: Attorney General Eric T. Schneiderman of New York announced on Sunday that three theater organizations  the Manhattan Theater Club, the Atlantic Theater Company and the School of Visual Arts Theater  have agreed to provide listening devices, like headsets or hearing loops, to audience members with hearing loss. As part of the Americans With Disabilities Act, theater companies that use microphones or have amplified sound during performances are to grant equal access to those who are hard of hearing, but the attorney generals office received complaints from individuals and disability rights organizations that some Off Broadway theaters were not following those guidelines. An investigation by attorney generals Civil Rights Bureau found that the three theater companies were not providing listening devices, and the bureau is working with other theaters to ensure their compliance with the law.

title: No Regrets for the Founder of Tumblr After Yahoo Sale
description: When Yahoo bought Tumblr for $1.1 billion a year ago, it sent a ripple of excitement  and anxiety  through the tech industry. Would Yahoo and its recently arrived chief executive, Marissa Mayer, breathe new life into Tumblr? Or would Yahoo smother the start-up, as it did after acquiring popular young services like GeoCities and Flickr?

title: X Still Marks Sunken Spot, and Gold Awaits
description: The discovery of sunken gold conjures up visions of instant riches: Swiss bank accounts and lazy afternoons on faraway beaches, daiquiris in hand.

title: The Relief Rsum of a Star Starter
description: Tom Seaver, one of 24 major league pitchers to win 300 games, started 647 games and was a reliever in nine. Tom Glavine is the only 300-game winner who never pitched in relief; he started 682 times.

title: Kiev Struggles to Break Russias Grip on Gas Flow
description: CHASLOVTSY, Ukraine  As Ukraine tries to contain a pro-Russian insurgency convulsing its eastern region, a perhaps more significant struggle for the country hinges on what happens beneath the ground here in a placid woodland in the far west, on the border with Slovakia.

title: Are Pap Smears on the Way Out?
description: Women who want to be screened for cervical cancer have just received a new option  and a new quandary. The venerable Pap smear, which has been the only screening tool to look for cancer in asymptomatic women for many decades, now has a rival, a genetic test that looks for the viruses implicated in causing cervical cancer.

title: The Toll of No New Taxes
description: With the nations highway system frayed and running short of funds, the Obama administration has asked Congress to end the current ban on states charging tolls to pay for the upkeep of federal interstate highways. The proposal would reverse a proud policy dating to the systems creation in 1956, when the postwar automobile boom left government flush with fuel taxes and ever bigger highway plans.

title: Gee Stymies Colorado to Help Prevent a Four-Game Sweep
description: DENVER  The Mets finally shook the demons that had haunted them at Coors Field this weekend, getting a masterly pitching performance and enough offense for a 5-1 victory against the Colorado Rockies.

title: Policing, on the Safe Side
description: The New York Police Department has been doing more with less for over a decade, with a force that is down about 6,000 uniformed officers from a peak of 40,710 in 2001. During that time crime in the city has fallen to record lows, and New Yorkers real worries about their safety have been replaced by more hypothetical jitters  can the trend possibly continue, and do we have enough officers to make sure it does?

title: A Better Economy, Still Far From Good
description: The good news from last weeks economic reports is this: April was the best month for job growth in quite a while. Employers added 288,000 jobs, bringing the average for the last three months to a respectable 238,000.

title: At Derby Day With Murdoch, Rand Paul Goes Through His Paces
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  On the afternoon of the Kentucky Derby, Rand Paul, the states junior Republican senator and likely presidential candidate, spilled out of an elevator in the exclusive Jockey Club Suites of Churchill Downs with an entourage of women with flower-adorned hats, men in seersucker suits and Rupert Murdoch.

title: Ukraines Reins Weaken as Chaos Spreads
description: ODESSA, Ukraine  Russian-speaking regions of Ukraine spun further out of the central governments control on Sunday as a mob stormed a police station in this Black Sea port and freed from detention 67 pro-Russian militants, on the same day that Ukraines prime minister was visiting the city.

title: A Key Player in a Scandal, V. Stiviano Feeds the Medias Appetite
description: Words are sometimes no match for pictures. So when I suggest that V. Stiviano may understand and avail herself of the current American media culture better than anyone, it is worth taking a look at our subject, below.

title: For Luxury Magazine, an Unusual Exclusive
description: In the week and a half since TMZ published the now-infamous audio recording of Donald Sterling, the owner of the Los Angeles Clippers, he has been perhaps the most elusive interview in America. That is, until Thursday night when DuJour magazine  DuWhat?  ran a piece on its website with the headline, Donald Sterling Speaks Up. Mr. Sterling, referring to the woman who taped his racist meltdown, said, I wish I had just paid her off.

title: Conquering Personal Setbacks for Strong Finishes at Wells Fargo
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  The greens at Quail Hollow Club, remade after they became a pocked, blotchy mess last year, set the theme for the Wells Fargo Championship: They bounced back from the abyss to earn rave reviews. By nightfall Sunday, so had three competitors.

title: Eye-for-an-Eye Incivility
description: The botched Oklahoma execution of Clayton Lockett has called our continued use of the death penalty in this country back into question. In many ways, the death penalty is an abhorrent attempt to sate an irrational cultural bloodlust, rooted in vengeance and barbarism and detached from data.

title: New Ideas in Lighting Get Closer to Market
description: WOBURN, Mass.  Ever since government regulations began phasing out the traditional light bulb in 2012, the once-simple visit to the lighting aisle has become an exercise in navigating a dizzying array of choices and terminologies, especially for new kinds of compact fluorescents and LEDs.

title: For a Winning Owner at the Derby, Belief in an Unseen Hand
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  Forgive Steve Coburn his brash proclamations about California Chrome. He can sound like a silver-tongued showman when he guarantees victory for his colt. That irritated some backstretch hard boots here in the days before the Kentucky Derby on Saturday.

title: Heroins New Hometown
description: The obituaries have a certain sameness to them: full of praise and regret for lives cut short, marked by telltale details and omissions. The deaths occurred at home, or at a friends house elsewhere on Staten Island. The mourned were often young and white, and although how they died was never mentioned, nearly everyone knew or suspected the cause.

title: Nets Know How to Beat Heat: Unconventionally
description: If there has been one defining characteristic of the Nets since Brook Lopez went down for the season, it is flexibility. Coach Jason Kidd has done well to make the most of what he has, but this flexibility is possible only because of the Nets physical skill sets and intelligence. Not only do the Nets have players like Paul Pierce and Shaun Livingston, who can fulfill a variety of needs and defy traditional definitions of their positions, they have a team smart enough to adjust on the fly.

title: Advertisers Seek a Second Screen Connection With Viewers
description: In recent episodes of Game of Thrones, viewers have seen scenes of theft, rape, infanticide, cannibalism, beheading, crucifixion, castration, incest, murder and dismemberment.

title: Old Times There Are Not Forgotten
description: Some people are paralyzed by self-consciousness. The playwright Branden Jacobs-Jenkins is inspired, energized and perhaps even set free by it.

title: Fun Home and Here Lies Love Win Lortel Awards
description: The Public Theater was the big winner on Sunday night at the Lucille Lortel Awards honoring Off Broadway works, with three of its critically acclaimed productions dominating the major categories.

title: Documentary Channel Aims at an Underserved Audience
description: LOS ANGELES  A sobering thought for documentarians: In 2013, Iron Man 3 sold about as many theater tickets in one day as all of their documentaries did all year. Combined.

title: Prosper, a Peer-to-Peer Lender, Raises $70 Million
description: As peer-to-peer lending  in which borrowers connect with lenders directly online  takes off, one of the biggest players in the field is taking advantage by raising more money.

title: Birding and Selfies
description: Dear Diary:

title: A Foothold on Clay May Be Slipping
description: This is all Rafael Nadals fault, of course.

title: Slate Raising Its Investment in Podcasts
description: The digital magazine Slate will start two new podcasts in the next week: The Gist, with the former NPR reporter Mike Pesca, its first daily podcast intended to deliver news and opinion to afternoon drive-time listeners, and Money, hosted by the financial writer Felix Salmon.

title: Girl Is Killed in Brooklyn by Driver Fleeing Police
description: A 9-year-old girl died after the car she was riding in was struck by a minivan fleeing another accident in Brooklyn on Sunday evening, the police said.

title: Rush for Deals Before Top Art Goes to Auction
description: In many ways this years spring auctions, which begin on Tuesday, follow a familiar pattern: hefty catalogs, more and more art to sell, the promise of multimillion dollar prices for blue-chip names.

title: Treasury Auctions for the Week of May 5
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: News From the Advertising Industry
description: Accounts

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for May 4, 2014
Gary Becker, 83, Nobel Laureate, Dies; Applied Economics to Everyday Life
description: Gary S. Becker, a Nobel prize-winning economics professor and longtime columnist for Business Week whose research illuminated motivations about such aspects of everyday life as marriage, crime, addiction, racial discrimination and birthrates, died on Saturday in Chicago. He was 83.

title: James Oberstar, 79, Congressman Ousted in Tea Party Tide, Dies
description: James L. Oberstar, an iron miners son from Minnesota who spent 36 years in Congress before losing to a political newcomer aligned with the Tea Party in 2010, died on Saturday at his home in Potomac, Md. He was 79.

title: At Cable Convention, an Industry Tries to Face Up to Its Tarnished Reputation
description: LOS ANGELES  If any industry knows it has an image problem, it is the cable business. Just about every consumer has experienced the anxious wait for a technician who might or might not arrive during the dreaded four-hour window. Experiences like that, as well as service failures and rising rates, create a bad reputation that is hard to shake.

title: Greenlight Asked S.E.C. for Delay on Disclosure of Micron Stake
description: David Einhorn, the billionaire hedge fund manager whose stock picks are closely watched on Wall Street, is not a big fan of so-called copycat traders who simply latch onto his ideas  especially when it costs his investors money.

title: Former New York Police Officer Charged With Painting Anti-Semitic Graffiti
description: A former New York City police officer was arrested Sunday and charged with spray-painting anti-Semitic messages on more than a dozen cars and several buildings in Brooklyn.

title: Thoma Bravo Raises $3.65 Billion Fund for Buyouts
description: Thoma Bravo, a private equity firm focused on technology companies, is expected to announce on Monday that it has raised $3.65 billion for a new fund.

title: Tight Schedule Exacts Toll on Rangers as Penguins Tie Series
description: PITTSBURGH  The workload was not too heavy for Henrik Lundqvist, who, despite the Rangers grueling schedule, put on a vintage performance Sunday and kept his team in the contest.

title: State Energy Plan Would Alter New York Utilities
description: New York State is proposing to turn its electric utilities into a new kind of entity that would buy electricity from hundreds or thousands of small generators and set prices for that electricity and for the costs of running the power grid.

title: Popular Demand
description: Popular celebrities like Ellen DeGeneres, who was featured on the March 3 cover of People, special issues like Forbess Billionaires list, and coverage of major events like the Oscars on March 2, are part of what bring visitors to magazine websites.

title: Photo Replay: April 28-May4
description: Nothing held back: Throwing ones heart, soul and body on the line for a chance at victory.

title: Game of Thrones Recap: Flames in the Night Sky
description: Here be spoilers but no jugglers, no jousting dwarfs and no 77-course meals

title: Chinas Baosteel Leads $1.3 Billion Bid for Australian Miner
description: HONG KONG  Baosteel Group, one of Chinas biggest steel makers, is leading a $1.3 billion takeover bid for the Australian miner Aquila Resources as Chinese companies continue their global search for raw materials.

title: Witnesses on R.I. Circus Collapse
description: The Rhode Island public safety commissioner and witnesses described the scene at at a Ringling Brothers and Barnum & Bailey circus show in Providence after performers crashed to the ground.

title: Sleeping Beauty
description: One of the oldest restaurants in the world, Turins fabled but faded Del Cambio, has been revived and returned to its former glory, only this time with great food.

title: Hot New Thing
description: Londons best-kept decorating secret is Marthe Armitage, the octogenarian wallpaper designer whose nature-inspired patterns are sought after by the English style cognoscenti.

title: Hurt Before the Birth
description: It was long assumed that brain injuries in newborns resulted from insufficient oxygen during labor or delivery. Distressed parents often blamed doctors, a belief that spawned countless malpractice suits and prompted many obstetrician-gynecologists to abandon the delivery room.

title: Moviefone Will Add Broadcast and On-Demand TV Information
description: LOS ANGELES  Imagine you are home on the sofa or even on vacation with an iPad, and you suddenly feel like starting the third season of Breaking Bad. You figure it is probably available on some digital service. But how do you quickly sort through the Netflix-Amazon Prime-iTunes-Google Play-VOD-Hulu Plus thicket to find it?

title: Times Minute | Pistorius Trial Resumes
description: In the Video

title: Times Minute | Pistorius Trial Resumes
description: What to expect as the Oscar Pistorius murder trial resumes. Also on the Minute, Robin Hooders try to free a New Hampshire town and gadgets that know how you feel.

description: implausible\()im-plo-z-bl\ adjective

title: Celebrating a Day Early
Apps and Resources for Birders in New York City
description: This time of year, New York Citys green spaces become what are known as migrant traps for birds flying to their breeding grounds.

title: Whats On Monday
description: 8 P.M. (Fox) 24: LIVE ANOTHER DAY The superagent Jack Bauer (Kiefer Sutherland, above) is back, living in exile, and willing to risk life and liberty to avert another global disaster in this two-hour premiere, which picks up four years after the Season 8 finale. Mary Lynn Rajskub has returned as the computer savant Chloe; Kim Raver is Jacks old flame; and William Devane is her father, a former defense secretary who is now president. Benjamin Bratt and Yvonne Strahovski play F.B.I. agents hot on Jacks trail. The story line includes a chief of staff (Tate Donovan) concealing information from the president, who could be targeted for assassination, as well as international terrorists and cyberinsurgents  la Julian Assange. The show is more of the same that filled all the days that came before, and thats not always desirable, Alessandra Stanley wrote in The New York Times. Sometimes its better to start over completely or let a series end for real, for good.

title: Dog Owners Square Off Against Birders
description: In Brooklyns Prospect Park, dog owners and bird-watchers have rioted over how the park is used.

title: India Election Digest: May 5
description: What you need to know on Monday about Indias elections: Narendra Modi of the Bharatiya Janata Party is defying tradition by holding a rally in his rivals district, political analysts revise their forecasts in the B.J.P.s favor, and Varanasis riverbank communities have decided to exercise their none of the above option.

title: In Prospect Park, Dog Owners and Bird Watchers Fight for Space
description: About a dozen bird watchers had just crossed the ravine in Prospect Park one recent morning when a northern waterthrush, the first of the season, alighted on a faraway branch. Thirteen pairs of elbows and binoculars rose along with a ripple of delighted murmurs.

title: A Boldface Guest List for Bird Week
description: The Cornell Lab of Ornithology says these 15 species will most likely pass through New York City this week.

title: Corrections: May 5, 2014
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: 11 Missing After Cargo Ships Collide Near Hong Kong
description: HONG KONG  A Chinese cargo ship laden with cement sank near Hong Kong waters early Monday after colliding with a larger container ship registered in the Marshall Islands, leaving 11 people missing and setting off a frantic search for survivors, officials said.

title: China Sentences Accused Spy to 10-Year Prison Term
description: A man in the southern province of Guangdong who sent military documents and photos of military bases overseas has been sentenced to 10 years in prison on a spying conviction, state media has reported.

title: Nations Planning Next Phase of Jet Search
description: SYDNEY, Australia  With nothing tangible to show for nearly two months of searching for Flight 370, officials and experts from Malaysia, China, Australia and other countries plan to meet on Wednesday in Canberra, the Australian capital, to sort out what to do next, officials said Monday. The focus will be on intensively examining the floor of the Indian Ocean looking for debris.

title: In Tepid Wage Growth, a Potent Sign of a Still-Fragile Economy
description: The single best gauge of the economic recovery  better than the headline unemployment rate  may be wage growth.

title: Witnesses Tell of Pistoriuss Anguish After Shooting Girlfriend
description: In dramatic and sometimes tearful testimony, the first people to see the double-amputee track star Oscar Pistorius after he fired the four rounds that killed his girlfriend told his murder trial on Monday that he was torn with anguish as he carried her bleeding body, saying, according to one witness, stay with me, my love, stay with me.

title: Test Yourself | E.L.L. Practice, May 5, 2014
description: Mothers Day is May 11. Below, a student interactive quiz with teaching ideas for how to make it a language-learning opportunity.

title: Petition Seeks Closure of Extrajudicial Detention Centers
description: More than 100 lawyers, scholars, retired officials and Communist Party members have signed a letter calling for the abolition of custody and education, a form of punishment meted out by the Public Security Bureau that bypasses the legal system and can jail people for up to two years. The signatories say the two-decades-old system contravenes Chinas constitution and laws, violates citizens rights and is out of step with the states law-building spirit.

title: 6 Qs About the News | California Chrome Wins the Kentucky Derby
description: In Coming From Humble Beginnings, a Favorite Defies the Odds, Joe Drape reports on the Kentucky Derby, which was run on Saturday.

title: In the Moment, Connecting and Questioning
description: Jess Dugan does not shy away from the complicated, the messy or the incomplete.

title: Do You Set Rules for Yourself About How You Use Your Time?
description: In recent years, it became a common practice to release an entire season of a television show at once, meaning that viewers no longer have to wait a week for the next episode. And in December, Beyonc released 17 music videos simultaneously.

title: Europe Expects Its Economy to Grow 1.6% This Year
description: BRUSSELS  The European Commission said on Monday that growth across the European Union would gain significant momentum this year and continue through 2015, but it also warned of numerous threats that could still derail a slow, gradual recovery.

title: Behind the Story: Jesse Eisinger on Wall Street and the Erosion of Justice Department Power
description: Jesse Eisinger, a senior reporter at ProPublica, the independent nonprofit investigative organization, wrote this weeks article about the lone Wall Street executive who has gone to prison for playing a role in the 2008 financial crisis.

description: Good crisp Monday morning to you.

description: Welcome to the Morning Briefing on NYT Now. (Download us for iPhone.)

description: 1914: American Shopping Club
