title: Short on Resources, Aam Aadmi Party Volunteers Canvass for Votes on Foot
description: VARANASI, India  On Thursday morning, Rajesh Nagar, 45, a former employee of the Indian Navy, led a team of three students to campaign for Arvind Kejriwal, the leader of the Aam Aadmi Party. Mr. Kejriwal is opposing Narendra Modi, the prime minister candidate of the Bharatiya Janata Party, in a parliamentary race here that has captivated India.

title: Two New Projects at Storm King Beckon Art Lovers Upstate
description: Now that the frenzy of Frieze weekend has passed, art lovers may be feeling the impulse to ditch the crowds, flee the city and light out for the territory. Fortunately, New Yorks outlying regions offer abundant reasons to make the reverse cultural commute, and this spring, Storm King Art Center announces two new ones: the just-opened exhibition Zhang Huan: Evoking Tradition and a newly commissioned installation by the sculptor Virginia Overton.

title: A Changing Shape in Americas Age Distribution
description: Demographers have used the image of a triangle or pyramid to describe the worlds population: a large group of young people at the bottom, progressively fewer people in each succeeding generation, with a small number of very old people at the top.

title: An Electronic Double Bill to Shiver the Timbers
description: The electronic music double bill on Saturday night at the Brooklyn Masonic Temple was a superb clash of aesthetic extremes. The Red Bull Music Academy Festival paired the United States debut of the Haxan Cloak (the English musician Bobby Krlic) with the German musician Robert Henke and his laser project, Lumire. Mr. Henkes music and light show were crisp, bright, geometric and propulsive, a calibrated barrage. The Haxan Cloak performance was amorphous, ominous and immersive, a transcendent plunge into darkness and overwhelming pressure. Earplugs were available at the door.

title: Confronted on Execution, Texas Proudly Says It Kills Efficiently
description: HUNTSVILLE, Tex.  If Texas executes Robert James Campbell as planned on Tuesday, for raping and murdering a woman, it will be the nations first execution since Oklahomas bungled attempt at lethal injection two weeks ago left a convicted murderer writhing and moaning before he died.

title: Nigerian Girls Seen in Video From Militants
description: MAIDUGURI, Nigeria  The fears have been mounting for weeks: that the girls have been sold, married off, spirited across international borders, and perhaps even killed. Their fate has become the focus of intense international concern, with Michelle Obama holding up a placard appealing for their safe return and governments across the globe pledging to help track them down.

title: Orient Express, the Lifestyle Brand
description: Orient Express, the luxurious French train company made famous in the late 19th and early 20th centuries by passengers like the Mata Hari and, later, immortalized by novelists like Agatha Christie, is being revived, though not to offer rail service, at least not at first.

title: Orient Express, the Exhibition
description: The towering brunette beauty in shiny spike heels and her short, gray-haired companion waited in line at dusk in the French capital one recent Friday as tourists in jeans and hoodies stared in envy.

title: Ukraines Acting Leader on Referendum
description: Ukraines interim president, Oleksandr V. Turchynov, described the referendums held by separatists in the countrys restive east as propaganda meant to justify crimes.

title: Had Enough of Handels Messiah? Try Eric Idles
description: When the annual parade of Messiah performances winds through New Yorks concert halls in the weeks leading up to Christmas, even devoted Handelians who are fascinated by the many variant scorings and ways of presenting this great oratorio can get a bit fatigued. The Collegiate Chorales solution is to offer a parody, Not the Messiah (Hes a Very Naughty Boy), an oratorio based on Monty Pythons 1979 film, The Life of Brian. The oratorio has a text by Eric Idle and music by John Du Prez (who was one of the musical contributors to Spamalot). Mr. Idle will be among the performers in the Chorales shows, at Carnegie Hall on Dec. 15 and 16.

title: Suvir Sarans Mushroom and Farro Burger
description: When I was introduced to these burgers, a creation of the chef Suvir Saran, I was struck by the brilliant idea of using sweet potatoes as a binder. Ive struggled to find ways to hold my burgers together, and this solution was perfect. Try to find light-fleshed sweet potatoes; they are drier, and a little less sweet than orange yams. I also love all the textures in these hearty patties. I have made some changes to Suvirs recipe, roasting the potatoes rather than boiling them, and I use less oil.

title: Potato and Pea Patties With Indian Spices
description: This is another one of Suvir Sarans ideas, which I have adapted. The whole spices in this mix contribute not only amazing flavors, but texture as well. I used a combination of light-fleshed sweet potatoes and red boiling potatoes: I loved the sweetness of the sweet potatoes with the spices, but the mix needed something starchier to hold it together, so I added some red potatoes.

title: Mollie Katzen-Inspired Potato and Broccoli Burgers
description: The famed vegetarian cookbook author Mollie Katzen has a whole chapter devoted to burgers and savory pancakes in her beautiful new cookbook, The Heart of the Plate. Before Id looked carefully at the chapter Id bought a bunch of broccoli with the idea that specks of broccoli would be beautiful in a burger. Mollie, with her delicious Walnut-Coated Broccoli-Speckled Mashed Potato Cakes, was way ahead of me on that idea. I loved her idea of coating the burgers with ground walnuts and barely cooking the finely chopped broccoli before incorporating it into the mix. Ive made a variation on Mollies burgers, using red potatoes and sticking with the Indian seasonings Ive been using in other burgers this week.

title: Suvir Sarans Spinach and Potato Patties (Palak Ki Tiki)
description: These are adapted from Suvir Sarans potato patties called palak ki tiki, from his lovely cookbook Masala Farm. They are a striking green because of all of the raw spinach that gets packed into them. The big, spicy burgers are incredibly easy to put together and to cook. Suvir serves them with chutney, either green or tamarind, but we both agree that theyre delicious with plain old ketchup. I made a quick raita to serve with the burgers by stirring sweet pickle relish into plain yogurt.

title: Sweet Potato, Quinoa, Spinach and Red Lentil Burger
description: You can use blond or black quinoa for these delicate burgers. Black will look striking against the sweet potatos orange when you cut into the burgers. The red lentils pale to yellow when you cook them; they contribute texture and flavor. The burgers have a decidedly Mediterranean flavor, with feta and mint included in the mix. But I still like to serve them with raita or chutney; a more Mediterranean condiment would be yogurt seasoned with pured garlic and mint.

title: Today in Small Business: Why Entrepreneurship Is Like Breeding a Pig
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: Putting On the Ritz, Six Words at a Time
description: A chain of luxury hotels and resorts is borrowing from an Internet meme to extend a marketing effort that celebrates the accumulation of experiences and memories rather than the trappings of wealth.

title: UniCredit Swings to a Profit as Lending Recovers
description: UniCredit, Italys biggest bank and a bellwether of the economy, said on Monday that it returned to profit in the first quarter after its backlog of problem loans declined for the first time since the beginning of the financial crisis.

title: Tetsuya Miyamotos KenKen
description: This weeks challenges were suggested by the Japanese math teacher and puzzle creator, Tetsuya Miyamoto, inventor of the popular KenKen math and logic puzzle. KenKen (wisdom squared in Japanese) was developed by Mr. Miyamoto in 2004 as an example of his educational philosophy The Art of Teaching Without Teaching. I asked him about this philosophy and received this response by email:

title: Coffee (Helado Negro Remix) by Sylvan Esso
description: A remix of the title track from the electronic duos latest album.

title: Vacancies Pose Threat to the Fed
description: WASHINGTON  The Federal Reserve governor Jeremy C. Stein is chairman both of the internal committee that monitors financial markets for signs of trouble and of the committee that watches the way banks treat their customers.

title: What We Learned From Tim Geithners Book
description: Timothy Geithners new book, Stress Test, runs 580 pages and covers countless moments of crisis and fear during his time as New York Fed president and Treasury secretary. Read our colleague Andrew Ross Sorkins magazine article on Mr. Geithner and the book for more on the broad themes it recounts. But in the meantime, here are a few smaller chunks that we found particularly revelatory.

title: Indias Voters Expected to Give Modi a Mandate
description: NEW DELHI  Exit polls released Monday suggested that voters in Indias parliamentary election will deliver a mandate for the Bharatiya Janata Partys Narendra Modi, a Hindu nationalist who has promised to create manufacturing jobs and overhaul the countrys infrastructure.

title: Explosion Is Cited in Deadly Fire on Bus in China
description: HONG KONG  A fire aboard a bus in western China killed one person and injured 19 others on Monday, a municipal press office said, as the state news media reported that the fire was being investigated as possible arson and began with an explosion.

title: U.S. Asks Stiff Term for Ex-SAC Trader
description: Federal prosecutors did not show much leniency in asking a federal judge to sentence Michael Steinberg, a onetime top trader for Steven A. Cohens hedge fund, SAC Capital Advisors, to more than five years in prison for insider trading on stock tips.

title: Same-Sex Couples in Arkansas Rush to Wed as Court Ruling Provides an Opening
description: Gay couples in many Arkansas cities rushed to get married on Monday as the attorney general asked the states highest court to suspend a ruling striking down the states ban on same-sex marriage.

title: Behind the Cover Story: Andrew Ross Sorkin on Timothy Geithner, the Bailout and the Banks
description: Andrew Ross Sorkin, a financial columnist for The Times, a co-anchor of CNBCs Squawk Box and the author of Too Big to Fail, wrote this weeks cover story about what the former Treasury secretary Timothy Geithner really thought of the bailout.

title: Image of the Day: May 12
Potato Heads in the Senate
description: Several United States senators are suddenly professing a keen interest in the nutritional needs of low-income women who are pregnant, breastfeeding or raising children under the age of 5. What the women and children need, they have decreed, is more white potatoes.

title: Boko Haram Leader Offers Prisoner Swap
description: The leader of the Nigerian Islamist rebel group Boko Haram offered to release more than 200 schoolgirls abducted by his fighters last month in an exchange for prisoners.

title: Scientists Warn of Rising Oceans From Polar Melt
description: A large section of the mighty West Antarctica ice sheet has begun falling apart and its continued melting now appears to be unstoppable, two groups of scientists reported on Monday. If the findings hold up, they suggest that the melting could destabilize neighboring parts of the ice sheet and a rise in sea level of 10 feet or more may be unavoidable in coming centuries.

title: Times Minute | Tensions in the Tea Party
description: Also on the Minute, reaction to the Eastern Ukraines vote, and FOX hopes its new show Gotham will attract advertisers.

title: Times Minute | Tensions in the Tea Party
description: In the Video

title: Pay Dispute Threatens Some High-Cost Legal Cases in Britain
description: A ruling from a British court about the inability to find lawyers for a group of defendants charged with fraud calls into question whether the British authorities will be able to pursue complex white-collar crime prosecutions without paying more for lawyers to take such cases. The decision could end up shifting some cases to the United States, which does not face the same issues as Britain in paying for legal defense.

title: General Barlow and the Bloody Angle
description: After being mauled by the Army of Northern Virginia in the Battle of the Wilderness, which took place in the dense central Virginia woods from May 5 to 7, 1864, Maj. Gen. Ulysses S. Grant pushed his troops southeast toward the small hamlet of Spotsylvania Court House, intending to get between the Confederates and their capital. But Robert E. Lees men won the race to the village, thwarting Grants designs and setting the stage for the Battle of Spotsylvania, which would rage for 12 days, one of the longest and bloodiest engagements of the war.

title: When Kids Would Rather Play Computer Games Than Code Them
description: Coding is trending. In schools. Twenty thousand teachers from kindergarten through 12th grade have introduced coding lessons, according to Code.org, a group backed by the tech industry that offers free curriculums. Thirty school districts, including New York City and Chicago, have agreed to add coding classes in the fall, mainly in high schools but in lower grades, too. At home, parents are downloading programs that promise to teach children coding basics, and toys that can be coded in various ways are lining up for the next holiday season.

title: Listen Up | Sylvan Essos Quirky, Caffeinated Synth-Pop
description: Is it the kind of coffee that makes you feel like a crazy person? asks Amelia Meath, one half of the Durham, N.C.-based electronic duo Sylvan Esso. The inquiry is directed toward a server at Caf Stella, a Silver Lake bistro popular with the indie set (members of the bands Warpaint and the Afghan Whigs have also been known to dine there). I have a problem with certain coffees, Meath clarifies. One sip and I know its going to turn me into a terrible person.

title: A Slow-Tech Approach to Tracking Spending
description: Ten years ago, I tracked every penny of our familys spending. Thats good, right? Over time, however, I lost sight of why I was doing it and eventually stopped. Recently, I decided to try it again, and I find myself having the same mental conversation every time I sit down with my receipts.

title: Monday Motorsports: Another Mercedes 1-2 Finish in Formula One
description: Lewis Hamilton and Nico Rosberg, teammates on the Mercedes-Benz Formula One team, finished one-two, a second apart, in the Spanish Grand Prix on Sunday, continuing Mercedess distinct superiority so far this season. Daniel Ricciardo, in the Red Bull Infiniti, came in a distant third, followed by Sebastian Vettel, his teammate and the defending series champion.

title: Can Andreessens View Justify $3.2 Billion for Beats?
description: Attachment therapy is controversial in the field of mental health. Its far from indisputable in the technology world, too. Venture capitalist Marc Andreessen justifies some high price tags in technology deals, in part, with the idea that huge companies are able to attach the products of smaller ones, making them worth far more than traditional analysis would suggest.

title: China and Vietnam at Impasse Over Rig in South China Sea
description: HONG KONG  China and Vietnam appear to have reached at least a temporary impasse over a giant drilling rig sent by a state-controlled Chinese oil company to a site in the South China Sea between the Vietnamese coastline and a cluster of disputed islands, as the confrontation has continued to raise thorny issues of international law.

title: Weekly News Quiz | May 6-12, 2014
description: Climate change, the N.F.L. draft, an entertainment trend and more: How many of the topics in this weeks news quiz have you been following?

title: Weekend Gun Report: May 9-11, 2014
description: Last March, when Facebook promised to crack down on gun advertising by deleting posts from people looking to buy or sell guns without background checks, it was heralded as a victory by some gun-control groups. Others, however, hoped for the outright ban of gun ads,  la Craigslist and eBay. Instead, the social network said it would hide posts peddling guns from minors and remind users to follow local gun laws.

title: Republican Moderates and the Minimum Wage
description: One of my first columns for the Times was a non-requiem for Arlen Specters career as a moderate Republican, in which I argued that the G.O.P. desperately needed a better sort of centrist than the Specter-esque, socially liberal, fiscally conservative northeasterners to whom the label has usually been applied. One theme in that piece, which has run through my commentary on the Republican Party ever since, is that a moderate wing of the G.O.P. that just imitates the Democrats on a few issues where the liberal line is popular isnt necessarily doing either its party or the country any great favors. To be truly constructive in their moderation, the G.O.P.s centrists should be advancing alternatives to popular liberal ideas trying to create a different center of political gravity, in effect, rather than just looking for ways to take some losing issues off the table.

title: Saving Your Favorite Videos on YouTube
description: Q. My YouTube mobile app has a nice + button for adding a video to my playlist of favorites, but I dont see a similar button on the desktop browser version of YouTube. How do you do it from the computer?

title: Recent Polls Bring Better News for McConnell
description: No victory would be sweeter for Democrats than one in Kentucky, where polls show Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell locked in a tight race against Alison Lundergan Grimes.

title: Lawson Software Founders Settle Insider-Trading Charges
description: Three founders of a Minnesota-based software firm have agreed to pay nearly $6 million to settle charges that they took advantage of inaccurate news reports to trade stock ahead of their firms acquisition in 2011.

title: Learning How to Hire a Management Team in China
description: After founding and operating several companies over the last 18 years, Im confident of one thing: The success of any business depends on the quality of its management team.

title: Vietnam and China Dispute Continues
description: Tensions rose in the South China Sea in the dispute between Vietnam and China over maritime rights as each country accused the other of escalating the situation.

title: What Is Organic? You May be Surprised
description: Heres an interesting A.S.P.C.A. poll demonstrating the differences between what people believe organic to mean and what the actual regulations require.

title: An Added Burden
description: Raquel Reichard, 23, reads an excerpt from her story about how the fear of street harassment keeps her struggling to overcome an eating disorder she has long fought.

title: Taliban Wage Deadly Attacks in 3 Afghan Provinces
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  On the first day of their spring offensive, the Taliban mounted attacks in three provinces that killed at least 11 people on Monday. In a fourth province, the families of two would-be suicide bombers turned them in to the police, helping to forestall what would have probably been another attack.

title: Being Bullied Is Bad for Your Health
description: Victims of bullying may develop long-term physical and mental health problems, and now researchers have found one possible reason: Being bullied raises the bloods level of C-reactive protein, or CRP, a marker of systemic inflammation and a risk factor for cardiovascular and other diseases.

title: When Fear of Harassment Curbs Recovery From an Eating Disorder
description: Raquel Reichard, 23, was one of many City Room readers who responded to our call for stories of street harassment earlier this year.

title: Clean Living in a Dirty Birdbath
description: Q: WHY DONT BIRDS GET INFECTED WHEN DRINKING FECES-CONTAMINATED WATER IN BIRDBATHS?

title: Indian Court Says Forced Marital Sex Is Not Rape
description: NEW DELHI  A Delhi court has ruled that sex between a husband and wife, even if forcible, is not rape.

title: Radio Signals Skew Birds Internal Navigation
description: Migrating birds may lose their way when exposed to the electromagnetic noise from radio signals and electronic devices, researchers have found.

title: New Neurons Found to Overwrite Old Memories
description: The inability of adults to recall experiences from early childhood may be linked to the creation of new neurons in the brain.

title: Moving Against Heart Disease
description: In women over 30, physical inactivity may be the greatest single contributor to heart disease risk.

title: Science Best Sellers
description: 1 QUIET by Susan Cain. Crown. Introverts  one-third of the population  are undervalued in American society. (3)

title: Marco Rubio Disqualifies Himself
description: If American presidents need to prove a basic ability to accept facts, then Senator Marco Rubio of Floridawhos publicly mulling a run  just disqualified himself from competition.

title: Second U.S. Case of MERS Virus Is Confirmed
description: A second case of MERS, the Middle East respiratory virus circulating on the Arabian peninsula, has been found in the United States, federal and state health officials said Monday.

title: Co-Owner of the Mets Is Said to Be Interested in Selling
description: Saul B. Katz, who owns a majority share of the Mets in a partnership with his brother-in-law and business partner, Fred Wilpon, has expressed a desire to sell his portion of the team because he has grown tired of spending millions to prop it up, according to several people in baseball who have been briefed on the matter.

title: Pensions vs. Art in Detroits Bankruptcy
description: The objection deadline has arrived for Detroits reorganization plan. And it seems likely that the art deal will be the focus of many objections, especially from bondholders.

title: Hope for an S-Shaped Back
description: I wore a hard plastic brace around my torso from ages 8 to 16 to treat scoliosis, or spinal curvature. Bracing has been standard treatment in children for the past five decades, and I wore my brace diligently, if awkwardly, in the hope that it would contain my S-shaped curvature and stave off the need for spinal fusion surgery.

title: Miles Davis Way to Be Unveiled
description: Before he left office, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg signed a bill naming a block of West 77th Street in honor of the jazz trumpeter and composer Miles Davis. The block, between West End Avenue and Riverside Drive, will be called Miles Davis Way. Mr. Davis, who died in 1991, had an apartment in a brownstone at 312 West 77th Street, and lived there for about 25 years, until the mid-1980s. Now the new street sign is ready, and will have a public unveiling on May 26, the 88th anniversary of Daviss birth, at noon. Two of Daviss children, Cheryl Davis and Erin Davis, as well as Vince Wilburn, Jr., his nephew, will be on hand for the ceremony, which will include a block party sponsored by the Far West 77th Street Block Association.

title: Exercising the Mind to Treat Attention Deficits
description: Which will it be  the berries or the chocolate dessert? Homework or the Xbox? Finish that memo, or roam Facebook?

title: A Flurry of Bookings to Norway
description: Whether because of Disneys animated Oscar-winner Frozen or interest in climatologically threatened polar bears, travel to Norway has increased this year.

title: Countdown to 2014 World Cup in Brazil
description: The 2014 World Cup begins on June 12, when Brazil plays Croatia in the opening match. Reporters and editors for The Times will count down to the start of the tournament each day with a short capsule of news and interesting tidbits.

title: West Antarctic Glacier Ice Flows
description: A NASA animation shows glacier changes detected in the highly dynamic Amundsen Embayment of West Antarctica.

title: Not Just Flowers, but How They Got There
description: Residential gardens created by landscape architects and designers can possess an ineffable sense of magic, until the tricks behind their creation are revealed. A few professionals are offering to share their secrets through Garden Dialogues, a national series of garden tours hosted by the Cultural Landscape Foundation. Running now through Oct. 5, each Garden Dialogues event invites a small group to visit a remarkable garden (a few tours include multiple sites), where the houses landscape designer along with the owner (and in some cases, its architect) describe how they created the environment.

title: Elevating Ordinary to an Art Form
description: Decorating blogs swoon over Hugo Guinnesss graphic black-and-white depictions of ordinary objects. Anna Wintour collects his work. Kate Spade hung his prints of spriggy flowers in her Fifth Avenue boutique. Wes Anderson, a friend of the artist, used Mr. Guinnesss rendition of mens briefs on the set of The Royal Tenenbaums to help establish the films quirky mood.

title: Pulling Big Brothers Strings Instead
description: The Processional Arts Workshop created a Procession of Confession to draw attention to government surveillance.

title: Theyve Deleted Their Spacebook Profiles
description: Why dont you join the 21st century? Annette Rapoports friends used to grump at her. They would send around Evites to parties, but they would have to mail Ms. Rapoport a paper invitation. She didnt know how to use a computer.

title: Q. and A. | Sterling Ruby on Making It in L.A., His New Show in New York and the Power of the Art Market
description: Numerous New York galleries and museums synced their best shows to Frieze weekend, including Hauser & Wirth, which opened a much-anticipated new exhibition by the Los Angeles polymath Sterling Ruby at its newly renovated West 19th Street space last Friday. Its Rubys first solo show in Chelsea since he parked two menacing, rectilinear forms (a bus and a big brick of human-size cages) inside the Pace Gallery four years ago. This new show, entitled Sunrise, Sunset, presents a dense cross-section of recent works the prolific and controversial artist has produced in his fabled studio-cum-industrial-complex on the outskirts of Downtown L.A.  where only weeks ago, a Mack truck veered off the road and through the wall of the building, destroying a number of mammoth spray paintings and Rubys studio managers car (fortunately, no one was injured). Though the accident was a setback, the grandiose, unexpected destruction of the incident aligned well with Rubys expansive practice. The exhibition is full of charged objects, including Corinthian columns dripping with lustrous red polyurethane, a super-size canary-yellow electric chair, infernal stoves and bleached fabrics that evoke everything from Rorschach tests to the American flag. Here, the artist reflects on his intentions for the show and his place in the art world.

title: A Charitys Video Shows Models Duped for a Cause
description: Is it fair to trick a model into trying to say diarrhea in her sexiest voice?

title: Tenures Becoming Shorter at a Short-Handed Fed
description: There are now just four Federal Reserve Board governors, and at the end of the month there may be three, for the first time in the Feds history.

title: For Some in Europe, High Lending Rates Hamper Recovery
description: PARIS  Lcio Machados small business in northern Portugal is finally starting to bustle again after his countrys recession. He hoped to expand his 12-employee business, which repairs autos and creates custom mechanical equipment for trucks and tractors, with a loan.

title: A Very High-Flying Scotsman
description: When Virgin Galactics first commercial flight accelerates to space carrying Richard Branson, the billionaire owner of the company, and his family, David Mackay is likely to be at the controls.

title: Food Curated: El Olomega Food Truck
description: Take a look at the lightning-quick creation of pupusas, a traditional Salvadoran street food, out of Janet and Marcos Lainezs food truck in Red Hook.

title: Vantiv to Buy Payment Systems Company for $1.65 Billion
description: Vantiv, a payment processor, said Monday that it had reached a deal to buy Mercury Payment Systems for about $1.65 billion, adding a specialist in point-of-sale payment systems.

title: Video: El Olomega Food Truck
description: Liza de Guia is a video journalist whose blog, Food. Curated., profiles people who produce interesting food in New York and beyond.

title: New York Police to Limit Seizing of Condoms in Prostitution Cases
description: The New York Police Department will significantly limit the practice of seizing condoms for use as evidence in prostitution-related cases, ending a procedure that health officials had long criticized as undermining their efforts to protect prostitutes from disease.

title: Statins and Women, Birth Defects and Polio Abroad
description: RESEARCH

title: When Taking a Stand Can Mean Taking a Hit
description: Canceling an event at a hotel can be an effective way for a group to raise awareness about a contentious issue, as the recent boycott of the Beverly Hills Hotel showed after the decision by Brunei, whose sovereign wealth fund owns the hotel, to impose a harsh form of Islamic law in the country.

title: Tony Nominations Continue to Boost Gentlemans Guide
description: More audience members have been willing to pay full price for A Gentlemans Guide to Love & Murder in the two weeks since the show received 10 Tony Award nominations, the most of any on Broadway this season. According to box office data released on Monday, Gentlemans Guide  a tongue-in-cheek operetta about a British man bumping off his rich relatives  had an average paid admission of $93.91 last week, compared to $82.56 for the week in late April immediately preceding the Tony nominations.

title: Reading Landai in New York
description: Today, Eliza Griswold reads at the Culture Project in New York from I Am the Beggar of the World, a book of landai by Afghan women. Griswolds translations of the landai  two-line folk poems typically about love and grief  are accompanied by photographs by Seamus Murphy, with whom she traveled to Afghanistan in 2012, a trip that also led to an article for the magazine in April of that year. Griswold wrote about young Afghan women for whom writing landai served as a vital, and in some cases sole, link to a wider world. These young women were often confined to their fathers homes in the rural villages where they lived; they would sneak calls to a Kabul-based poetry hotline to read their poems and exchange ideas with other Afghan women  parliamentarians, doctors, professors  whose lives they could only imagine. One young woman, Zarmina, stood out. Her poems were distinctive in their language but also in their fearless questioning of Gods will. Zarmina called as frequently as she could, but she lived in fear of being discovered. One day, as Griswold wrote, she was:

title: Im a Cellist, Not a Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtle
description: IVE been traveling most of my adult life. Im co-artistic director of the Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center, and Im one of those musicians who actually like to travel. Ive hardly ever done any dedicated tourism. In fact, Ive never been to countries in which I didnt have a concert, so Ive never seen Egypt or Tibet, two places I really want to visit.

title: Air Travel Economics Make Midsize Hubs Unprofitable
description: WE are committed to Cleveland, the chief executive of United Airlines, Jeff Smisek, told a group of business leaders there in 2010, shortly after United acquired Continental Airlines in a merger.

title: Pictures of the Day: Ukraine and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Ukraine, Syria, Afghanistan and India.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Welcome to NYT Now, the new app from The New York Times. (Download us for iPhone.)

title: Looks Like Rain Again. And Again.
description: The acid test of a scientific theory is whether it makes predictions that eventually come true. So consider this old prediction, from a pair of researchers in Australia and New Zealand. They were summarizing the results of then-primitive computerized forecasts about global warming:

title: Video: Puppets Casting an Eye on Big Brother
description: Processional Arts Workshop, best known for its large-scale puppets that lead the Greenwich Village Halloween parade, lately has turned its attention to a more sociopolitically charged matter: the state of surveillance in the 21st century.

title: In Performance | Gil Shaham
description: The violinist performs the Gigue from Bachs Partita No. 3.

title: Searching for Other Earths, Spiders With Personality
description: Geoff Marcy is an exoplanet hunter who looks at the billions of planets we now understand to be circling other stars and sees a near cosmic guarantee of intelligent life. Spiders in the Kalahari desert develop personalities that are affected by their spider peers, just like teenagers.

title: Podcast: Searching for Other Earths
description: Geoff Marcy is an exoplanet hunter who looks at the billions of planets we now understand to be circling other stars and sees a near cosmic guarantee of intelligent life.

title: Profiles in Science | The Planet Hunter
description: Geoffrey Marcy of the University of California, Berkeley, has discovered scores of alien worlds, so-called exoplanets circling distant stars.

title: Finder of New Worlds
description: BERKELEY, CALIF.  Last summer a homely room in the basement of a math building on the University of California campus here was ground zero in the epic quest to end cosmic loneliness.

title: Red Velvet Cake: A Classic, Not a Gimmick
description: In the pantheon of food-related shark jumps, red velvet cake body mist may well be the greatest leap of all.

title: Deciphering Harsh Poetry in Modernist Works
description: According to the pianist Peter Serkin, programs show integrity when there is no attempt to win anyone over at all, assuming instead that audiences want to hear interesting music. How can one possibly determine what is easy or difficult to listen to for someone else? Mr. Serkin said in an interview posted on the 92nd Street Ys website. Is Beethoven really easier to listen to than Wolpe or Wuorinen?

title: Pine Island Glacier
description: This airborne tour was created from a small portion of the images collected during a flight over the Pine Island Glacier crack on Oct. 26, 2011.

title: Snowdens Story, Behind the Scenes
description: The title of the journalist Glenn Greenwalds impassioned new book, No Place to Hide, comes from a chilling observation made in 1975 by Senator Frank Church, then chairman of a select committee on intelligence. The United States government, he said, had perfected a technological capability that enables us to monitor the messages that go through the air. That capability, he added, could at any time be turned around on the American people, and no American would have any privacy left, such is the capability to monitor everything: telephone conversations, telegrams, it doesnt matter. There would be no place to hide.

title: Recipes as a Guide, Not a Command
description: Many ethnic cuisines viewed through an American lens amount to CliffsNotes: crowd-pleasing highlights, clichs even, that never meander down back roads. With few exceptions, Greek food in restaurants and cookbooks is like that. What? No spanakopita? No pastitsio? No moussaka?

title: When Marine Mammals Are Drafted
description: To the Editor:

title: Amid Tensions, a New Portrayal of Anne Frank
description: AMSTERDAM  Over the decades, the story of Anne Frank has been interpreted onstage in varying ways, including a version that some critics describe as too simplistic. Now a new play, simply titled Anne, that opened here last week presents a complex portrayal of a teenage girl: sometimes impetuous, spoiled and lonely.

title: Look Ma, Im a Star (Photographer)
description: Ron Galella, the ultimate New York City paparazzo, enjoys a second act and a measure of respect (or, at least, acceptance).

description: Updated, 8:38 p.m. | AT&T is in talks to buy DirecTV for at least $50 billion, and the two sides are actively working toward an announcement, according to several people with knowledge of the matter.

title: Consider Clashing Scientific and Societal Meanings of Collapse When Reading Antarctic Ice News
description: Updated, May 14, 11:46 a.m. | For decades, the inevitability of many feet, even yards, of sea-level rise in a warming climate has been crystal clear. But societys response, both in stemming heat-trapping greenhouse gas emissions and adapting to eroding coastlines, will always be more a function of the rate of change than the ultimate outcome.

description: To the Editor:

title: To Please, to Perplex and to Be Barely Noticed on a Dash Through Queens
description: My assignment, as I chose to accept it, was to review a performance called Topologie at the Chocolate Factory Theater in Queens. In the theaters lobby on Thursday afternoon, I found a map of the area with a geometrically elaborate route outlined in red. Soon, Inkyung Lee walked in, traced her finger along the map and left. I followed her out onto the misty street. She ran. I took up the chase.

title: Seen on the Street | Frieze New York 2014
description: What does art fair style look like? Find out in the Frieze Week photo diary of Helga Traxler.

title: Just One More Way the Stars Live Better Than We Do
description: Riot, a new spring space filler on Fox, must be condemned on philosophical grounds. But it sure does have funny moments.

title: How N.S.A. Recalibrated Its Mission
description: Part 1 of United States of Secrets, Tuesday night on PBSs Frontline, is a fine ticktock account of how we arrived at our current information collection quandary, and what makes it so says a lot about this still-evolving issue.

title: An Immersion in Dvorak, With Operatic Fervor
description: First, full disclosure. I must admit that after attending several adventurous concerts of the fourth, and final, Spring for Music festival at Carnegie Hall, which ended on Saturday night with an engrossing performance by the Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra, I was not exactly eager to hear James Levine conduct the Met Orchestra at Carnegie on Sunday afternoon in a Dvorak program.

title: New York Police Aviation Rescue
description: On Sunday, the New York Police Departments aviation unit rescued a female hiker who had broken her ankle high on a steep rock trail just north of Alpine, N.J., in Palisades Interstate Park.

title: Study Finds Being Ignored on Facebook May Lower Self-Esteem
description: Social media promises to make people feel better about their lives and promotes the ability to connect with others and share wonderful moments.

title: R.B.S. Makes First Move to Spin off Citizens
description: The Royal Bank of Scotland has made the first move to spin off its United States banking operation, Citizens.

title: Amid Pipeline and Climate Debate, Energy-Efficiency Bill Is Derailed
description: WASHINGTON  A bipartisan bill to encourage energy efficiency in buildings died in the Senate on Monday, derailed by the contentious debate over the Keystone XL pipeline and President Obamas plans to issue new climate change regulations.

title: Telling Off the C.E.O., Once a Year
description: As she has done every year since the financial crisis, Judy Koenick traveled from her home in Maryland to Bank of Americas annual shareholder meeting in Charlotte, N.C., last week, a drive of more than six hours.

title: Christie Vetoes Bill to Improve Storm Recovery Effort; Big Mistake, Top Senator Says
description: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey vetoed a bill on Monday that lawmakers had unanimously passed to improve the states management of Hurricane Sandy recovery.

title: After Protests, I.M.F. Chief Withdraws as Smith Colleges Commencement Speaker
description: A week before she was to speak at the Smith College commencement, Christine Lagarde, chief of the International Monetary Fund, has withdrawn from the event, citing protests against her and the fund, the college said Monday.

title: More Insured, but the Choices Are Narrowing
description: In the midst of all the turmoil in health care these days, one thing is becoming clear: No matter what kind of health plan consumers choose, they will find fewer doctors and hospitals in their network  or pay much more for the privilege of going to any provider they want.

title: Courtroom Sketch Artist
description: I was introduced to the work of Gary Myrick, the subject of this Op-Doc video, when I ran across an article in Texas Monthly magazine that spotlighted his career as a courtroom sketch artist. He was once the go-to artist for television news station  millions regularly viewed his work on the networks. I was intrigued and wrote him immediately, asking if he would consider being filmed for a documentary. He said hed be glad to help anyone nurture his creativity.

title: Courtroom Sketch Artist
description: This short documentary captures the rise and fall of a courtroom sketch artist in Texas.

title: Read, Kids, Read
description: As an uncle Im inconsistent about too many things.

title: Rocky Road for Canadian Oil
description: CALGARY, Alberta  With TransCanadas Keystone XL pipeline snarled in a regulatory and legal struggle south of the border, Canadian oil companies are proposing many new and expanded pipelines that would connect the oil sands fields with new markets in China and across the world.

title: After Forming Deep Roots in U.S., Man Discovers He Isnt a Citizen
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla.  After living nearly a half century in the United States  marrying and raising a family here, paying taxes and working for decades for the federal government  Mario Hernandez made a discovery recently that rattled him to his core: He is not an American citizen. In fact, he is not even a United States resident.

title: Fox and NBC Strut New Shows to Marketers
description: NBC and Fox opened the television upfront week for the 2014-15 season with presentations on Monday that were long on new series, long on new strategies, and just long in general.

title: The Joys of Trimming
description: My favorite part of writing is taking stuff out. In writing, you must kill all your darlings, William Faulkner famously wrote, suggesting that the process of self-editing requires stoicism and the suppression of a natural affection. Samuel Johnson said something similar: Read over your compositions and, wherever you meet with a passage which you think is particularly fine, strike it out.

title: For a Nonesuch Celebration at BAM, Reich and Glass Bury the Hatchet
description: Nonesuch Records used to be a budget classical label that mostly licensed recordings from Europe and released them at prices that made them beloved among cost-conscious college students. But even then Nonesuch was a little quirky: it also had a world music series, long before world music was hot (or even called world music).

title: Mapping Basketball Nation
description: Find the most popular N.B.A. team in every ZIP code, based on Facebook data.

title: Which Team Do You Cheer For? An N.B.A. Fan Map
description: Highlights from a map of N.B.A. fandom based on Facebook likes.

title: Qaeda Affiliate Steps Up Video Propaganda Push
description: MUKALLA, Yemen  The large microphone with the fancy logo might have belonged to any television news crew, but these man-on-the-street interviews sounded more like militant lectures.

title: Reopening of the Washington Monument
description: The Washington Monument reopened to the public on Monday, after an earthquake in August 2011 damaged the 130-year-old stone obelisk.

title: Met Orchestra Authorizes Strike Vote if Talks Fail
description: This weekend the musicians in the Metropolitan Opera orchestra wore buttons during performances to call attention to the fact that the opera house is seeking concessions from them in contract talks.

title: Kerry to Meet Palestinian Leader in First Exchange Since Peace Talks
description: WASHINGTON  Secretary of State John Kerry plans to meet in London on Thursday with Mahmoud Abbas, the president of the Palestinian Authority, the State Department announced Monday.

title: Computing in the Classroom
Whos on Third? In Baseballs Shifting Defenses, Maybe Nobody
description: For more than 100 years, baseball looked pretty much the same from the grandstands. There were three players spread in the outfield, a pitcher on the mound, a catcher behind the plate, and four infielders neatly aligned, two on each side of second base.

title: A Deal to Dodge the Tax Man in America
description: Pfizers chairman and chief executive, Ian C. Read, is in London this week trying to sell a skeptical public there on his $106 billion takeover plan for rival AstraZeneca. On Tuesday, he is scheduled to testify to a parliamentary committee about a deal that has been described in the British tabloids as too dangerous and has raised a bevy of nervous questions about potential job losses.

title: The Problem With Confidence
description: The current issue of The Atlantic carries a fascinating summary of The Confidence Code by Katty Kay and Claire Shipman. The essay runs through the evidence suggesting that women tend to have too little self-confidence. When asked how well they did on tests, women tend to estimate that they got fewer answers correct than they actually did. In one British study, a business school professor asked students how much they would deserve to earn five years after graduation. The womens estimates were 20 percent lower than the mens.

title: Healed, Landmark Again Beckons: Come On Up. The View Is Terrific.
description: WASHINGTON  Nearly 670 feet of cracks are sealed, and loose stones are once again fixed in place at the 130-year-old Washington Monument, which defines the capital skyline. The panoramic views, from about 500 feet above the landscape, are back.

title: Seeing Future in Fuel Cells, Toyota Ends Tesla Deal
description: Toyota said on Monday that it would allow a battery-supply deal with Tesla Motors to expire this year and would focus instead on building cars running on hydrogen fuel cells, a next-generation technology that rivals Teslas all-electric systems.

title: Detroit Tries to Sell Itself, One House at a Time
description: Having watched for decades as residents of Detroit moved away and neighborhoods emptied, officials in this bankrupt city are trying their own antidote: recruiting new residents themselves, one house at a time, with an online auction of abandoned properties.

title: Detroit Pension Ballot Poses Tough Choices
description: Detroit dropped tens of thousands of ballots in the mail on Monday, initiating a crucial stage in the citys bankruptcy case that allows retirees, employees and bondholders to cast votes on a painful debt-shedding plan.

title: Science vs. Taxes
description: In the United States, most of the controversy over Pfizers $101 billion bid for AstraZeneca has been about the potential tax consequences. Last year, Pfizer paid an effective tax rate of about 27 percent. But if it were to succeed in taking over its British rival  and so far, at least, AstraZeneca has shown zero interest in the idea  it would be able to conduct a maneuver called inversion, becoming a British company and paying the British corporate tax rate of 20 percent. It would also be able to access cash that resides overseas, which would be taxed at the American rate of 35 percent if it were repatriated into this country.

title: A New Fire Commissioner
description: In more than three decades as a firefighter, New York Citys new fire commissioner has had a close-up view of the entrenched racial discrimination that led the Justice Department to sue the city, resulting in a court ordering sweeping changes in the departments hiring policies.

title: William Coughlin, 91, Editor, Dies; His Newspaper Exposed Fouled Water
description: William J. Coughlin, who after a career as a globe-trotting correspondent landed in a small North Carolina town where he led the local newspapers Pulitzer Prize-winning exposure of carcinogens in municipal drinking water, died on Thursday in Bolivia, N.C. He was 91.

title: Smarter Electricity in New York
description: In one of the most promising moves in the energy sector in years, New York State is proposing a way to get a head start on, and perhaps help lead, a revolution in the world of electricity generation. Starting this week, the main players in the states complex electricity business will be asked to comment on a new report from the states Public Service Commission that envisions more efficient and climate-friendly ways to produce electricity.

title: Clippers Co-Owner: I Didnt Do Anything Wrong
description: As co-owner of the Los Angeles Clippers for the past 33 years, Rochelle Sterling has been a largely silent partner. But now, as the N.B.A. pushes for the permanent removal of her husband, she does not want to go away quietly.

title: What Mr. Putin Cant Control
description: If there were questions about the legitimacy of the separatist referendums in eastern Ukraine, the farcical names of the entities on which people were asked to vote  the self-declared Peoples Republics of Donetsk or Luhansk  surely answered them. But the gathering rumble of violence accompanying the votes is serious and is driving the Ukrainian crisis in a direction that before long no one  not President Vladimir Putin of Russia, not authorities in Kiev, not the West  will be able to control.

title: $350 Million Investment Needed to Open Casino Closest to New York City, Panel Says
description: ALBANY  A state gambling panel declared on Monday that business interests seeking to build a casino in Orange County, just an hour from New York City, would be required to invest a minimum of $350 million in capital. Casino industry experts say it is a surprisingly low buy-in for what could be a billion-dollar franchise, and one that could cause serious problems for casino proponents in the Catskills to the north.

title: Interim C.E.O. of Clippers Sets Out Striving for Stability
description: LOS ANGELES  Richard Parsons stepped up to a lectern Monday as the new, though interim, face of the Los Angeles Clippers, and for 25 minutes, he tried to provide a credible presence at the top of the organization.

title: A Rescue That Worked, but Left a Troubled Economy
description: The mortgage market was starting to come apart on Aug. 16, 2007, when Federal Reserve policy makers gathered for an emergency videoconference. The worst of the financial crisis was more than a year away, but big problems were emerging.

title: U.S. Military Deaths in Afghanistan
description: The Department of Defense has identified 2,305 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations. It confirmed the deaths of the following Americans recently:

title: As Newark Fights Many Woes, Mayoral Candidates Take Jabs at Each Other
description: NEWARK  The mayoral candidate Ras Baraka, a burly man with a two-day growth of gray-flecked beard, was asked during a television debate last week to introduce himself to viewers.

title: New Parks Chief Brings a City Planners Vision
description: Seated at the head of a long conference table in what was once the office of the parks chief Robert Moses, Mitchell J. Silver, New York Citys new parks commissioner, declared himself a Worlds Fair enthusiast.

title: Support for E.U. Improves, Poll Finds
description: BRUSSELS  Attitudes toward the European Union have improved ahead of elections to the European Parliament this month, but there is growing reluctance to cede more power to Brussels, according to a closely watched poll published Monday.

title: Injuries and Age March On, to the Dismay of the Yankees
description: The Yankees are taking on that same discouraging feeling from last season: old, sad and broken. You look at the names and the salaries and you expect something special. Then you look at the calendar and know better.

title: Local News Feature
description: TUESDAYS PUZZLE  My local news happens to come from the New York City television stations and, on CBS-TV, the meteorologist is Lonnie Quinn. Mr. Quinn is your basic, telegenic weather guy with perfect hair who does a very serviceable job explaining why you will need an umbrella this morning, and there is really nothing remarkable about him except for his tendency to panic dramatically about the weather while on the air.

title: Hikers Spread Democracy in India
description: MARKHA VALLEY, India  Staring up at the steep and lifeless brown ridges looming over the valley, Gulzar Ahmad Dar, a boyish and chatty Kashmiri policeman, sighed at having drawn a short straw.

title: TV Networks Bank on Future of M.L.S.
description: Everything aligned for Major League Soccer to make deals with ESPN, Fox and Univision worth a combined $90 million annually from 2015 to 2022.

title: Brooklyn Development Plan Stirs Debates on Affordable Housing and Park Funding
description: The first project at Brooklyn Bridge Park in 2007 was not a playground, but a converted warehouse with some of the most expensive condominiums in the borough.

title: When Looks Count Way Too Much
description: Sarah Baker may or may not be a fat lady. But she played one on TV.

title: Family Mourns at Site of a Fatal Beating
description: Wen Hui Ruan, 68, was just a block from his East Village home on Friday night when a man stopped him on East Sixth Street and hurled him against a wall. When Mr. Ruan fell to the ground, the man punched him and began stomping on his head.

title: In Lundqvist, Rangers Have an Unflappable Master of the Seventh Game
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  When the pressure gets higher, Henrik Lundqvist turns into the Rangers resident Zen master. He is 9-2 in elimination games since the start of the 2012 playoffs, and has won four of five Game 7s in his career. He has a remarkable .963 save percentage in those games, having allowed only five goals.

title: A Long Streak in Decisive Games
description: The Rangers, seemingly preprogrammed to play Game 7s, will play another on Tuesday night, against the Penguins in Pittsburgh. The Rangers have won seven of their past eight Game 7s, most by a single goal. Henrik Lundqvist has been in the net for the last five, winning four.

title: Book Reveals Wider Net of U.S. Spying on Envoys
description: WASHINGTON  In May 2010, when the United Nations Security Council was weighing sanctions against Iran over its nuclear program, several members were undecided about how they would vote. The American ambassador to the United Nations, Susan E. Rice, asked the National Security Agency for help so that she could develop a strategy, a leaked agency document shows.

title: De Blasios Budget Proposal Finds Critics at a Ratings Agency and in Accounting
description: In unveiling his budget proposal last week, Mayor Bill de Blasio repeatedly said it toed the line between fiscal prudence and progressiveness  assuring New Yorkers that teachers and other municipal employees who had long been working without a contract could be made whole, and then some, and that the city could afford the billions of dollars their raises and back pay would cost.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for May 12, 2014
No Shortage of Finns Flying Down the Ice for the Wild
description: ST. PAUL  The nickname Flying Finn goes back more than 100 years, long before Minnesota Wild scouts noticed centers Mikael Granlund and Erik Haula, the latest hockey products from Finland.

title: Despite Jamess Big Night, Nets Stay Close Until End
description: As LeBron James took two meaningless free throws to close out the Miami Heats win Monday night at Barclays Center, Chris Bosh and Mario Chalmers stood on the opposite end of the court, far away from the other players, smiling and shaking hands.

title: Russia Vows Harsh Response to Airspace Snub and to Raid of a Delegates Jet
description: MOSCOW  It began with a state visit by senior Russian officials to a separatist enclave in another country. It ended with Russia threatening economic retribution against several European nations on Monday, after the plane carrying the delegation was grounded in Moldova and raided by the local police.

title: In One Eastern City, Ukrainians Find Battle Hits Too Close to Home
description: SLOVYANSK, Ukraine  Roughly midway through an hourlong gunfight that began just after midnight Sunday, six high-explosive mortar rounds narrowly missed the home of Yevgeny Kharkovsky and his wife, exploding around them on Yuzhnaya Street.

title: De Blasio Looks Toward Sweden for Road Safety
description: STOCKHOLM  Across this Scandinavian capital of graceful cyclists and speed-regulating shrubbery, cabbies who drive Volvos and pedestrians who look over their shoulders before jaywalking, a simple figure rules:

title: Negligence Charges Brought in Quebec Derailment and Fire
description: OTTAWA  The Montreal, Maine and Atlantic Railway and three of its employees have been charged with criminal negligence in connection with a derailment that killed 47 people and incinerated much of downtown Lac-Mgantic, Quebec, last July, officials said on Monday.

title: At Least 14 Die as Migrant Boat Headed for Italy Sinks off Libyan Coast
description: ROME  A boat packed with hundreds of migrants trying to reach Europe sank in the Mediterranean Sea about 45 miles off the Libyan coast on Monday. At least 14 people died, but more than 200 were rescued in an operation led by the Italian Navy.

title: A Death Draws Attention to Afghan Police Methods
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  A familys accusations that the police in Kandahar tortured and killed their son while he was in custody has again focused attention on a wave of disappearances and deaths in the southern province.

title: Long Fight to Keep a Grand Address on the Upper West Side
description: On a clear, freezing day in January 2013, Marieliz Unwin and Fran Jacobs sat in an office above Times Square discussing the dcor in Ms. Unwins apartment at the Ansonia.

title: Spain: Provincial Council Leader Shot
description: A regional politician from Spains governing Popular Party was shot dead in the northern city of Len on Monday, prompting the countrys main parties to suspend campaigning ahead of the European parliamentary elections this month. Isabel Carrasco, the head of the provincial council in Len, was shot at least three times as she crossed a bridge in the citys downtown, according to local news media reports. Ms. Carrasco, 59, had been running the provincial council in Lon since 2007. The shooting in broad daylight was a shock in a country that has only recently emerged from decades of terrorist bombings and political killings by members of ETA, the Basque separatist group that declared a cease-fire in 2011. An unidentified woman arrested in connection with the crime, according to local news reports, is believed to have recently been fired from her council job.

title: Somalia: Attack on Former Official Fails
description: Eleven people have been confirmed dead and 20 others wounded after a car bomb exploded on Monday at a cafe frequented by government officials in the town of Baidoa, officials said. The suicide bomber was believed to have been targeting a former regional governor, Abdifatah Ibrahim Gesey, who survived the attack. No group has claimed responsibility. The Somali president, Hassan Sheik Mohamud, and the special representative of the United Nations secretary general for Somalia, Nicholas Kay, condemned the attack.

title: Nominee for Egypt Ambassador Post
description: The White House movedMondayto fill the long vacant post of the United States ambassador to Egypt by nominating Robert Stephen Beecroft, a career diplomat.Mr. Beecroft currently is the American ambassador to Iraq. Mr. Beecrofts Iraq post, in turn, will be filled by Stuart E. Jones, the United States ambassador to Jordan, the White House said. Mr. Beecroft will take up his post in Cairo during a tumultuous period. Abdel Fattah el-Sisi, who led the ouster last year of the elected government in Egypt, is expected to be electedEgypts president next month. The Cairo post has been vacant since Anne Patterson left in August to become the top Middle East official at the State Department.

title: Word of the Day | brazen
description: brazen\bra-zn\ adjective and verb

title: Silver Issues a Response After Sterlings Interview
description: It was only a written statement, but his exasperation was clear.

title: New York City Police Helicopter Rescues Injured Hiker
description: It began as a Mothers Day hike with family and ended like a scene from some Rocky Mountain adventure film: an injured hiker, unable to get down from a treacherous cliffside trail; a rescuer descending by rope from a hovering helicopter.

title: Timothy Geithners New Book, Chart By Chart
description: The former Treasury secretary talks about some of the charts he included in his memoir and why they are particularly significant.

title: James Scores 49 Points in Vintage Performance
description: It was almost as if LeBron James were back in Cleveland.

title: At Christies Auction, an Experiment Proves Fruitful
description: Gambling on the boundless appetite and bottomless checkbooks of todays contemporary art collectors, not to mention their quirky taste for macabre images  an electric chair, a canvas filled with dead flies, and an installation incorporating handcuffs and an illustrated guide to pistols  Christies staged a highly publicized experiment on Monday night that was a runaway success.

title: Quotation of the Day for Tuesday, May 13, 2014
description: When you do something a lot, you get good at it. I think Texas probably does it as well as Iran.

title: Authorities in Spain Make Arrests in Fatal Shooting of Politician
description: MADRID  A regional politician from Spains governing Popular Party was shot dead in the northern city of Len on Monday, prompting the countrys main parties to suspend their campaigning ahead of the European parliamentary elections later this month.

title: Queens Bombers Rally to Beat the Yankees
description: After 17 years of interleague play between the Yankees and the Mets the novelty was bound to wear off. Since 1997, when the concept was introduced with a bang at the old Yankee Stadium, the intensity and buzz had gradually eroded.

title: George Christie Dies at 79; Steward of His Familys Opera Legacy
description: It is a truth universally acknowledged that a married man in possession of a good fortune, boundless determination and a wife who is a singer must be in want of an opera house.

title: Struggling Granderson Has His Say for a Night
description: Curtis Granderson stepped into the batters box for the Mets in the sixth inning Monday, to a mixture of boos and polite applause from the Yankee Stadium crowd. He drew a 3-0 count, leaned over the plate and calmly sent a Hiroki Kuroda sinker into the right-field seats for a two-run homer. It was a familiar sight, Granderson rounding the bases here in his usual trot.

title: Uruguayan Leader Meets With Obama to Talk Trade and Human Rights
description: URUGUAY  President Jos Mujica of Uruguay met with President Obama in Washington on Monday, pointing to the strengthening ties between the United States and the South American nation, which is advancing an array of socially liberal legislation, including the legalization of same-sex marriage and abortion. True to his laid-back style, Mr. Mujica, a 78-year-old former guerrilla who has farmed chrysanthemums for a living, did not wear a tie to the White House. The leaders discussed opportunities to expand trade as Uruguay, a small ranching nation of 3.3 million people, seeks new markets for its commodities exports. Mr. Obama also referred to the influence of Mr. Mujica in connection to human rights issues in Latin America. Curiously, the two leaders did not publicly refer to Uruguays pioneering legalization of marijuana, a sweeping measure that went into effect last week. Focusing on common ground between Uruguay and the United States, Mr. Mujica, a former livestock minister, said, I embrace all agriculturalists of this nation.

title: Whats on Tuesday
description: 8 P.M. (CBS) NCIS Gibbs (Mark Harmon) travels home after his fathers death in this season finale honoring Ralph Waite, who played Jackson, the elder Gibbs, for six seasons and died on Feb. 13. The team, meanwhile, investigates whether a fire on a Navy ship that was used as a secret detention site for indicted terrorists was accidental or cover for an escape. In NCIS: Los Angeles, at 9, Callen (Chris ODonnell) and Hanna (L L Cool J) must find a missing submarine used to smuggle cocaine from Colombia into the United States.

title: Times Minute | Traffic Safety, Imported
description: New York City imports traffic safety strategy from Sweden. Also on the Minute, confronting Irans future warfare capabilities and a slow-motion depletion in Western Antarctica.

title: Nuclear Talks Will Confront Irans Future Capability to Enrich Uranium
description: WASHINGTON  As Iran and six world powers meet this week in Vienna to begin drafting language to resolve their nuclear standoff, negotiators say they are finally confronting a crucial sticking point to a permanent agreement  the size and shape of the nuclear fuel production capability that Iran will be permitted to retain.

title: Video Notebook: Guarding LeBron James
description: Brooklyns Paul Pierce talks bout guarding Miamis LeBron James on a night he tied a playoff career high with 49 points.

title: Times Minute | Traffic Safety, Imported
description: In the Video

title: Video Notebook: Heat Top Nets in Game 4
description: Brooklyns Deron Williams discusses the possession that led to a Chris Bosh 3-pointer with just under a minute left in the game that gave the Heat the lead for good.

title: Bus Drivers Actions Credited With Saving Lives in Fire
description: The driver of a bus that erupted in flames in southwestern China on Monday afternoon stayed aboard the blazing vehicle as he used a fire extinguisher, smashed a window with a safety hammer to create an exit and then helped passengers leave the conflagration, a municipal government statement said on Tuesday.

title: Corrections: May 13, 2014
description: NATIONAL

title: Warning Spreads as Beijing Clamps Down on Illegal Modeling
description: The word is spreading among advocates for better working conditions for international models: There is a crackdown on foreign models working illegally in China, so warn any colleagues or friends there.

title: India Election Digest: May 13
description: What you need to know about Indias elections, now that the last phase of voting is over: Exit polls on Monday night widely predicted a sweep by the National Democratic Alliance, which is led by the Bharatiya Janata Party, but the spotty record of exit polls casts a shadow over the results.

title: Former Israeli Premier Is Sentenced to 6 Years in Bribery Case
description: JERUSALEM  Ehud Olmert, the brash former prime minister who was on the brink of a peace deal with the Palestinians when he was forced from office on corruption charges, on Tuesday became the most prominent former Israeli leader to be sentenced to prison, with a judge giving him six years for taking bribes while likening him to a traitor.

title: BlackBerry Unveils Low-Cost Smartphone With Indonesia in Mind
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  The smartphone maker BlackBerry unveiled a new model on Tuesday that it has hopes of bringing to emerging markets in Asia and South America.

title: Unbalanced in Basel
description: Ambrose Evans-Pritchard draws our attention to a speech by Jaime Caruana, General Manager of the Bank for International Settlements. It is indeed a quite remarkable speech  and I mean that in the worst way; its a perfect illustration of the way permahawks keep finding new arguments for their never-changing demand that we raise interest rates now now now.

title: Inflation Targets Reconsidered
description: My paper for the ECB research conference (pdf) in Portugal, later this month.

title: Test Yourself | History, May 13
description: Take the Quiz

title: 6 Qs About the News | Spiders That Thrive in a Social Web
description: In Spiders That Thrive in a Social Web, Natalie Angier writes about new research that reveals how some spiders learn to cooperate.

title: European Court Lets Users Erase Records on Web
description: Europes highest court said on Tuesday that people had the right to influence what the world could learn about them through online searches, a ruling that rejected long-established notions about the free flow of information on the Internet.

title: The Horse at the Heart of Chinese-Turkmen Relations
description: Natural gas projects may be the most desirable gift Turkmenistans president brought with him to China, but a heavenly horse, presented to Chinas president, Xi Jinping, was definitely more photogenic.

title: Chinese Police Detain Contributor to U.S.-Based Website
description: The police have detained a Beijing resident who they say fabricated stories about topics including organ harvesting and police beatings and posted them on a North Carolina-based Chinese-language website, the latest in hundreds of arrests in a crackdown on expression on the Internet that began last year.

title: The Bud Light-ification of Bud
description: There are many things that bother Jon Cooper about the market for marijuana.

title: What Career or Technical Classes Do You Wish Your School Offered?
description: Automotive mechanics, culinary arts, video editing or computer coding? Do you wish you were able to get hands-on training in a field that interests you while still in middle or high school?

title: Look Ma, Im a Star (Photographer)
description: Ron Galellas mother named her son after her favorite movie star, Ronald Colman, because of his elegant British accent. But she raised him in the Bronx, where he wound up sounding more like Marlon Brando in On the Waterfront.

title: Exit Polls Favoring Opposition Add to Indian Stock Market Rally
description: MUMBAI, India  The benchmark Indian stock market indexes rose to a third consecutive record on Tuesdayafter exit polls forecast that the opposition Bharatiya Janata Party would win with a large majority, making Narendra Modi, a leader with a business-friendly reputation, the next prime minister of India.

title: VW Wins Enough Shares to Take Full Control of Scania
description: LONDON  The German automaker Volkswagen said on Tuesday that it had succeeded in coaxing enough shareholders to sell so that it could take full control of the Swedish truck maker Scania.

title: London Stock Exchange Looking at Russell Investments
description: LONDON  The London Stock Exchange said on Tuesday that it was in talks to buy Russell Investments, the owner of the Russell 2000 stock market index.

title: At Center of Ukraine Talks, Degrees of Decentralizing
description: KIEV, Ukraine  National round-table talks seeking to resolve Ukraines six-month political crisis by finding a formula for decentralizing power will begin Wednesday against a seemingly formidable array of obstacles.

title: New York Today: Talent Underground
description: Good Tuesday morning to you.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Welcome to the Morning Briefing on NYT Now. (Download us for iPhone.)

title: The Loyal Bunch
description: JOHANNESBURG  Late last month, just as the dry winter weather started to bite, the political climate turned yellow, green and black, the colors of the African National Congress. Africas oldest liberation party was girding itself for the fifth general elections since the end of apartheid and the most anticipated race since Nelson Mandela walked out of prison.

title: Your Thoughts, Our Thinking
description: Many readers have praised our question-and-answer sessions, including one with Gretchen Morgenson, the business columnist.

title: Norwest Raises $1.2 Billion in Venture Capital
description: With investors enthusiastic about hot technology start-ups, a major venture capital firm has raised $1.2 billion for its new fund.

title: The Orange Underpants Logo and the Value of Testing
description: A few months ago, my company, RJMetrics, proudly released a new logo: an orange dodecahedron. It had everything:a great back story,an alignment withcompany values and the potential to revolutionize the way our customers perceive our brand.

title: IBMs Virginia Rometty on Leadership and Management
description: In an article this week, Virginia M. Rometty, IBMs chief executive, described her mission as leading the technology giant through a transformation that would leave it healthy and successful through the next decade. That is not a one-year job, she said, not when youre a hundred billion-dollar company.

title: The Climate Legacy
description: What well be leaving to future generations.

title: In Our Pages: May 14
description: 1939: Rush-Hour Blasts in London

title: Asymmetric Misinformation
description: A followup to my post about Jaime Caruana at the BIS. One other thing that struck me was his claim that

title: Prosecutor Seeks 30-Day Psychiatric Evaluation for Pistorius
description: The prosecutor in the murder trial of the athlete Oscar Pistorius formally applied on Tuesday for him to undergo a 30-day psychiatric evaluation following testimony that he suffered from general anxiety disorder.

title: AT&T Pursues DirecTV
description: AT&T is in talks to buy DirecTV for at least $50 billion, and the two sides are said to be actively working toward an announcement, DealBooks David Gelles writes. If the deal is completed, it would give AT&T, the countrys second-largest wireless carrier, control of the countrys largest satellite television provider, a move that would further reshape the already changing telecommunications and television industries.

title: When Spell-Check Cant Help
description: Heres the latest batch of sound-alike problems, look-alike problems and other word mix-ups.

title: Daily Report: E.U. Court Orders Google to Grant Right to Be Forgotten
description: The highest court in the European Union decided on Tuesday that Google must, in some cases, grant users of its search engine a right to be forgotten that includes deletion of links to embarrassing legal records, James Kanter reports from Brussels.

title: Q & A: Evan Osnos on the Age of Ambition: Chasing Fortune, Truth, and Faith in the New China
description: China today is one of the worlds greatest economic success stories, with hundreds of millions of people pulling themselves out of poverty and enjoying a prosperity and quality of life unimaginable three decades ago. It is also the worlds biggest authoritarian state, which puts dissidents behind bars, closely censors the media and allows average citizens little say in politics.

title: A Hollywood Princess Returns to the Screen
description: LOS ANGELES  In the spring of 1955, Grace Kelly sprinkled a bit of stardust around the eighth international film festival in Cannes, then headed up the coast to Monaco, where she met, and eventually married, the principalitys reigning monarch, Rainier III.

title: Lawmakers Mistrust a Marriage Offer Pfizer Wont Abandon
description: LONDON  Pfizer opened the door on Tuesday to a possible higher offer for AstraZeneca, saying the deal remained compelling. It also urged AstraZenecas board to engage in discussions that could result in a transaction that AstraZeneca can recommend.

title: Listen Up | Nearly Two Decades In, Little Dragon Breaks Out
description: The story floating around the blogosphere about the Swedish electro-pop band Little Dragon is that its name was inspired by the epic tantrums that the lead singer Yukimi Nagano used to have in the studio. Its been told and retold enough times to have taken on a mythical quality. It was so long ago now that I forgot if its true, but I feel pretty Zen these days, Nagano says. To maintain a band, you have to be able to disagree on a lot of things, and I cant explode every single time  its kind of exhausting. She adds, Its like a relationship. Its tricky.

title: Youll Make New Friends. Maybe.
description: How do you feel about leaving your friends? I asked Cai one evening.

title: A Stolen Briefcase, and a Very Calm Victim
description: Dear Diary:

title: 2 Killed in West Virginia Mine Where Safety Lapses Were Cited
description: WHARTON, W.Va.  Two miners died late Monday in an accident inside a West Virginia coal mine whose long history of safety violations had already brought it under special scrutiny by federal officials.

title: Chinas Sizzling Real Estate Market Cools
description: HONG KONG  After almost two decades of nearly unceasing increases in real estate prices and construction across China, one of the worlds longest-running bull markets finally seems to be stalling, with broad consequences for the countrys economy and possibly its politics.

title: Labor Market Seems Dented, Not Broken
description: There are two schools of thought about the longer-term prospects for the labor market. The darker view is that the Great Recession wrought permanent damage: The jobs that disappeared arent easily replaced, and the skills of the jobless are a poor match for the jobs that remain.

title: Picasso Museums President Is Dismissed
description: PARIS  The French government dismissed the embattled president of the Muse Picasso on Tuesday amid an employee revolt and a bitter debate over delays in reopening the museum, which has been closed for renovation for almost five years.

title: Lew Urges China to Ease Exchange Rate Controls
description: BEIJING  Treasury Secretary Jacob J. Lew pushed China on Tuesday to let market forces decide its exchange rate, and pressed senior officials here not to undercut the Obama administrations sanctions on Russia.

title: How PAC Spending Stays Secret
description: The American Heartland PAC hit the airwaves last week in Iowa with a television advertisement criticizing a Republican Senate candidate, Mark Jacobs, as a Texas millionaire who supported Democrats in the past. The super PAC, which lists a Washington address, spent $140,000 on the ad.

title: Researching Stop Signs in the Skies for Birds
description: Advisory: No birds were harmed in the reporting of this article.

title: E.U. Court Rules in Google Privacy Case
description: The highest court in the European Union decided on Tuesday that Google must, in some cases, honor requests from its search engine users to delete links to personal information.

title: Building Blackbeard: A Syndication System Powered By Play, Scala and Akka
description: The NYTimes News Service/Syndicate division distributes content to other publications. Our syndication business is growing and, until recently, was managed with a legacy desktop-based CMS, which did not integrate well with our web publishing system.

title: What Are the Draws and Drawbacks of Success for Writers?
