In Surviving Twin, an 80-minute one-man show that opens at the Westside Theater in Manhattan on June 9, Mr. Wainwright will sing favorites from his catalog, as well as several new songs that he plans to include on his next album, Havent Got the Blues (Yet), due in September.

title: 9/11 Museum Opens to a Somber Crowd
description: Alone or in groups they emerged from the dark exhibition halls and the even darker subject matter of the National September 11 Memorial Museum, reaching for words like overwhelming, shock and gut-wrenching.

title: Study Sees Bigger Role for Placenta in Newborns Health
description: The placenta, once thought sterile, actually harbors a world of bacteria that may influence the course of pregnancy and help shape an infants health and the bacterial makeup of its gut, a new study has found.

title: 36 Hours in Montevideo, Uruguay
description: Uruguay has made a splash in the news in recent months: Lawmakers allowed same-sex couples to marry less than a year ago, marijuana became legal in December and the countrys folksy president, Jos Mujica, has appeared in many magazine profiles. While some developments can be seen as a continuation of the countrys track record of economic and social liberalism, they also point to a new, bolder attitude, which can be easily glimpsed in Montevideo, the capital. New hotels, cultural spaces, restaurants and a residential building boom have quickened the citys tranquil pace. Still, the appeal of Montevideo lies not in novelty but in its timeless backdrop of fin-de-sicle architecture, shady plazas and riverside promenades bordered by sandy beaches  places where laid-back residents indulge in lifes simple pleasures.

title: The Collaboration as Wrestling Match: Is It a Draw, or Must Someone Prevail?
description: The French dancers Cdric Andrieux and Christophe Ives met each other in the 1990s, when they were both studying at the national conservatory in Paris. I dont know how chummy they were back then, but a few years ago, they decided to make a duet embodying their relationship and their process of collaboration. That duet, Les Communs, does not look like a reunion of old drinking buddies or an expression of fraternit. It looks rivalrous, like a wrestling match.

title: In Credit Suisse Settlement, a Question of Justice
description: Updated, 3:44 p.m. | Hours after the Obama administration announced the criminal conviction of Credit Suisse on Monday evening, the banks chief executive, Brady W. Dougan, publicly reassured Wall Street that the punishment would not do much damage to his firm. The conviction, he said on a conference call, would not cause any material impact on our operational or business capabilities.

title: Stephen Hertz, Corporate Lawyer, Dies at 55
description: Stephen R. Hertz, a top lawyer in mergers and acquisitions as well as private equity buyouts, died on Friday in Manhattan. He was 55.

title: Fed Panel Has Begun to Address How to Gradually Raise Rates
description: Federal Reserve officials have gingerly begun to take on what will be their most difficult task over the next 12 to 24 months: determining how and when to gradually raise interest rates and return monetary policy to a more traditional path, even as they keep trillions in assets accumulated during the huge stimulus efforts of the last five years.

title: Pelosi Picks 5 Democrats for Panel on Benghazi
description: WASHINGTON  Representative Nancy Pelosi of California on Wednesday appointed a full slate of senior House Democrats to a special committee investigating the 2012 attack on the diplomatic mission in Benghazi, Libya, surprising some in her party by giving legitimacy to an inquiry many had dismissed as a political stunt.

title: House Hunting in ... Buenos Aires
description: A FIVE-BEDROOM APARTMENT IN THE RECOLETA NEIGHBORHOOD OF BUENOS AIRES

title: 71 Are Accused in a Child Pornography Case, Officials Say
description: It began in Westchester County with the arrest of a police chief who was teaching classes about sexual abuse at a Roman Catholic church. The investigation soon swept up many others who were swapping files of children forced into explicit sexual acts: two registered nurses, a Brooklyn rabbi, a New York City police officer, a paramedic and a Boy Scout leader.

title: Against Walter Kasper (I)
description: Ive referred a couple of times to Cardinal Walter Kaspers very interesting interview with Commonweal Magazine, in which the prelate/theologian discussed the proposals on communion for remarried Catholics that (apparently with a papal blessing) hes been promoting in advance of the looming Synod of Bishops, which is dedicated to family life and scheduled for this fall. This is going to be the first of two posts on his argument; the second which wont be forthcoming till next week at the earliest, I expectwill deal with the communion-for-the-remarried proposal itself, but first I want to address the frame he puts around his ideas, and particular his claim that a truly remarkable number of contemporary marriages may actually be, in the eyes of the Catholic Church, invalid.

title: What You Get for ... $1,700,000
description: GLENDALE, MO.

title: How Much Does That Plane Ticket Really Cost?
description: A group of bipartisan lawmakers in the House of Representatives has been pushing a bill that would make it easier for airlines to deceive travelers about the true cost of flying. As we noted in an editorial last month, the cynically named Transparent Airfares Act of 2014 would allow airlines to advertise base fares that do not include taxes and fees. But not everybody in Washington is on board with that idea.

title: Drowning Risk Varies by Age and Race
description: Almost 21,000 people under 30 died from drowning from 1999 to 2010 in the United States, and there were substantial variations in death rates depending on age, race and ethnicity.

title: Titanic Musicals Return to New York Is Delayed
description: A previously announced Broadway revival of Titanic, the winner of the 1997 Tony Award for best musical, will not berth during the 2014-15 theater season as planned because a suitable theater was not available, the producers announced on Wednesday.

title: Cuomo Picks Ex-Congresswoman as Running Mate
description: MELVILLE, N.Y.  Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo on Wednesday named a former congresswoman from Buffalo to be his running mate, a move that completes the Democratic ticket and underscores his courtship of western New York.

title: In Cybersecurity, Sometimes the Weakest Link Is a Family Member
description: Since I started writing about cybersecurity, Ive developed something of a  reputation for paranoia.

title: The Gun Report: May 21, 2014
description: This morning, Rep. Carolyn Maloney of New York and Sen. Ed Markey of Massachusetts unveiled bicameral legislation that would grant the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention $10 million a year to research firearm safety and gun violence prevention.

title: Art Market | Possibly the Coolest Art and Design Auction Ever
description: Who needs more things? I think that we all want more experiences, says David van der Leer, the director of the Van Alen Institute, the public architecture think tank, which hosts its gala benefit tonight. The accompanying online auction, which accepts bids through the end of the week on Paddle 8, features offerings that will occupy space in your memory (and Instagram feed), rather than your home: winning bidders will have the chance to take journeys with 30 noteworthy figures in the architecture and design world.

title: Browsing in Boutiques Near Venices Grand Canal
description: When it comes to shopping, travelers to Venice tend to stick to the big-brand Italian chain stores near touristy San Marco Square, but the citys homegrown boutique scene warrants far more attention than it gets. The Cannaregio area, for example, is filled with a diverse range of local shops along narrow alleys and in small piazzas. Situated off the Grand Canal and a 10-minute walk from the Rialto Bridge, this is a residential enclave where middle- and upper-class families have lived for generations and to which Venetians regularly flock for retail excursions.

title: Exploring Cafes and Culture in Downtown Newark
description: The ceramic fire-breathing dragons in the window of Gifts East West, a curio shop owned by Ing and John Watts, have seen neighbors come and go during their 40-year tenure at 57 Halsey Street in Newark. Today the dragons look out to an empty lot and a mural painted on a wall of a shuttered department store, Hahne & Company, which last saw customers in the late 1980s. In two years the building will house a Whole Foods Market, with mixed-income rental apartments stacked above it. Another construction site across the street is for the Prudential Tower, which will give the financial services giant a new home next year, with room for retail as well.

title: Google S.E.C. Filing Says It Wants Ads In Your Thermostat and Car
description: Updated, with comment from Tony Fadell, founder of Nest, and to cite an S.E.C filing in the headline.

title: In Search of the Win-Win Solution: Exploring Techniques in Fair Division
description: Overview | How can goods and burdens be fairly divided among groups of people? What are the characteristics of an equitable division procedure?

title: Former Bronx Assemblyman Sentenced for Corruption
description: Eric A. Stevenson, a former New York assemblyman convicted of bribery and other corruption charges, was sentenced to three years in prison on Wednesday by a judge who said he had sold an assemblymans core function for money.

title: A Horse on the Bourse? Of Course
description: Herms pulled out all the stops at its All About Women event at 23 Wall Street.

title: After Death of a Caddie, Raising Pints and Concern
description: BAGSHOT, England  The table for one with the unopened pack of cigarettes and the untouched glass of cheap red wine stood a few feet from a sign that read, Book This Room for Your Celebration. The Tuesday night gathering here on the first floor of the Cedar Tree, in honor of a man who seldom ate alone, drew a crowd that spilled onto High Street with frothy glasses of Guinness.

title: Cannes Film Festival: From Writers Fights Came Winter Sleep
description: CANNES  In Winter Sleep, from the Turkish director Nuri Bilge Ceylan, an older former actor and his beautiful younger wife are caught up in an intense conversation  about the limits of altruism, the responsibilities of the artist, about love and forgiveness and self-deception.

title: A Horse on the Bourse? Of Course
description: THE HERMS WORLDVIEW is nothing short of cosmological.

title: Prince Charles Passes Comment on Putin, and a Nation Is Aghast
description: LONDON  The poor man may eventually become king of England, but even at 65, every time he opens his mouth, even to utter banalities in private, he seems to get into trouble with the British press.

title: A Mets Rookies Hair and Profile Grow
description: For more than 30 years as the baseball coach at Stetson University in DeLand, Fla., Pete Dunn enforced a strict hair policy. He had served in the Marines, had an old-school type of mentality and wanted his players to look a certain way in class and on the field.

title: A Familys Hard Journey, With Disney as a Guide
description: Over the last two decades, Ron Suskind has been known as a hard-hitting, Pulitzer Prize-winning political reporter, a thorn in the side of the Bush administration, a chronicler of the Obama White House. In private, though, Mr. Suskind was Iago the parrot, Baloo the bear, Merlin the wizard: Disney characters whose dialogue, songs and even wisdom he borrowed to communicate with his autistic son, Owen.

title: Black Keyss Latest Tops Michael Jackson
description: In one of the odder contests in recent pop history, the Black Keys have narrowly beaten Michael Jackson for the No. 1 spot on the new Billboard album chart.

title: Pennsylvania Governor Wont Fight Ruling That Allows Gay Marriage
description: Gov. Tom Corbett of Pennsylvania said Wednesday that he would not appeal a judges ruling striking down Pennsylvanias ban on same-sex marriage.

title: His Peers Views Are in the Details
description: Karl Ove Knausgaard, a handsome, rangy, brooding Norwegian author (and father of four young children) has held much of the literary establishment in thrall ever since his 3,600-page, six-part autobiographical novel, My Struggle, started appearing in English in 2012. Direct and unguarded in tone, the books combine a micro-focus on the granular detail of daily life (child care, groceries, quarrels with friends) with earnest meditations on art, death, music and ambition. The novelist Jeffrey Eugenides, calling these two elements auto-fiction and rumination, said that blending them in the way Mr. Knausgaard does is something nobodys done before.

title: Aaron Schock and His Popular Instagram Persona
description: WASHINGTON  I love your life. Youre the coolest. Stud.

title: Immersed in Family Business
description: Gang Related is a series on Fox on Thursdays about a reverse undercover cop. The hero, Ryan Lopez (Ramon Rodriguez), isnt a police officer posing as gang member, he is a gang member who has infiltrated the Los Angeles Police Department.

title: Alex Chapman: The D.I.Y. Hip-Hop Artist
A Return to the Hamptons
description: Growing up mostly in Manhattan, Larry Landau spent his summers first on Fire Island and later in Southampton, where his mother bought a small ranch house. Thats the house that introduced his wife, Susan, whos from New Jersey, to the Hamptons.

title: Yellen Speaks at N.Y.U. Commencement
description: Janet L. Yellen, the Federal Reserve chairwoman, told graduates at New York University that a willingness to stand up for principles is a crucial trait.

title: More Voices Than Usual, Soaring in Service to Bach
description: In recent decades, largely thanks to the early-music movement, audiences have become accustomed to hearing Bachs major choral works sung by smaller choirs, often with period-instrument ensembles, performances where textures come through clearly, and rhythmic execution can be crisp.

title: Bending Convention
description: Fifty shades of blue, and a smattering of black and white tuxedos take over the red carpet.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Welcome to NYT Now, the new app from The New York Times. (Download us for iPhone.)

title: For Tuxedos, Blue Is the New Black
description: Its the garment no man ever thinks about until he has to, the suit that strikes terror in an average guys heart. Subject to archaic codes of sartorial etiquette, composed of curious components, seemingly too expensive to buy for one-time use and yet vaguely forlorn when rented, it is, of course, the tuxedo  that set of formal clothes even whose name is controversial. (Dinner jacket is preferred by fancy folks.)

title: Its Difficult to Remain Incognito if You Insist on Taking Your Clothes Off
description: The sensorial effect of dance has much to do with the way performers inhabit a stage, be it spookily, generously or, in the case of the Zurich choreographer Simone Aughterlony, deviously. In Disguise, part of Zurich Meets New York: A Festival of Swiss Ingenuity and performed at the Kitchen on Tuesday night, takes place on a pink floor strewn with pieces of wood and rope, moss, knives and axes.

title: Suite Wheels at AKA in Beverly Hills
description: AKA, the nine-property brand of luxury extended-stay accommodations, recently introduced a mobile suite at its Beverly Hills, Calif., location in partnership with Airstream 2 Go.

title: Clip: Gore Vidal
description: A scene from the documentary Gore Vidal: The United States of Amnesia.

title: Medieval Secrets Whispered in Caves
description: CW starts off the summer television season on Thursday night with Labyrinth, a four-hour event mini-series. Event in this case means a two-year-old Da Vinci Code rip-off from the Ridley Scott costume-drama factory. Always wanted to know more about Catharism and the Albigensian Crusade? After watching Labyrinth, you may actually know less.

title: Clip: Blended
description: A scene from Blended with Adam Sandler and Drew Barrymore.

title: For Memorial Day, Channeling the Relaxed Delevingne Look
description: Memorial Day is a reminder to downshift a little, to put your look in a more-relaxed gear. And if the seasons offerings have you at a loss, go with it. Channel the mixed-and-mashed style of the model Cara Delevingne (left), who has a weakness for, among other things, 90s street wear, eclectic prints, oversize sunglasses and idiosyncratic baseball caps. Not that we all could or should pull off the Delevingne look (and shes British, anyway), but we can capture some of the cheerful, nonchalant punch her outfits so often pack.

title: Clip: The Dance of Reality
description: A scene from the film.

title: Clip: X-Men: Days of Future Past
description: A scene from the film.

title: Looking Overseas, Google Weighs a Shift in Deal Focus
description: Since 2001, Google has struck more than 160 takeovers, most of them at home.

title: Voices From Serbian Flooding
description: Survivors recounted the moment floodwaters submerged their homes in the towns of Obrenovac and Krupanj.

title: The Final Game to Pick the 2015 USA-1 Bermuda Bowl Team
description: The final of the trial to pick the 2015 USA-1 Bermuda Bowl world championship team was played last weekend in Phoenix.

title: Worries Turn to Disease as Waters Recede in Balkans
description: OBRENOVAC, Serbia  For five days, as rain pelted the Balkans and the waters rose, Jovanka Sreckovic, 85, waited in bed in her tiny house, barely a hut, beside the Sava River. Ms. Sreckovic, unable to walk, had no food, no water, no medicine and no electricity, and felt herself sinking into sickness with nothing but a childrens book about Jesus to pass the time.

title: 3 Ways to Do Ribs
description: How to braise, grill or smoke them any time of year (but especially now).

title: Clip: Stand Clear of the Closing Doors
description: A scene from the film, directed by Sam Fleischner.

title: Curious Incident, On The Town Steer Clear of Stars in Casting
description: Not every Broadway show is banking on star power to sell tickets, as the casting of two fall openings, announced on Wednesday, demonstrates.

title: Deceit, Madness and Love, Imported Directly From Russia
description: WASHINGTON  Is it better to see the Bolshoi Ballet at home or abroad? For decorative splendor, few opera houses can compare with the rebuilt Bolshoi Theater in Moscow  which I visited recently  and fewer with the immensity of its stage. Yet too many performances in Moscow and St. Petersburg are ruined by the partisan clamor of balletomanes and claques who overapplaud individual sections (sometimes individual steps) of each work, turning ballet into a competitive sport.

title: This Dinners Highlights May Be on SportsCenter
description: The theater group New Georges describes its Jam on Toast festival as a performance gym for early-career playwrights and directors. Using that metaphor, its safe to say that Kate Benson and Lee Sunday Evans, collaborators on the spectacularly inventive A Beautiful Day in November on the Banks of the Greatest of the Great Lakes, are the kinds of people everyone else at the gym stares at with envy.

title: From a Prison Cell to the Red Carpet
description: Wheres Nadya?

title: In Paris, A Sexy New Swimming Hotel Is Making Waves
description: The just-opened Molitorhotel is making a splash (quite literally) in Paris this season. Even in its new incarnation as a nautically themed 124-room luxury hotel, the site of the mythic Piscine Molitor  a vintage Art Deco public swimming pool  hasnt entirely lost the aura of erotic possibility that made it beloved, in a tongue-in-cheek sort of way, by generations of Parisians. The three-story cement complex with sleek ocean-liner-like architecture and two pools  one indoor and heated, one outdoor  was originally designed by the architect Lucien Pollet and inaugurated in 1929 in the heart of the silk-stocking 16th Arrondissement, Pariss Upper East Side, by the American Olympic gold medalists Aileen Wiggin and Johnny Weissmuller  who spent a summer here working as a lifeguard and giving swimming lessons before he went on to win the role of Tarzan in the film of the same name a few years later.

title: The Parisian Life Beckons, Waiting to Become Unforgettable
description: In 1988, when American Ballet Theater debuted a new production of Leonide Massines Gat Parisienne, one of the most popular ballets of the 1940s and 50s, some people were shocked by the cartoonish sets by Zack Brown and the clashing colors in the costumes by Christian Lacroix. But the designers had the right idea. If a modern production of this comical character ballet is not to become a quaint evocation of mid-19th-century French cafe culture, it must not be afraid of being vulgar.

title: For Canness Man on the Red Carpet, a Fade-Out
description: CANNES, France  Each year, as stars ascend the red-carpeted steps here, a reserved gentleman in a bespoke Agns B tuxedo is there to receive them. He is Gilles Jacob, and after more than 35 years at the Cannes Film Festival, the last 15 as president, he is alighting from those steps and retiring.

title: Art School Creates a New Reality
description: Andy Warhol, who knocked painting off its pedestal by introducing it to mass production, is not the first person who might spring to mind as a defender of arts academic traditions, particularly fusty-sounding ones like cast drawing and anatomical study. But he was a classically trained draftsman. And in the late 1970s, he helped found what became the New York Academy of Art, a bastion of figurative training that was swimming decidedly against the current, even at a time when Neo-Expressionism had brought painting the human form back into vogue.

title: Store Openings and Fashion Events Starting the Week of May 22
description: Openings

title: Classics Help Broadway Rebound
description: Thanks to an unusual combination of established hits and whod-a-thunk-it crowd-pleasers from Shakespeare, Beckett and Pinter, Broadway has bounced back forcefully from the flops, flat ticket revenues and thin audiences that battered business a season earlier.

title: Icon, an L.G.B.T. Nightclub in Astoria, Queens
description: Is Astoria becoming the next Hells Kitchen? In the last year, three L.G.B.T. nightspots have popped up in this diversifying neighborhood of Queens, the latest being Icon. Opened in January by a longtime Astoria resident, Nick Lion, Icon occupies a former Greek bar that has been given a makeover, with Swarovski-bedazzled lamps, studded black banquettes and swirly wall accents. One thing missing are big TV screens. I dont want a Britney Spears video to be the star, he said. I want the crowd to be the main attraction.

title: U.S. Sends Troops to Chad to Aid Hunt for Nigerian Schoolgirls
description: WASHINGTON  The United States has sent 80 troops to Chad in Central Africa to support a growing international effort in neighboring Nigeria to help find and rescue the schoolgirls who were abducted by an Islamist extremist group last month, the White House said on Wednesday.

title: Pictures of the Day: Ukraine and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Ukraine, Sudan, Serbia and Palestine.

description: No question, danmei, or indulge in beauty, the erotic stories and manga that originated in Japan and have put down deep roots in China, can be strong stuff.

title: Web Retailer JD.coms I.P.O. Shows a Hunger for China
description: The biggest test yet of American investors appetite for a Chinese Internet company has passed with flying colors  and it doesnt involve the Alibaba Group, that countrys e-commerce giant.

title: Christie Renominates New Jerseys Chief Justice in Deal With Democrats
description: In a decision long anticipated as an indicator of his political fortunes, Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey renominated the chief justice of the states Supreme Court on Wednesday, despite his promises to remake what he has called an activist and liberal court.

title: Is a Chromebook All You Need?
description: Molly Wood reviews Googles Chromebooks, whose wide range of web apps and low price tags have helped the company take on big competitors in Apple and Windows.

title: Chromebooks Win Buyers Ready to Live in the Cloud
description: YOU have to hand it to Google: Its little hobbies sometimes have a way of taking off.

title: The Crumbling of the Republican Establishment
description: Those celebrating the victory of so-called establishment Republican candidates in Tuesdays congressional primaries should take a close look at how one of those victors casts his votes.

title: Conquering the Closet
description: On the household to-do list my wife and I update whenever were orbiting Neptune in our hovercraft, organize closets is right up there with hand-tune our unused piano and sort DVD collection by Rotten Tomato rating. But when we recently had friends over for dinner and I couldnt fit their coats into the entry hall closet, I figured I had to do something.

title: The Science Behind Overeating
Behind the Closet Door
description: Tools to make a daunting task less intimidating.

description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

title: Still a Nation of Immigrants
description: The American melting pot appears to be heating up again, and its ingredients have grown ever more varied.

title: Electricity Goes to Waste
description: Love the idea of composting but hate the thought of housing a mass of worms to do it? Food Cycle Science, a company that makes electric commercial composters that do not need invertebrates, now offers an attractive, convenient version for the home.

title: Sales at Doris Leslie Blau, Simon Pearce and Ethan Allen
description: All vintage and antique rugs are 30 percent off at Doris Leslie Blau, through Sunday (a late-19th-century Persian Tabriz rug, originally $20,000, is $14,000); 306 East 61st Street (Second Avenue), seventh floor, 212-586-5511, dorisleslieblau.com.

title: In the Houses Where He Lived
description: From the 1930s until his death in 1980, Cecil Beaton was a pivotal figure in design and fashion, thanks to his photography for Vogue and sets and costumes for My Fair Lady. There have been many exhibitions about his work, but none about how he lived. This will change Friday when Cecil Beaton at Home opens at the Salisbury Museum in Englands Wiltshire district. The exhibition will be on view through Sept. 19. For Beaton, two homes counted: his Wiltshire country estates Ashcombe, where he lived from 1930 to 1945, and Reddish, which he occupied from 1947 until his death. (The 1950s magazine ad, right, was photographed there.) The shows curator, Andrew Ginger, has recreated parts of two rooms from those houses, installing Beatons Circus Bed, complete with unicorns, sea horses and barley-twist posts. Information: salisburymuseum.org.uk. For a total Beaton immersion, head down the road to Cecil Beaton at Wilton, a show of his photos from the 1930s, which runs through Sept. 14. Information: tourism@wiltonhouse.com.

title: Because Buildings Need Seats
description: William Pedersen, 76, a founder of the architecture firm Kohn Pedersen Fox, has designed some of the worlds most notable skyscrapers, including the cluster of leaning towers under construction at Hudson Yards. Even so, he staffed his own booth at the recent International Contemporary Furniture Fair, presenting his new group of carbon-steel chairs that curve through space like line drawings. In what may look to the observer like a counterintuitive career move, Mr. Pedersen, after 50 years of designing buildings, is diversifying by taking on furniture. The line, called Loop de Loop after the stunts performed by small aircraft, includes a side chair, dining chair, chaise and lounge chair with ottoman. Eventually there will be a rocker. With their knit polyester mesh, they are for outdoor or indoor use. (This interview was edited and condensed.)

title: Spindle Doctor
description: The Bernhardt Furniture Company in Lenoir, N.C., celebrated its 125th anniversary (yes, it really is that old) by commissioning No Duchaufour-Lawrance (French), Ross Lovegrove (Welsh) and Jephson Robb (Scottish) to reimagine classic pieces of American furniture.

title: Pick a View, Any View
description: When Nina Monte and Harvey Karp first met, at a party in 1992, she mistook him for a nanny. Here was this good-looking, ponytailed, hippy-ish guy telling me he took care of our hosts child, she said. It didnt occur to me he was a doctor.

title: Seeking Balance on Mideast Visit, Pope Pleases Few
description: BETHLEHEM, West Bank  Pope Francis plans to give a strong show of support for a sovereign Palestinian state when he makes his first visit to the Holy Land this weekend, becoming the first pontiff to travel directly into the occupied West Bank rather than passing through Israel.

title: Ruby Beets Dives into Brooklyn
description: Ruby Beets has arrived in Brooklyn. The home dcor boutique, founded more than 20 years ago in the Hamptons, opened an outpost last week in Sunset Park, the first nonfood-related retail establishment to emerge in the developing Industry City complex.

title: Portuguese Design
description: LISBON  Portugal gets a lot of attention as a tourist destination, as the countrys faltering economy has made it more affordable than many other European destinations. And it turns out its not a bad place to shop for home furnishings, either.

title: Fish Need Trees, Too
description: AS a resident of Sitka, in southeast Alaska, Ive worked in the local commercial fishing industry on and off for the past 17 years. This summer Ill go out on the boat once more, in search of salmon, which have become one of the drivers of the regions economic recovery.

title: California Woman, Abducted at 15, Is Found After 10 Years
description: BELL GARDENS, Calif.  First, he drugged and kidnapped his girlfriends 15-year-old daughter, the police in Santa Ana, Calif., said. Later, he said that if she tried to get away, her family would be deported. Eventually, he forced her to marry him, and she had a baby.

title: How Arthur Gelb Helped Reinvent the Modern Times
description: Arthur Gelb, who died Tuesday at the age of 90, held many titles in his years with The Times. He was a critic, chief cultural correspondent, metropolitan editor, deputy managing editor and managing editor.

title: The Civil War and P.T.S.D.
description: Edson Bemis was a hard man to kill. Rebel soldiers tried three times, and three times they failed. At the Battle of Antietam, a musket ball ripped through his left arm. Two years later, in the horrible fighting in the Wilderness, he was shot in the abdomen, just above the groin. The ball was never extracted, remaining in his body until the day he died.

title: How the Poll Was Conducted
description: The New York Times/NY1/Siena College poll of New Yorks 13th Congressional District consists of telephone interviews conducted May 15 through 20 with 678 likely Democratic primary voters throughout that district.

title: Virtual Rift Leads to Legal Rift for Oculus and ZeniMax
description: A dispute over Oculus VR, the virtual reality start-up Facebook is buying for $2 billion, escalated on Wednesday, as ZeniMax Media said in a lawsuit that it has not been paid for its contributions to Oculuss virtual reality headset.

title: Full Results of The New York Times/NY1/Siena College Poll
description: Representative Charles B. Rangel holds a significant lead in the 13th Congressional District primary.

title: Rangel Has Modest Lead Over Main Challenger in Democratic Primary, Poll Finds
description: Charles B. Rangel, the scandal-scarred Harlem congressman seeking a 23rd term in office, holds a modest but meaningful lead in his Democratic primary battle against State Senator Adriano D. Espaillat, a Dominican-American who is hoping to harness the political ambitions of the districts surging Latino population, a New York Times/NY1/Siena College poll of likely voters has found.

title: An Indirect Path to Accuracy in Election Polling
description: Representative Charles Rangel of New York has a nine-point lead over his nearest primary challenger, in a new New York Times/NY1/Siena College poll of likely voters. And there is reason to think his odds of winning the nomination may be larger than that lead suggests.

title: Dinner Party Politics
description: What do you think the election results mean?

title: Depressed, but Not Ashamed
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich.  MOST of our closest friends didnt know that we struggled with depression. It just wasnt something we discussed with our high school classmates. We found that we both had taken Prozac only when one of us caught a glimpse of a prescription bottle in a suitcase during a journalism conference last November. For the first time, we openly discussed our feelings and our use of antidepressants with someone who could relate. We took a risk sharing our experiences with depression, but in our honesty, we found a support system. We knew we had to take the idea further.

title: No Runs Allowed, but Still No Wins for Cubs Samardzija
description: CHICAGO  What, exactly, does Jeff Samardzija have to do to win a game? Hit home runs? Throw 200 pitches? Rewrite the rule book?

title: Fatal Film Accident Prompts Wrongful Death Suit
description: LOS ANGELES  A legal fight over responsibility for a fatal film accident erupted on Wednesday as the parents of Sarah Jones, who was killed by a train on a movie set in February, sued a number of filmmakers, the CSX rail line, the Rayonier landowning company and others over the death.

title: Exploring the World, in New York
description: Marilynn K. Yee left Los Angeles to cover New York City during the chaos of the 1970s. Today, she retires as a staff photographer for The New York Times.

title: Grabbing the Spotlight
description: After walking the International Contemporary Furniture Fair, the annual showcase of new design that ended its 26th run at the Jacob K. Javits Convention Center on Tuesday, I have just one word to say. Are you listening?

title: A New Kind of Bachelorette?
Kerry Calls on Venezuela to Talk With Opposition
description: MEXICO CITY  Secretary of State John Kerry said on Wednesday that President Nicols Maduro of Venezuela had failed to negotiate in good faith with his political opponents and warned that the United States Congress was moving to legislate economic sanctions.

title: A TGI Fridays Makeover to Recapture the Social Crowd
description: SO raucous were the unattached young people at a sidewalk cafe on the corner of 63rd Street and First Avenue  as described in a 1966 article in The New York Times  that noise complaints culminated in a hearing at the citys Department of Consumer Affairs.

title: Legislation to Protect Against Patent Trolls Is Shelved
description: WASHINGTON  A yearlong effort to pass legislation protecting companies against so-called patent trolls was declared all but dead on Wednesday, when the bill was removed from the Senate Judiciary Committees agenda.

title: Ageless Veterans Are Still Giving Spurs Extra Kick
description: SAN ANTONIO  Despite appearances, it has never been easy. Tim Duncan, 38, boxes and swims in the off-season to maintain his fitness. Manu Ginobili, 36, eats his vegetables. Tony Parker, 32, tends to his sore left hamstring. There are so many bumps and bruises, the costs of playing a physical sport and the dangers of growing old.

title: The Grandchildren of Divorce
description: BOLINAS, CALIF.  Two years ago, my mother called.

title: U.S. Seeks Disclosure of All Fees Fliers Face
description: Airlines and travel agents will be required to list fees for services like checked bags, carry-ons and seat reservations so that travelers can compare fares more easily under a proposal announced by the Transportation Department on Wednesday.

title: U.S. Charges Egg Business and Owners
description: Federal prosecutors in Iowa on Wednesday brought felony charges stemming from a 2010 salmonella outbreak against the owners of one of the nations largest egg businesses and their company, Quality Egg L.L.C.

title: Fatal Shooting in Part of Bronx With Surge of Violence
description: Gunfire erupted just before 9 a.m. on Wednesday in a pocket of the Bronx that has been racked by violence this year. The body of a 45-year-old man lay on the asphalt alongside an elementary school as a van sped away.

title: Airbnb Will Hand Over Host Data to New York
description: Airbnb, the apartment sharing service, and New York law enforcement officials came to an agreement Wednesday after a dispute over rental data that lasted for the better part of a year.

title: Where Say Nothing Is Gospel, I.R.A. Victims Daughter Is Talking
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland  Helen McKendry was shopping recently when she spied a former neighbor who she is sure was one of the members of the Irish Republican Army who burst into her home 42 years ago and abducted her mother.

title: Inmate Attacks on Civilian Staff Climb at Rikers
description: Attacks on health care workers and other civilian staff members at Rikers Island have spiked over the last year, as officials have scaled back their use of punitive measures and expanded treatment for the swelling ranks of mentally ill inmates at the New York City jail complex.

title: Need Scholarship? Join Scrum
description: Last year, Brianna Danner, 17, had never even held a rugby ball. Fourteen months later, she is weighing scholarship offers from two colleges with premier rugby teams.

title: Troubles With Veterans Health Care
description: When America sends men and women to fight, it owes them an enduring debt, starting with competent and timely health care and disability benefits when they leave active duty. President Obama expressed outrage on Wednesday at recent charges of wrongdoing in the Department of Veterans Affairs health care system. He also dispatched his deputy chief of staff to Phoenix to assess explosive allegations that government workers falsified data to hide long wait times for veterans needing to see doctors.

title: The Senate Foolishly Rushes In
description: The Senate is unnecessarily rushing to vote on President Obamas nomination of David Barron for a seat on the United States Court of Appeals for the First Circuit in Boston, even though the public has yet to see documents written by Mr. Barron that have raised legitimate concern among civil liberties advocates on both the left and the right.

title: Testing Time for European Unity
description: The elections to the European Parliament, taking place Thursday through Sunday, are second only to Indias in size. Europe has 380 million registered voters, but turnout has been declining with every European Union parliamentary election since the first one in 1979, and it is likely to dip sharply below the 43 percent of registered voters in the last one in 2009.

title: Is It Better to Rent or Buy?
description: The choice between buying a home and renting one is among the biggest financial decisions that many adults make.

title: Man Who Thought He Was a Citizen Makes It Official
description: MIAMI  Nearly 50 years after he arrived here from Cuba, Mario Hernandez, a former federal employee and an Army veteran who for decades thought he was a United States citizen, and was never told otherwise, finally became one on Wednesday.

title: Chinas Global Search for Energy
description: Whether by diplomacy, investment or in extreme cases, force, China is going to great lengths to satisfy its growing hunger for energy to fuel its expanding car fleet and electrify its swelling cities.

title: For Sale: 20% Stake in Hedge Fund. Terms: Complicated.
description: It should be an easy sell.

title: Youths in Happy Video Find Irans Grip on Internet Is Still Tight
description: Six young Iranians who were arrested for posting a YouTube video of themselves dancing on Tehran rooftops to Happy, the globally infectious pop song, were released on bail on Wednesday as new details emerged of their possible mistreatment while incarcerated amid an outpouring of sympathy  including a subtly supportive Twitter post from Irans president.

title: A Teams Missing Letter
description: In probably no other sport is the team captain as revered as he is in hockey.

title: This Smart Girl Says Thank You
description: THU THUA, Vietnam  In 2011, a malnourished 14-year-old Vietnamese village girl named Phung arose in the wee hours each morning in a herculean struggle to get an education. After I wrote about her, readers responded with a torrent of $750,000 in donations to Room to Read, the aid organization helping her.

title: Detroit Pension Proposal Gets an Angry Reception
description: DETROIT  After weeks of heated negotiations with Detroit, the nations largest bankrupt city, lawyers for city retirees took the stage at a convention center downtown on Wednesday to face their fuming clients.

title: Iranians Detained for Happy Video Are Released on Bail
description: One of the stars of Happy in Tehran, an exuberant music video that offended the sensibilities of Irans conservative judiciary, reported on Instagram Wednesday that she was free, three days after the police had stormed into her apartment and carted her and five friends off to jail.

title: Solidarity Eludes Ukraine Separatist Groups as Presidential Election Nears
description: DONETSK, Ukraine  With a critical presidential election looming on Sunday, rifts are appearing among the patchwork of separatist groups that have seized control of public buildings in numerous cities in southeastern Ukraine.

title: Egyptian, 17, Seeks Asylum After Traveling to Intel Science Fair
description: LOS ANGELES  He was a teenage science prodigy, celebrated throughout Egypt as the little inventor, and his latest accomplishment was a trip to the United States to show off his original research at the prestigious Intel International Science and Engineering Fair.

title: Starboard Is Said to Plan Fight for Control of Dardens Board
description: Updated, 3:42 p.m. | Starboard Value officially unveiled its effort to unseat the entire Darden board.

title: Letter to Roger Goodell
description: Fifty members of the Senate signed the letter, circulated by Senator Maria Cantwell and endorsed by Senator Harry Reid, which urged the league to press the Washington Redskins to change the team name.

title: Hacking Charges Threaten Further Damage to Chinese-American Relations
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama was not involved in the decision to indict five members of the Peoples Liberation Army, an administration official said on Wednesday. But bringing the charges, the official said, was consistent with Mr. Obamas belief that the United States needed to adopt tougher measures after President Xi Jinping brushed off Mr. Obamas repeated demands that the Chinese government curb the hacking of American companies.

title: Supreme Court Halts Missouri Execution and Sends Case Back to Appeals Court
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.  The United States Supreme Court indefinitely halted the execution of a Missouri man on Wednesday and sent his case back to a federal appellate court to hear his appeal.

title: A Costly Blunder for French Rails
description: PARIS  Somewhere in France, a proud nation of ubiquitous trains and similarly ubiquitous state administrations, a railway bureaucrat is sweating.

title: Celebrating New Pier While Debating Parks Uses
description: At Brooklyn Bridge Park, there are terraces for barbecuing, paths for strolling and lawns for simply lying around and enjoying the views of Lower Manhattan, the East River and the Statue of Liberty. This week, more than six years after the park broke ground, a pier will be unveiled for activities that require more energy: five acres devoted to sports including pickup basketball games, roller-skating, bocce and kayaking.

title: Vigilance Urged for N.Y.U. After Abuses in Abu Dhabi
description: Following a report this week about mistreatment of workers who built New York Universitys new Abu Dhabi campus, N.Y.U. apologized and said it would work with its partner to investigate. The next day, the partner, the Abu Dhabi government, confirmed it would participate.

title: Rocky Renewal in Tibetan City
description: After a 2010 earthquake that left more than 100,000 people homeless in Yushu, Chinese efforts to rebuild the city have been incomplete and, many say, inequitable.

title: Prosecutors Investigating Grants for Health Site in Oregon
description: SEATTLE  Unworkable technology pushed Oregons health care exchange to the brink, making it the first state to abandon its self-administered system in favor of the federal exchange. But now prosecutors are following the money.

title: 4 Years After Quake, Some See a Resurrected Chinese City, Others Dashed Dreams
description: YUSHU, China  Gazing out over the gleaming heart of this resurrected city, the young Buddhist monk marveled at how quickly the Chinese government had rebuilt his hometown just four years after a calamitous earthquake shattered every last building, killing at least 3,000 people and leaving more than 100,000 others homeless.

title: For Christie, a Narrative Loses Currency
description: There may be some public employees right now who dont like me because Im prescribing tough medicine. But when the pension system gets well in a decade, Im going to be their favorite governor. Ill wait to get the thank-you notes then.

title: Starbucks Orderer
description: THURSDAYS PUZZLE  How long did you stare at your grid before you realized what the theme of Adam G. Perls puzzle was? I thought it was tricky and devious and ultimately brilliant.

title: One Step Forward, One Back for M.T.A. on Union Contracts
description: On the day the Metropolitan Transportation Authority officially resolved a long-running dispute with its largest transit union, its conflict with employees of the Long Island Rail Road appeared as intractable as ever.

title: Attack in Xinjiang Kills 31 and Injures 94
description: Explosions at a crowded market killed 31 people and injured 94 others on Thursday morning in Urumqi, the capital of the restive Xinjiang region of China, in what officials called a violent terrorist attack. It was the deadliest burst of violence this year, highlighting a growing challenge to Chinese rule in a region that is home to the mostly Muslim, Uighur ethnic group.

title: Media Companies Join to Extend the Brands of YouTube Stars
description: LOS ANGELES  Simon & Schuster is making a big bet on YouTube stars, an undertaking that could either open up a blockbuster new publishing market or reveal the limitations of Internet celebrity.

title: U.N. Will Weigh Asking Court to Investigate War Crimes in Syria
description: UNITED NATIONS  The Security Council is scheduled to vote Thursday on a resolution that would ask the International Criminal Court to investigate war crimes in Syria.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for May 21, 2014
History and Context of an Embattled Department of Veterans Affairs
description: WASHINGTON  The uproar over medical care for military veterans involves one of the nations biggest health care systems, a far-flung operation that treats 6.5 million people a year at 151 hospitals and 820 outpatient clinics, with more than 18,000 doctors and an annual budget of more than $57 billion.

title: Sante Kimes Dies in Prison at 79; Killed and Swindled With Her Son
description: Sante Kimes, the maternal side of a murderous mother-and-son grifter team, died on Monday in her prison cell in Westchester County, N.Y. She was 79.

title: U.N. Draft Resolution on Syria
description: The United Nations Security Council will vote Thursday on asking the International Criminal Court to investigate war crimes in Syria, but Russia is almost certain to veto the measure.

title: Appeals Court Orders Qaddafi Son Tried in Hague, Not Libya
description: PARIS  In the extended legal dispute over who has the right to prosecute a son of the former Libyan dictator Muammar el-Qaddafi, an appeals court ruled on Wednesday that the case should be tried, as planned, at the International Criminal Court in The Hague.

title: A National Team Without a Country
description: GORINCHEM, the Netherlands  The 18 Eritrean refugees arrived in this picturesque, blue-collar Dutch city 20 miles east of Rotterdam earlier this month looking for safety, security and, finally, after 18 months of fear and uncertainty in two refugee camps on two continents, a home.

title: Vincent Harding, 82, Civil Rights Author and Associate of Dr. King, Dies
description: Vincent Harding, a historian, author and activist who wrote one of the most polarizing speeches ever given by the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., in which Dr. King expressed ardent opposition to the Vietnam War, died on Monday in Philadelphia. He was 82.

title: Prominent Libyans Vow Support for General
description: TRIPOLI, Libya  A Libyan general who has led a violent campaign against Islamist militias and lawmakers drew prominent new supporters to his cause on Wednesday, including the countrys air force commander and its ambassador to the United Nations.

title: Rent or Buy? The Math Is Changing
description: Billy Gasparino and Jenna Dillon-Gasparino were savvy enough to wait out the housing boom of a decade ago as renters. Not until 2010, well into the bust, did they buy a house in the Venice neighborhood of Los Angeles, less than a mile from the beach, for $810,000.

title: Young Mets Career Line: 2 Solid Starts, 2 Losses
description: No matter what Jacob deGrom did Wednesday, it would be hard for him to top his major league debut. Last Thursday, he held the Yankees to one run in seven innings. He got a hit, mercifully ending the Mets pitchers hitless streak. And he improved as the game went on, showing maturity and poise and guts, keeping the Mets close in a 1-0 game.

title: 1-Year-Old Boy Falls to Death From Sixth-Floor Window in Brooklyn
description: A 1-year-old boy fell to his death from a sixth-floor window late Wednesday morning in Brooklyn.

title: With New Bill, Abortion Limits Spread in South
description: BATON ROUGE, La.  The Louisiana State Legislature on Wednesday passed a bill that could force three of the states five abortion clinics to close, echoing rules passed in Alabama, Mississippi and Texas and raising the possibility of drastically reduced access to abortion across a broad stretch of the South.

title: The Americans Recap: Season 2 Ends With an Answer and a Question
description: Recaps are all about spoilers, so if you havent seen the finale yet, you shouldnt be here, especially since I will begin with the biggest at the top. Stop reading if you dont want to know anything.

title: India: Former Delhi Leader Jailed in Defamation Case
description: Arvind Kejriwal, who as leader of the Aam Aadmi. or Common Man, Party briefly served last year as Delhis chief executive, was jailed on Wednesday after refusing to pay a bail bond of around $171. Mr. Kejriwal was charged with defamation after making accusations of corruption against Nitin Gadkari, the former chief of the Bharatiya Janata Party, which won parliamentary elections last week in a landslide. The news that Mr. Kejriwal was being held set off protests by his supporters outside the prison. Prashant Bhushan, now the Aam Aadmi leader, told reporters that Mr. Kejriwal considered the case to be politically based and refused to pay the bond as a matter of principle.

title: Conservatives Draft Manifesto to Help Republicans Attract Middle-Class Voters
description: WASHINGTON  Hoping to push their agenda ahead of the presidential election, a group of prominent conservatives has devised a 121-page policy manifesto aimed at giving the Republican Party a message that will attract some of the middle-class voters the party lost in recent White House races.

title: Quotation of the Day for Thursday, May 22, 2014
description: I am not prepared to choose between peace and justice.

title: U.S. Military Deaths in Afghanistan
description: The Department of Defense has identified 2,308 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations. It confirmed the death of the following American recently:

title: Dobrica Cosic, First Friend Then Foe of Serbias Milosevic, Dies at 92
description: Dobrica Cosic, a novelist and outspoken Serbian nationalist who served briefly as president of Yugoslavia in the early 1990s when its breakup in the midst of sectarian war was already underway, died on May 18 in Belgrade, the Serbian capital. He was 92.

title: F.B.I. Closes Investigation Into Guantnamo Defense Aide
description: WASHINGTON  An F.B.I. investigation into a member of a defense team for a Guantnamo Bay, Cuba, detainee accused of aiding the Sept. 11, 2001, terrorist attacks has been closed, a Justice Department official told a war-crimes court on Wednesday. The court filing is not yet public but was described by several people familiar with its contents.

title: U.S. Campaign Urges Gay Men to Talk About H.I.V.
description: The federal government began a major AIDS-related public service campaign aimed exclusively at gay men on Wednesday with a message urging them to talk more openly with one another about whether they are infected with H.I.V.

title: The Universal Appeal of the Ice Cream Cone
description: In this weekly series, Ts photo editors share the most compelling visual projects theyve discovered.

title: 4 Days, 11 Pounds
description: This article appeared in the May 25, 2014 issue of The New York Times Magazine.

title: Word of the Day | invective
description: invective \in-vek-tiv\ noun

title: Five Questions You Need to Ask Yourself Before Buying a Home
description: Editors note: This article was first published in 2014. Its general guidance, however, is still true.

title: Times Minute | Intervention in Nigeria
description: Also on the Minute, meet Tom Steyer, a left-wing version of the Koch Brothers, and Broadways big financial year.

title: Times Minute | U.S. in Nigeria Hunt
description: In the Video

title: Pushing Climate Change as an Issue This Year, but With an Eye on 2016
description: WASHINGTON  Tom Steyer, a billionaire environmental activist from California, wants to blast the issue of climate change to the front lines of American politics. His super PAC, NextGen Climate, will spend about $100 million this year to influence several Senate and governors races in which climate change could play a major role.

title: Citing N.B.A. Example, Senators Urge N.F.L. to Act on Redskins Name
description: WASHINGTON  Fifty members of the Senate have signed a letter to the N.F.L. to urge its leadership to press the Washington Redskins to change the team name in the aftermath of tough sanctions against the owner of the Los Angeles Clippers for racially charged comments.

title: Whats On Thursday
description: 4:30 P.M. (FX) X-MEN TAKEOVER THURSDAY With the release of X-Men: Days of Future Past on Friday, the network presents a trilogy of films about Marvels mutant superheroes, as well as interviews with cast members of the latest installment. The lineup begins with X-Men Origins: Wolverine (2009), followed by X-Men: The Last Stand (2006) at 7:15, and X-Men: First Class (2011) at 10. Hugh Jackman, above (who portrays Logan/Wolverine), Ellen Page (Kitty Pryde/Shadowcat), Patrick Stewart (Prof. Charles Xavier), James McAvoy (Charles Xavier), Michael Fassbender (Erik Lehnsherr/Magneto) and Peter Dinklage (Bolivar Trask) discuss the challenges facing the mutants of the future, how they prepare to play their characters and what they took away from the experience of making this latest film.

title: Corrections: May 22, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Q & A: Adam Segal on China, Cyberspies and the Moral High Ground
description: This week, the United States took its most aggressive step yet in trying to curb what it calls Chinese state-sponsored hacking attacks aimed at stealing trade secrets from American corporations. The Justice Department on Monday announced an indictment against five members of the Peoples Liberation Army accused of corporate cyberespionage. United States officials say the five men belong to Unit 61398, which operates out of an office tower on the outskirts of Shanghai.

title: China Plans Security Checks for Tech Firms After U.S. Indictments
description: HONG KONG  A Chinese state agency that threatened retaliation after the United States obtained indictments of  five Peoples Liberation Army officers on charges of cyberespionage announced plans on Thursday for tighter checks on Internet technology companies that do business in China.

title: Search for Missing Malaysia Airlines Plane Resumes
description: SYDNEY, Australia  The deep-sea underwater search for missing Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 resumed overnight on Thursday with a remote-controlled submersible scouring the seabed in an area where searchers still believe they detected acoustic signals from the jets flight data recorders.

title: Unilever to Sell Ragu and Bertolli Brands
description: LONDON  Unilever said on Thursday that it had agreed to sell its North American pasta sauce business under the Ragu and Bertolli brands to the Mizkan Group of Japan for $2.15 billion.

title: Test Yourself | English, May 22, 2014
description: Take the Quiz

title: Vivendi to Cut Stake in Video Game Maker Activision Blizzard
description: LONDON  The French media conglomerate Vivendi said on Thursday that it would sell half its stake in the video game publisher Activision Blizzard.

title: South Korean Leader Dismisses More Aides After Ferry Disaster
description: SEOUL, South Korea  President Park Geun-hyes office said on Thursday that she would replace the head of her governments intelligence agency and her top national security adviser as she struggled to overcome the political fallout of the sinking of a ferry that left more than 300 people dead or missing last month.

title: Fringe Parties May Gain in European Parliament Voting
description: BRUSSELS  Starting with Britain and the Netherlands, Europe began voting on Thursday for a new European Parliament, an election in which fringe parties of the right and left are expected to capitalize on low voter turnout and anger over immigration and anemic economies in the wake of the financial crisis.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Li Qualifies for U.S. Womens Open, at 11
description: In Li Qualifies for U.S. Womens Open, at 11, Lisa D. Mickey writes about a sixth-grade golfer.

title: Exploring the World, in New York
description: New York City, 1977. Fires raged through the Bronx. Son of Sam was on the loose. Murders were almost as common as street fights and Times Square was dirty, in every way possible.

title: What Would You Most Like to Learn to Cook or Bake?
description: The New York Times is developing a cooking site through which youll be able to search thousands of recipes and watch learn to cook videos.

title: Euro Zone Recovery Is Chugging Along, Driven by Germany, a Survey Says
description: PARIS  The euro zone economy is continuing its steady, albeit slow, expansion, according to a private sector report published on Thursday that showed Germany again driving the region.

title: New York Today: If Its Raining, It Must Be Thursday
description: Good morning, drizzly city.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Welcome to the Morning Briefing on NYT Now. (Download us for iPhone.)

title: Where You Live Matters for Lifesaving Liver Transplants
description: Broad-shouldered, deeply tanned and in his 50s, the farmer had ignored his worsening fatigue until the morning he realized that the whites of his eyes had turned yellow. His liver was failing, and when a specialist a few towns over informed him that he might not survive the year, he asked for the closest transplant center.

title: Myanmars Journalists Still at Risk
description: Among the many reasons to cheer when Myanmars military junta officially dissolved itself in 2011, beginning a transition to democracy and a more open society, was the end of official censorship. Journalists, including the legendary U Win Tin, who passed away last month and who was jailed for more than 19 years by the military junta, began working freely again. But freedom of the press, apparently, remains unacceptable to Myanmars government.

title: Thailands Military Stages Coup, Thwarting Populist Movement
description: BANGKOK  The Thai military seized control of the country on Thursday and detained at least 25 leading politicians in a culmination of months of maneuvering by the Bangkok establishment to sideline a populist movement that has won every national election since 2001.

title: Sony Says Shake-Up Is Pointing to Profit
description: Sonys chief executive vowed on Thursday to bring the electronics and entertainment company back to operating profit next year, but he offered few new strategies to put an end to the struggles that have fueled calls for its breakup.

title: I, Too, Will Stand Up for Tiananmen
description: SYDNEY, Australia  On May 6 three of my friends were arrested in Beijing on suspicion of picking quarrels and provoking trouble. They are Xu Youyu, a scholar and former researcher at the Chinese Academy of Social Sciences, Prof. Hao Jian of the Beijing Film Academy, and Pu Zhiqiang, a prominent human rights attorney.

title: Deutsche Bank Vows to Remain a Top 5 Investment Bank
description: FRANKFURT  Deutsche Bank is determined to remain among the top five investment banks in the world, its co-chief executives told shareholders on Thursday at a typically raucous annual meeting, even as other European lenders cut back their profitable but risky trading activities.

title: The Ethic of The Ethicist
description: Chuck Klosterman is an author, essayist and former rock critic. He writes The Ethicist, a weekly column for The Times Magazine. His responses have sometimes provoked outrage. Klosterman isnt surprised. We asked him to reflect on writing the column.

title: As the Delay Continues on Crowdfunding Rules, Concerns About Investor Risks Grow
description: It has been more than three months since the comment period on the Securities and Exchange Commissions proposed rules for equity crowdfunding ended, and with no sign of final regulations on the horizon, stakeholders are getting antsy.

title: One Womans Lonely Boycott of Amazon
description: Updated with new reporting on Amazons relationship with a book publisher, Hachette.

title: Julia Scott on Discovering What She Smells Like After 28 Soapless Days
description: For the Health Issue this week, Julia Scott tested the claim by AOBiome that a living bacterial skin tonic composed of billions of cultivated Nitrosomonas eutropha, an ammonia-oxidizing bacteria, would make her skin feel cleaner and more hydrated. Part of her experiment included these headshots she took of herself. Scott recently talked about what it was really like not to shower with soap products for a month.

title: 27 Captured by Taliban Amid Siege
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Taliban insurgents captured 27 of 40 police officers and officials who had taken refuge in a bunker, the government and the insurgents said on Thursday, as the Taliban continued to besiege a district government complex in a remote corner of northern Afghanistan that until last year had been considered one of the safest parts of the country.

title: Violence and Doubts About Credibility as a Troubled Ukraine Election Nears
description: DONETSK, Ukraine  When two armed men on Thursday afternoon barged into the small yellow schoolroom that has served as Inna Mashenskayas makeshift election office, she stood up straight and began to argue. But when one of them, wearing sunglasses, patted the knife that was hanging from his belt, she stopped talking and surrendered control of her polling center.

title: My No-Soap, No-Shampoo, Bacteria-Rich Hygiene Experiment
description: For most of my life, if Ive thought at all about the bacteria living on my skin, it has been while trying to scrub them away. But recently I spent four weeks rubbing them in. I was Subject 26 in testing a living bacterial skin tonic, developed by AOBiome, a biotech start-up in Cambridge, Mass. The tonic looks, feels and tastes like water, but each spray bottle of AO+ Refreshing Cosmetic Mist contains billions of cultivated Nitrosomonas eutropha, an ammonia-oxidizing bacteria (AOB) that is most commonly found in dirt and untreated water. AOBiome scientists hypothesize that it once lived happily on us too  before we started washing it away with soap and shampoo  acting as a built-in cleanser, deodorant, anti-inflammatory and immune booster by feeding on the ammonia in our sweat and converting it into nitrite and nitric oxide.

title: A Revolutionary Approach to Treating PTSD
description: Bessel van der Kolk sat cross-legged on an oversize pillow in the center of a smallish room overlooking the Pacific Ocean in Big Sur. He wore khaki pants, a blue fleece zip-up and square wire-rimmed glasses. His feet were bare. It was the third day of his workshop, Trauma Memory and Recovery of the Self, and 30 or so workshop participants  all of them trauma victims or trauma therapists  lined the rooms perimeter. They, too, sat barefoot on cushy pillows, eyeing van der Kolk, notebooks in hand. For two days, they had listened to his lectures on the social history, neurobiology and clinical realities of post-traumatic stress disorder and its lesser-known sibling, complex trauma. Now, finally, he was about to demonstrate an actual therapeutic technique, and his gaze was fixed on the subject of his experiment: a 36-year-old Iraq war veteran named Eugene, who sat directly across from van der Kolk, looking mournful and expectant.

title: A Thirst for China
description: American investors are hungry for a Chinese Internet company, and it isnt the Alibaba Group, Chinas e-commerce giant. Instead, JD.com, an online retailer aspiring to become that countrys answer to Amazon.com, exceeded expectations for its initial public offering on Wednesday, raising $1.78 billion, DealBooks Michael J. de la Merced writes. Even though the company has lost money for the last several years, its stock sale valued the company at $25.7 billion. Shares in JD.com will begin trading on the Nasdaq stock exchange on Thursday under the symbol JD.

title: Bloomberg, in Israel, Wins a $1 Million Prize, and Then Gives It Back
description: JERUSALEM  Two very, very rich Americans who recently left very, very high-profile jobs flew to Israel this week, each on a private plane. The less-rich one hosted a ceremony Thursday night where the more-rich one got a $1 million prize from a quartet of Russian oligarchs. Then he gave it back.

title: Eyes Everywhere
description: My position was straightforward, Glenn Greenwald writes. By ordering illegal eavesdropping, the president had committed crimes and should be held accountable for them. You break the law, you pay the price: Its that simple.

title: A Memorial to Personal Memory
description: Why do we memorialize Sept. 11?

title: Lost Without a Prayer
description: In the town of Mapleton, N.Y., all appears normal. The shops on the Main Street are open for business, and the neighborhoods are full of pristine homes and well-manicured front yards.

title: Sunday Night Dinner | Tasting Prunes New Menu
description: In this new food series, the writer Charlotte Druckman and the photographer Melanie Dunea visit New York City institutions and find out whats new with the people behind them.

title: Dominicans Begin to Flex Political Muscle
description: The namesake company of one of the wealthiest and most powerful families in the Dominican Republic is backing a multistate effort to register Dominican-Americans to vote and increase civic participation as Dominicans become more active in United States politics, especially in the Northeast.

title: Turf Wars Seen in Response to High-Frequency Trading
description: Attorney General Eric T. Schneiderman of New York has been vocal about his inquiry into aspects of high-frequency trading, which he calls insider trading 2.0.

title: What Ive Been Reading
description: Seems like this will be a biweekly rather than a weekly feature

title: Courtesy to the Hot-Dog Man
description: Dear Diary:

title: Hess to Sell Retail Arm to Marathon for $2.6 Billion
description: Updated, 9:03 a.m. | The Hess Corporation said on Thursday that it would sell its retail arm, including its familiar green-and-white gas stations, to Marathon Petroleum for $2.6 billion as it focuses on exploring and drilling for oil.

title: The Tennis Whisperer Makes His Mark at the Top
description: PARIS  Roland Garros Stadium is sweet-and-sour territory for Magnus Norman. It is the bustling place where he reached his only Grand Slam final, which he lost to Gustavo Kuerten despite saving 10 match points. It is where Normans prize pupil, Robin Soderling, became the only man to beat Rafael Nadal at the French Open and later reached two finals of his own, only to lose them both and eventually his health.

title: Some Privacy, Please? Facebook, Under Pressure, Gets the Message
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Do you know who can see what you are posting on Facebook, including your photos, birthday and personal cellphone number?

title: Daily Report: Facebook, in Shift, to Tighten Privacy Settings
description: Responding to business pressures and longstanding concerns that its privacy settings are too complicated, Facebook announced on Thursday that it has decided to give a privacy checkup to every one of its 1.28 billion users, Vindu Goel reports.

title: As Xi Speaks of Conciliation, Neighbors Voice Disquiet
description: Even as President Xi Jinping called this week for a new security concept for Asia, frictions between China and several of its neighbors underscored the challenges facing regional cooperation.

title: Sears Posts Worst Report of a Bad Lot in Retailing
description: The slide continued on Thursday for the deeply troubled Sears Holdings, whose dismal earnings report not only lacked signs of improvement but also laid bare how few options the company had left.

title: In Our Pages: May 23
description: A French television news report about the opera singer Maria Callas as she prepared for one of her signature roles, as Norma, from May 21, 1964.

title: I.S.S. Recommends Approval of Signets Bid for Zale
description: LONDON  The specialty jewelry retailer Signet Jewelers has gained the support of Institutional Shareholder Services, a leading proxy advisory services firm, in its bid to acquire a smaller rival, the Zale Corporation.

title: New York Stock Exchange Chief to Retire
description: Duncan L. Niederauer, the head of the New York Stock Exchange who negotiated a sale to an upstart exchange in Atlanta, will retire from his post earlier than expected.

title: Why Comparisons Between L.B.J. and Obama Can Mislead
description: Lyndon Johnson was not known as a great orator, but 50 years ago today he stood before graduates at the University of Michigan and described his vision of the Great Society  a more humane society that demands an end to poverty and racial injustice. In his efforts to achieve those goals he enacted programs like Medicare, food stamps and the Voting Rights Act, giving Johnson an image of legislative effectiveness that every president since has been measured against.

title: Pope Francis: We Are Custodians of Creation
description: Pope Francis is digging in on the role of faith and science in shaping a smooth human journey in this turbulent century of cresting appetites and global interconnection.

title: Leah Hager Cohen: By the Book
description: The author of No Book but the World says the last book that made her furious was The Da Vinci Code  At the end of every chapter, Id glance up and announce in increasingly disgusted tones: What schlock!

title: When the Waters Too Cold, Something Else to Dive Into
description: The shredder ate your A.T.M. card. You hear sirens because you butt-dialed 911. Your kid blew up canned cherries in the all-white kitchen because shes an aspiring filmmaker, and Steven Spielberg once did it  his mother got to like the bloodstained look. You finally bagged the neighborhood pest in a Havahart trap, and its the cutest, fluffiest thing, but you never want to hear the deranged hiss of an angry raccoon again.

title: They Share So Much. Perhaps a Tony?
description: Phoebe, the English ingnue of A Gentlemans Guide to Love & Murder, is lovely, noble and pious. She wears tightly corseted gowns and ribbon-trimmed hats. She loves Shakespeares sonnets.

title: Cannes Film Festival: A Belgian Thriller by Way of France
description: CANNES  On a rooftop terrace here this week, the actor and director Mathieu Amalric pulled a frayed robins-egg blue paperback out of his pocket. It was La Chambre Bleue, or The Blue Room, a thriller by Georges Simenon that the actor-director has just adapted for his film in competition here in the Un Certain Regard section.

title: British Gambling Company Bwin.Party Reaches Pact With U.S. Activist
description: The British online gambling company Bwin.Party has agreed to work with the activist investor Jason N. Ader, narrowly averting a battle at the annual meeting on Thursday.

title: Indias Import Limits on Gold Leave Jewelry Artisans Idle
description: NEW DELHI  The alleys of Reghar Pura, in the Karol Bagh district of the Indian capital, are choked with ramshackle buildings. Inside one of these, above a rickety spiral of stairs, a few goldsmiths squatted on the floor and concentrated on the delicate work laid out on wooden tables in front of them.

title: One Venerable Ad Trade Association Is Acquiring Another
description: Two marketing trade associations, each of them more than a century old, are joining forces.

title: Modi Exits Gujarat but His Influence Lives on in New Chief Minister
description: A day after Narendra Modi, Indias prime minister-elect, resigned as the chief minister of Gujarat to climb the higher echelons of power in New Delhi, one of his closest aides in his cabinet, Anandiben Patel, was sworn in as the first female chief minister of the state.

title: China and Russia Block Referral of Syria to Court
description: UNITED NATIONS  Beheadings, torture, aerial bombardments of schools and hospitals: The war in Syria, raging for more than three years with no sign of relief, represents the very excesses of war that the International Criminal Court was designed to take on.

title: All the Rage | Four Design Trends of the Moment, on View at Last Weekends International Contemporary Furniture Fair
description: Design insiders often take a jaundiced view of New Yorks International Contemporary Furniture Fair, the less glamorous cousin to the Salone del Mobile in Milan, which took over the Javits Center last weekend, with satellite operations around the city. But while it may be true that there is nothing new under the sun, a survey of items on view revealed four compelling trends worth noting, including a renewed interest in midcentury modern design; an emphasis on materials with warmth and character like copper, brass and marble; the bold use of basic geometric forms; and lighting that explored the limits and possibilities of new technology.

title: Geithner and Stewart Dont See Eye to Eye on The Daily Show
description: If there was one big takeaway from the former Treasury Secretary Timothy Geithners appearance on The Daily Show on Wednesday night, its that he and Jon Stewart do not agree on many things about the financial crisis.

title: Inspired by Dada, a Party for the Death of Privacy
description: The first sign that something was up was the tombstones that appeared around the city last week, from Times Square to Chelsea to Wall Street, proclaiming: RIP Privacy. It turned out that they were teasers for an unusual night of Dadaism that was held Saturday night, the details of which are now becoming known thanks to a video hosted by a puppet.

title: Raging Amid Tears in a Gathering Storm
description: The Normal Heart, Larry Kramers impassioned jaccuse about the early years of the AIDS crisis, is an entirely different thing from what it was when first staged as a play at the Public Theater in 1985. Back then, it was, above all, a political statement about continuing indifference toward the gathering storm of AIDS; those strident speeches that the central character, Ned Weeks, delivered onstage could just as appropriately have been shouted on the sidewalks outside City Hall or the White House.

title: To Greeks, the Parliamentary Vote in Europe Is a Test of Their Own Direction
description: ATHENS  This time, there are no predictions of doom, no anguished fretting out of Washington or Berlin that Greek national elections could unravel the European economic order. That was the mood in 2012, when the fate of the euro seemed to hang on the whims of an angry Greek electorate that, in the end, voted to stay the course in the euro zone.

title: Detroits Police Chief Stands His Ground
description: What, precisely, did Detroit police chief James Craig have in mind when he spoke favorably of citizens arming themselves as an extra protection against violence in his battered city? The chief wound up on the cover of a National Rifle Association magazine this month after he stressed his pro-gun position, telling Americas 1st Freedom: that he was celebrating the rise of good Americans, good Detroiters carrying firearms because they were fed up with being victims.

title: Poetry Pairing | Letter to Brooks: Spring Garden
description: This is our final Poetry Pairing of the school year. How do you use this feature? What would you like to see next year?

title: JD.com Has Rousing Start in Trading Debut
description: Updated, 4:04 p.m. | The online Chinese retailer JD.com started life as a publicly traded company with a rousing start, closing up 10 percent on the Nasdaq on Thursday. At that price, shareholders valued the company at more than $28.6 billion, more than other American technology names like Twitter and LinkedIn.

title: Modi Activists in Karnataka Tell Bangalore Writer to Go to Pakistan
description: At a book launch at a college in Bangalore last September, U. R. Ananthamurthy, an award-winning author of literature in the Kannada language of his home state of Karnataka, said to a crowd of several hundred that he did not want to live in a country ruled by Narendra Modi.

title: NATO Steps Back Into the U.S.S.R.
description: LONDON  The best line about NATO was always the simplest: If NATO is the answer, whats the question?

title: A Big Pile of Fantastic Ideas to Get Kids Outside Making and Doing This Summer
description: Its May, time for teachers to revisit their bookshelves and think about summer reading selections. This year, Im considering a different kind of summer reading for my kids, books that will inspire them to head outside and make, do and create. My younger son, Finn, likes these sorts of projects, and while I can provide him with scrap lumber, nails, a drill and some screws, he and I wanted to find some additional inspiration.

title: Despite Poor Governance, JD.com Is Fast Off the Block
description: JD.com has achieved a rich price despite poor governance. The company, Chinas second largest e-commerce group after Alibaba, priced its shares above the expected range on Wednesday, raising $1.8 billion.
