title: Striving for Wealth and Truth in China, in Face of Monolithic Government
description: Evan Osnos appears to be almost as entrepreneurial, intrepid and creative as the strivers whose linked portraits underpin his book Age of Ambition: Chasing Fortune, Truth, and Faith in the New China. During eight years of remarkable reporting from China, much of it for The New Yorker, Mr. Osnos ferreted out interesting people to interview, from the billionaire Queen of Trash Cheung Yan to a poet sweeping the street outside Mr. Osnoss home in Beijing. His network included the popular blogger Han Han, whose website has had more than a quarter of a billion visitors, and the dissident and Nobel Peace Prize winner Liu Xiaobo. Others were unknowns, like Michael, who hopes to make his fortune by writing English textbooks; his dreams and self-doubt capture Chinas historical moment.

title: Blood, Toil, Tears, Sweat and Talking Heads
description: It took NBC 26 episodes to cover just the maritime campaigns of World War II in the 1952 documentary Victory at Sea.

title: Drawn Back, Again and Again, to the Flame
description: The Essential Straight & Narrow, by the Mad Ones at the New Ohio Theater, is very funny. Then suddenly it isnt. Created by the company and directed by Lila Neugebauer, the show melds folk-rock, the game show The $10,000 Pyramid, schlocky cop dramas and the Nietzschean concept of the eternal return. Ingenious and tricksy, its story lines tantalize and confound. But just when youre ready to dismiss it as a postmodern goof, it shoots straight at your heart. With excellent aim.

title: A Citys Simple Joy
description: If there was ever a perfect warm-weather, holiday-weekend city sport, bocce may be it. It requires only a set of bocce balls, which are traditionally made of metal but come in a plastic version these days, and a flat, rectangular space to use as the court. The rules are complicated enough to keep the game interesting, but the skill is simple enough to require no athletic ability. As a bonus, it is a traditional Italian game, commonly played with one hand while the other holds an espresso or a glass of wine.

title: Doctors, Hospitals and Dollars
Delay Tests Video Game Developer
description: MONTREAL  Imagine living an all-consuming existence as a supremely intelligent yet vengeful, tormented computer hacker who is armed with the technology to control nearly anything and anyone.

title: Immigration Solutions
description: To the Editor:

title: A Bulls-Eye for Marketers
description: To the Editor:

title: Whats in a Book Blurb?
description: To the Editor:

title: Gay Chief Executives
description: To the Editor:

title: Working in Tobacco Fields
Rhinebeck Retreat Selects Musicals
description: Nine musicals have been selected for the 2014 Rhinebeck Writers Retreat, which provides a weeklong residency in Rhinebeck, N.Y, for the writing team behind each project. A total of 26 musical theater writers are to participate, including Mindi Dickstein (Little Women), Nathan Tysen (The Burnt Part Boys) and Peter Mills (Illyria). Among the works to be developed are Alexander Supertramp, by Janet Allard and Niko Tsakalakos, a musical based on Jon Krakauers book Into the Wild; Stillwater, a rock theater piece by John Jobson, Ryan McCall and Mr. Tysen, about the residents of a trailer park in Oklahoma; and At the Beck, by Chantal Bilodeau, Ms. Dickstein, and Peter Melnick, about two British girls who claim to have taken real pictures of fairies.

title: Its Unanimous!
description: The Thai military takes a poll on this weeks coup.

title: Q. and A.: Chan Koonchung on Tibet, Sex and Censorship
description: The shopkeeper at the small Hong Kong bookstore recognized the author Chan Koonchung right away. The Peoples Recreation Community  its initials are a play on Peoples Republic of China  specializes in books that are banned on the Chinese mainland, but not in the relatively free territory of Hong Kong. Mr. Chan found his own volumes on the shelf across from the cashier, while the shopkeeper brought over mugs of milk tea.

title: Dropped at Woodstock
description: UPDATE: Please click here for the Monday, May 26 Across Lite version of the puzzle.

title: A Film About Film Divides Cannes
description: CANNES, France  Theres a scene in Clouds of Sils Maria in which a young American played by Kristen Stewart delivers a beautifully sincere defense of blockbusters to a French star played by Juliette Binoche. Theyre talking about movies in a multilayered film from the French director Olivier Assayas that is itself partly an inquiry into cinema. The star, Maria Enders, has become famous in big movies, yet she also voices contempt for them. Given how closely Mr. Assayas cuts to a central tension that plays out yearly at the Cannes Film Festival  a temple of auteurist worship that rolls out the red carpet for industrial cinema  it isnt surprising that Sils Maria wasnt wholly embraced here.

title: A Late Rebound at USA-1 Trials in Phoenix
description: Teams led by Nick Nickell almost have a patent on late recoveries, snatching victory from apparent defeat.

title: For American Men, Long Road to Dominance
description: PARIS  Believe it or not, American mens tennis may not have struck bottom. Look at the once-dominant Australians, who have no men in the top 40 of the ATP rankings. Look, if you can bear it, at the once-dominant Swedes, who have no men in the top 300.

title: Bat Meets Crystal Ball as Jeters 4 Hits Belatedly Fulfill a Prediction
description: CHICAGO  Brian McCanns prediction was off by a day, but fairly clairvoyant nonetheless. On Saturday, he told Derek Jeter that Jeter would get four hits in that game.

title: I.R.S. Bars Employers From Dumping Workers Into Health Exchanges
description: WASHINGTON  Many employers had thought they could shift health costs to the government by sending their employees to a health insurance exchange with a tax-free contribution of cash to help pay premiums, but the Obama administration has squelched the idea in a new ruling. Such arrangements do not satisfy the health care law, the administration said, and employers may be subject to a tax penalty of $100 a day  or $36,500 a year  for each employee who goes into the individual marketplace.

title: Banner Day Disappoints Before Mets Win Game 2
description: Somber and quiet and shaking their heads, hordes of fans filed out of Citi Field and trudged toward the subway station. The second game of the days single-admission doubleheader was about to start, but they had better plans for the rest of their Sunday afternoon. The Mets had found a new way to lose, and their fans had seen enough.

title: Obama Surprises Troops in Afghanistan
description: President Obama lands in Afghanistan for a Memorial Day visit to thank troops who are preparing to withdraw after 13 years at war.

title: Jacobs Pillow Prize Is Announced
description: The contemporary choreographer John Heginbotham, above, will receive the eighth annual Jacobs Pillow Dance Award. Mr. Heginbotham is to accept the award, which comes with a cash prize of $25,000, on June 14, the opening night of this years Jacobs Pillow Dance Festival. His company, Dance Heginbotham, will also perform a new work called Chalk and Soot at the festival, from July 30 to Aug. 3. Jacobs Pillow, in Becket, Mass., established the award in 2007 to recognize outstanding contributions to dance. Previous recipients include last years winner, Michelle Dorrance; Crystal Pite; and Bill T. Jones.

title: Countdown to 2014 World Cup in Brazil: Day 18
description: The 2014 World Cup begins on June 12, when Brazil plays Croatia in the opening match. Reporters and editors for The Times will count down to the start of the tournament each day with a short capsule of news and interesting tidbits.

title: Ukraine Goes to the Polls
description: Ukrainian voters streamed to the polls on Sunday to replace their toppled president, Viktor F. Yanukovych.

title: Thank You for Being Expendable
description: YEARS after I first returned from Iraq and started having thoughts and visions of killing myself, Id call the Department of Veterans Affairs. They always put me on hold.

title: Notre Dames Goalie Emerges as Possible Answer to Dukes Versatile Offense
description: BALTIMORE  Duke needed eight playmakers, six goal scorers, five key defensemen and two goalies to beat Denver on Saturday and advance to the N.C.A.A. mens lacrosse title game for a third time in five seasons.

title: Adopt a Dog With a Southern Drawl
description: IF I could be reincarnated as anyone, Id pick my dog, Landon. He leads a charmed life. Most mornings he gets scrambled eggs for breakfast, which he prefers to hard-boiled. Every afternoon, he takes a long run. Landon sleeps with my husband and me  hes a 60-pound retriever mix, but seems to expand to five times that size in our bed. In summer, we take him on vacation to Maine, where he frolics on the beach. Not that he cares, but his picture has appeared in the online edition of Vogue.

title: When California Sang Country
description: LOS ANGELES  Even the vinyl addicts among us have to dig deep for Billy Mize.

title: Salvaging Steinbecks Vessel From a Little-Known Berth
description: PORT TOWNSEND, Wash.  A wooden fishing boat that John Steinbeck chartered in 1940 with a biologist friend, then wrote about in a story of their journey through the Sea of Cortez in Mexico, sits in sad, decaying splendor in a boatyard here, two hours northwest of Seattle.

title: A Mysterious Map of Louisiana
description: These days the intersection of cartography and Big Data is all the rage: Using information from the 2010 census, countless news outfits, including The New York Times, have created tools allowing readers to make customized maps of everything from trends in ethnic and racial composition to the dynamics of housing development. Indeed, we have come to expect that any large body of data will be visualized through maps and infographics. Such tools help to transform information into knowledge, and at their best allow us to see patterns that might otherwise be lost.

title: Star Trek Prop to Help Reading Rainbow Grow
description: LeVar Burton is leveraging a chance to wear the original Visor he sported as the character Geordi La Forge in Star Trek: The Next Generation in exchange for a donation to the actors more recent venture: an expansion of the revived Reading Rainbow brand that encourages children ages 3 to 9 to read.

title: Judging Spinoza
description: I.

title: Speaking the Language of Birds, and Bracing for Their Flocks of Visitors
description: At first light, the pink flamingos stretch their spindly legs, the Inca terns burst into flight and the penguins plunge into their pool. Soon, the air fills with squawks and honks, trills and warbles as hundreds of birds at the Bronx Zoo start their day.

title: Press Battle in Pakistan Feeds Into Larger Conflict: Government vs. Military
description: LONDON  For a moment, it seemed that a victor had emerged from Pakistans news media wars. After a month of mud-slinging between rival television stations, officials from the government media regulator announced last week that Geo News, the countrys most popular news channel, would immediately be closed.

title: No Time to Text? Say It With Stickers
description: On the messaging app Line, a late-afternoon conversation between colleagues might involve a series of colorful icons, or stickers  a way to invite someone out for a drink or to gently say no:

title: Slowed Elsewhere, Tea Party Still Wields Considerable Sway in Texas Races
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  This years Republican story line may be the declining fortunes of the Tea Party, but conservatives in Texas do not seem to have received the memo.

title: Lebanon Arrests Radical Cleric Who Backed Militants
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Lebanese security forces on Sunday arrested a radical Islamic cleric who was long prominent in Britain and was wanted here under a new security plan to curb violence in the northern city of Tripoli that has been exacerbated by the war in neighboring Syria.

title: Hospitals Look to Health Law, Cutting Charity
description: Hospital systems around the country have started scaling back financial assistance for lower- and middle-income people without health insurance, hoping to push them into signing up for coverage through the new online marketplaces created under the Affordable Care Act.

title: Europes Secret Success
description: SINTRA, Portugal  Ill be spending the next couple of days at a forum sponsored by the European Central Bank whose de facto topic  whatever it may say on the program  will be the destructive monetary muddle caused by the Continents premature adoption of a single currency. What makes the story even sadder is that Europes financial and macroeconomic woes have overshadowed its remarkable, unheralded longer-term success in an area in which it used to lag: job creation.

title: Clinton Lauds N.Y.U. Graduates, and Inquiry, in Speech
description: ABU DHABI, United Arab Emirates  Former President Bill Clinton said on Sunday that he believed that New York University and the Abu Dhabi government would conduct a thorough investigation into worker rights abuses at the universitys new campus here in the countrys capital.

title: Once Bustling, Syrias Fractured Railroad Is a Testament to Shattered Ambitions
description: DAMASCUS, Syria  For Younes al-Nasr, a lifelong train lover, the Hejaz railway station here in the heart of the Syrian capital is a repository of shelved ambitions.

title: Rebutting Mark Cuban on Bigotry
description: Lets assume, as we always should in the absence of evidence to the contrary, that Mark Cuban, the Dallas Mavericks owner, had good intentions when he confessed to Inc. magazine on Wednesday that he was bigoted.

title: Kings Leading a Series and Dictating Its Play
description: LOS ANGELES  While the counterpunching between the Los Angeles Kings and the Chicago Blackhawks has been hockeys answer to Hagler vs. Hearns, the Kings have gained an edge on the scorecard that may be wider than it seems.

title: A Banking Forum in Europe and a Raft of U.S. Economic Data
description: EUROPEAN CENTRAL BANK TO HOLD GLOBAL FORUM

title: Heat Rely on Cumulative Experience in the Fourth Quarters
description: MIAMI  Basketball players call it winning time, the last quarter in a game, when legs and minds are tired, when all the plays have been called and all the individual tricks and tendencies have been laid bare.

title: The Pitch of Americas Voice
description: Vladimir Putins aggressive return to Cold War propaganda is feeding congressional momentum for a bipartisan overhaul of Voice of America, the federal broadcast outlet that has long jockeyed between providing independent, credible news and meeting its statutory mission as official supporter of the United States. This is not always an easy balance, and a measure approved last month by the House Foreign Affairs Committee would explicitly tighten the definition of the V.O.A.s mission so that its news is consistent with and promotes the broad foreign policies of the United States.

title: Gov. Christies Pipeline
description: Three years ago, Gov. Chris Christie proposed a natural gas pipeline that would run right through the environmentally sensitive Pinelands of southern New Jersey. It was a faulty plan, and the guardians of that area  the Pinelands Commission  wisely rejected the pipeline in January. Now Mr. Christie and his allies are trying to pack the commission with people who will see things his way.

title: Evan Williams on Medium
description: Evan Williams, founder of Blogger and Twitter, talks to David Carr about his latest venture, Medium.

title: A Platform and Blogging Tool, Medium Charms Writers
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Evan Williams is at it again. Mr. Williams is sitting in an office here a mile up the road from Twitter, where he is a founder and is still a board member, working on Medium, an amorphous-sounding company that could be one more curio of the Internet age or might end up taking over the world.

title: Treasury Auctions for the Week of May 26
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes auctions of new three- and six-month bills on Tuesday, after the market closure on Memorial Day, as well as an additional auction of two-year notes on Tuesday. There will also be auctions of four-week bills, one-year bills, two-year floating rate notes and five-year notes on Wednesday, and seven-year notes on Thursday.

title: Even in a State With Restrictive Laws, Gunman Amassed Weapons and Ammunition
description: ISLA VISTA, Calif.  Even in California, with some of the strictest gun control laws in the country, Elliot O. Rodger was able to amass a stash of weapons and ammunition, despite having struggled with mental health issues for years.

title: Muslims and the N.Y.P.D.
description: New York Citys police commissioner, William Bratton, made the right decision last month when he said he would disband a unit used by his predecessor, Raymond Kelly, to spy on law-abiding Muslims as they worshiped or patronized businesses in their communities. Beyond proving useless for intelligence purposes, the Demographics Unit undermined the fight against terrorism by alienating Muslims who were understandably angry about being singled out, not for illegal conduct but because of their religious affiliation.

title: Options Dwindle for Bronx Residents Trying to Escape to the Movies
description: If the Bronx were a city, it would rank about sixth in population in the United States, its 1.4 million inhabitants making it near the same size as Philadelphia, Phoenix or San Antonio. But one glaring difference is especially relevant with the arrival of Memorial Day, the semiofficial start of the summer movie season: Film lovers there have to plan more and travel farther to see their favorite blockbuster.

title: The Economy, Explored on Film
description: LOS ANGELES  A new film series from Morgan Spurlock and the Microsoft co-founder Paul G. Allen boils down to this: Its the economy, stupid, and many Americans are stupid about the economy.

title: Big Travel Day? He Drove 906 Miles in 2 Circles
description: CONCORD, N.C.  The clock showed 3:17 p.m. when Kurt Buschs No. 26 Honda crossed the finish line at Indianapolis Motor Speedway. He had just completed the Indianapolis 500, racing 500 miles at more than 220 miles per hour in a grueling event that left his back and hands aching.

title: Music Data Analyst Turns Sights to Books
description: In 2009, Alexander S. White, a former Universal Music Group intern, co-founded a company called Next Big Sound that analyzed vast amounts of data about musicians  from Twitter activity to Wikipedia searches to radio appearances  and showed how it affected sales.

title: In East, Separatists and Fear Stop Voters
description: DONETSK, Ukraine  Standing in a small park and holding a Soviet flag, Nikolai Brilyov, an enthusiastic member of the breakaway Peoples Republic of Donetsk, spent Sunday immersed in civic duties. There was an oligarch to run out of town, and political rallies to attend. None of it, however, included voting in the presidential election.

title: Political Ad Man Finds the Personal in Democratic Hopefuls
description: WASHINGTON  Mark Putnam has convinced a Democratic political candidate to swim the Hudson River in February (Mayor Steven Fulop of Jersey City). He has cajoled one to sling luggage on the tarmac at the Baltimore-Washington airport (Senator Ben Cardin of Maryland). And more recently, he persuaded another to ride a snowmobile in subzero temperatures (Senator Mark Begich of Alaska).

title: In Courtrooms, a Crusade to Give the Flag Its Due
description: For more than 20 years, news organizations in New York City have relied on the chalk-smudged hands of Shirley Shepard and her daughter, Andrea, to draw high-profile courtroom scenes where cameras are forbidden.

title: Parents Nightmare: Futile Race to Stop Killings
description: It was Friday evening when the parents of Elliot O. Rodger clicked open the 140-page manifesto emailed to them from their son and learned of his plans for mass murder and suicide. Frightened and alarmed, they called 911 and then raced to Isla Vista, Calif., in separate cars from Los Angeles, desperate to stop him.

title: Insurers Once on the Fence Plan to Join Health Exchanges in 15
description: In a sign of the growing potential under the federal health care law, several insurers that have been sitting on the sidelines say they will sell policies on the new exchanges in the coming year, and others plan to expand their offerings to more states.

title: Rampage Victims Drawn to California Campus From Near and From Far
description: ISLA VISTA, Calif.  The first time that sheriffs deputies were called to the apartment of Elliot O. Rodger, the dispute seemed minor, almost laughable.

title: Popovich: Division III Coach at Heart
description: OKLAHOMA CITY  The euphoria had not yet worn off when Oliver Eslinger, the basketball coach at the California Institute of Technology, walked into his office a few days after his team had won a conference game for the first time in 26 years.

title: Detroit Plan to Profit on Water Looks Half Empty
description: FLINT, Mich.  As Detroit seeks to settle its debts and chart a viable course for the future, one of its best sources of revenue, clean water for sale, may be evaporating.

title: Mr. Schumer Backs a Bad Old Idea
description: Senator Charles Schumer of New York wants to outsource the collection of unpaid back taxes to private debt collectors, who would take a cut of the proceeds. The plan is basically a budget gimmick aimed at creating jobs at a handful of collection agencies, two in upstate New York.

title: Global Digital News Brands See Growth Opportunity in India
description: Newspaper is everywhere in India. Print readership, especially of the countrys vernacular press, is continuing to rise.

title: On Roller Skates in a Downpour
description: Dear Diary:

title: As Ballot Count Nears, Citys Teachers Debate Whether to Ratify Contract
description: Jake Rosen said he was not sure what to think. Between co-workers worrying about some of the proposed changes, and others glad for them, between online rants calling teachers greedy and others saying they were robbed, Mr. Rosen, a history teacher at Beacon High School in Manhattan, said he had no idea which box he would check when it was time to turn in his ballot for the new teachers contract.

title: Colleges Rattled as Obama Seeks Rating System
description: WASHINGTON  The college presidents were appalled. Not only had President Obama called for a government rating system for their schools, but now one of his top education officials was actually suggesting it would be as easy as evaluating a kitchen appliance.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for May 25, 2014
In Russia, Tune Changes About Leader in Ukraine
description: MOSCOW  Petro O. Poroshenko, the billionaire businessman who won Ukraines presidential election on Sunday, was portrayed last month in a bilious campaign profile on Russian television here as money-grubbing, devious, a radical sympathizer  in short, a run-of-the-mill Ukrainian politician to Russian eyes.

title: Popular Demand
description: Television still dominates the information landscape, with average weekly viewing by adults topping 27 hours. Usage holds across all ages, at 98 percent for 35-to-54-year-olds and those 55 and older, and 95 percent for people 18 to 24.

title: Beautiful Day at Citi Field, Except for Action on the Field
description: My dad called from Philadelphia late Sunday afternoon. He was leaving Citizens Bank Park, where Josh Beckett of the Los Angeles Dodgers had just pitched a no-hitter against the Phillies. For fans used to more mundane defeats, it was a good day.

title: Fantasia, Albino Burmese Python Who Inspired Absolute Awe, Dies at Staten Island Zoo
description: Like more than a few of the creatures who make their way to the citys institutions, the python known as New Yorks largest snake began public life as an oversize pet.

title: In Egyptian Town, Cheers for Sisi but Murmurs of Discontent
description: BANHA, Egypt  His face smiles down from campaign banners everywhere, but splashes of red paint have bloodied a few.

title: Memorial Day Holiday Service Changes
description: Memorial Day

title: Peace-Talk Critic Takes Lead in Colombia Presidential Vote
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  A harsh critic of peace talks between the Colombian government and the countrys largest rebel group led in presidential voting Sunday but lacked the majority needed to avoid a runoff.

title: Frank M. Woods, Vintner and Ambassador for Sonoma, Dies at 81
description: Frank M. Woods, who founded the Clos du Bois winery in Sonoma County, Calif., and was instrumental in raising the profile of that regions wines around the world, died on May 8 in San Francisco. He was 81.

title: Penny Dreadful Recap: Frankensteins Monster Wants a Partner. Now.
description: John Logan, the creator of Penny Dreadful, has a reputation for not repeating himself, with a resume that includes the screenplays to Rango, Gladiator and Hugo as well as this dependably lurid series. But in Resurrection, the third episode, Mr. Logan nods to another of his successes, the film adaptation of Sweeney Todd, even at the expense of historical accuracy.

title: How Nadal Dominates the French Open
description: Rafael Nadal has dominated the French Open as no man has ever dominated a Grand Slam tennis tournament.

title: Dog Reported Beaten to Death in Front of Owner in Beijing
description: City management officers in Beijing beat a small dog to death in front of his horrified owner, a Briton working at an international school in Beijing, over the weekend, a magazine reported. The officers, known as chengguan, who are a regular feature of Chinese news reports for using violence to enforce regulations like where fruit sellers can ply their trade, attacked the dog because the owner did not have registration papers for his pet, according to the magazine, The Beijinger.

title: First Win of Year for Johnson
description: CONCORD, N.C.  The six-time series champion Jimmie Johnson failed to win in the first 11 races of the Sprint Cup season. If his fans were panicked, Johnson surely wasnt.

title: Return of Brassard Proves Crucial
description: The puck, passed tape to tape from 100 feet away, reached Derick Brassards stick on the blue line.

title: Speaking Up About an Uncomfortable Condition
description: Bowels, especially those that dont function properly, are not a popular topic of conversation. Most of the 1.4 million Americans with inflammatory bowel disease  Crohns disease or ulcerative colitis  suffer in silence.

title: St. Louis Lifts Rangers in Overtime
description: Martin St. Louis added another chapter to his remarkable playoff journey with a goal in overtime Sunday to give the Rangers a 3-2 victory over the Montreal Canadiens, and a 3-1 lead in the best-of-seven Eastern Conference finals.

title: Whats On Monday
description: 9 P.M. (Lifetime) PETALS ON THE WIND (2014) This sequel to Flowers in the Attic (shown at 7) finds Cathy (Rose McIver), Christopher (Wyatt Nash) and Carrie (Bailey Buntain) Dollanganger struggling to put their sordid past behind them a decade after escaping from their grandparents attic. But forbidden desire isnt easily forgotten, and when tragedy strikes again, Cathy returns to Foxworth Hall to confront her grandmother (Ellen Burstyn) and seek revenge on her mother (Heather Graham, above).

title: With Ibaka Back in Lineup, Thunder Cut the Spurs Lead to a Game
description: OKLAHOMA CITY  Years from now, the story will no doubt have Serge Ibaka crawling off his death bed rather than the training table. He will have rescued a cat from a tree on the way to the arena and handed out free tickets at a homeless shelter.

title: Quotation of the Day for Monday, May 26, 2014
description: If you look around the world, there are very few political leaders who are relatively untainted. People want to believe there is somebody good and charismatic, and a good authority figure, out there.

title: Mass on Mount Zion Stirs Ancient Rivalries
description: JERUSALEM  The intimate Mass celebrated by Pope Francis on Monday in the Cenacle, the hall on Jerusalems Mount Zion venerated by Christians as the room of the Last Supper, capped a Holy Land pilgrimage meant to promote peace and tolerance.

title: Corrections: May 26, 2014
description: NATIONAL

title: Chinese Blogger Says He Was Fired After Meeting With Kerry
description: A Chinese blogger says he was fired from his job at one of Chinas leading Internet companies for his comments during a February meeting in Beijing with the American secretary of state, John Kerry.

title: Beijing Seems to Be Warming Toward Aung San Suu Kyi
description: After some courteous flirtation between the Chinese Communist Party and Daw Aung San Suu Kyi, a long-awaited visit by the Myanmar opposition leader to Beijing may be getting closer. The well-traveled Nobel Peace laureate has been to Western Europe, the United States and Australia, but not to China.

title: Pope Lays Wreath at Tomb of Zionisms Founder
description: JERUSALEM  A conflict largely defined by dueling narratives became a battle of competing imagery during Pope Francis sojourn through the Holy Land, with Palestinians and Israelis both seizing on the pontiffs strong symbolic gestures to promote their perspectives.

title: E.C.B. Plots Strategy for Staving Off Deflation
description: SINTRA, Portugal  The European Central Bank was basically intended to do one thing: keep inflation in a cage. But its mission has turned out to be a lot more complicated than that.

title: After Coup, General Vows to Create A Genuine Democracy in Thailand
description: BANGKOK  Thailands military junta said Monday that it would stay in power indefinitely and that its rule had been endorsed by King Bhumibol Adulyadej, the monarch for nearly seven decades who has semi-divine status in the country.

title: Ukraine Forces Appear to Oust Rebels From Airport in East
description: DONETSK, Ukraine  The new Ukrainian government struck the separatists in this eastern province with a major military offensive on Monday, battling them over an important provincial airport in ground fighting that lasted for hours. The rebels were left scattered and shaken, just one day after a successful national election they had tried to disrupt.

title: Pistorius Arrives at Hospital for Psychiatric Assessment
description: Oscar Pistorius traveled on Monday to a state psychiatric hospital in Pretoria for the first day of a mental health evaluation ordered last week by the judge at his murder trial.

title: Chinese Developers Fake Sphinx Has Egypt Seething
description: They say imitation is the sincerest form of flattery, but a Chinese replica of one of Egypts most famous icons has gone too far in the eyes of the Egyptian government.

title: Tiananmen Comment Eyed After Professors Microblog Vanishes
description: The popular microblog of a prominent nationalist professor at Peking University has been blocked, possibly in response to a comment he posted about the military suppression of the 1989 Tiananmen protest movement.

title: Brazil Is Tired of Being Scolded
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  By now, Brazil should probably have been grounded for life, without video games or dessert.

title: The Jewish Museum in Berlin
description: Images from the Jdisches Museum and the Memorial to the Murdered Jews of Europe in Berlin.

title: Bucking E.U. Tide, Italians Endorse Prime Minister
description: ROME  If there was one bright spot for mainstream political parties in the elections for the European Parliament, it came, to the surprise of many, in Italy, where Prime Minister Matteo Renzi and his Democratic Party received more than 40 percent of votes cast, a level no party has reached in any Italian election since 1958.

title: Voting Opens in Egyptian Election Lacking Suspense
description: CAIRO  Rasha Hazem has brought her two daughters to 10 national votes in the last three years, letting the girls ink their own fingers each time to practice at democracy.

title: Maintaining a Classical-Music Miracle in Cleveland
description: CLEVELAND  When Milton Maltz looked down from his box seat in Severance Hall  the stately home of the Cleveland Orchestra  he used to fear for its future. I saw gray hair and no hair, said the longtime orchestra benefactor. And I said, Where are the young people?

title: Firefighters Salvage Most of Glasgow School of Art
description: LONDON  Firefighters in Scotland were able to salvage most of the Glasgow School of Art from a fire last week, except for its iconic library located at the top of the building, said Duncan McKenzie,a press officer for the Scottish Fire and Rescue Service on Monday. The cause of the fire, which began on Friday and was extinguished a day later, remained unknown, he said.

title: Renovation and Controversy at the Roof of the World
description: Four years and $7.2 billion later, Yushu, a city high on the Tibetan Plateau that was leveled by a calamitous earthquake, has been largely made whole, as I reported from there recently. There are thousands of new homes, dozens of schools and impressive-looking museums. The reconstruction effort was made all the more challenging by the citys isolation and thin air.

title: Beijing Levels New Attack at U.S. Cyber-Spying
description: A week after United States prosecutors  indicted  five Peoples Liberation Army officers on charges of cyber-theft, a Chinese government agency has issued its own lengthy, political indictment of American cyber-espionage, accusing the Obama administration of spying on the Internet on a scale far greater than that of other countries.

title: Populists Rise in Europe Vote Shakes Leaders
description: BRUSSELS  An angry eruption of populist insurgency in the elections for the European Parliament rippled across the Continent on Monday, unnerving the political establishment and calling into question the very institutions and assumptions at the heart of Europes post-World War II order.

title: Astrologers Check Modis Stars to Offer Advice to New Prime Minister
description: NEW DELHI  Before the parliamentary elections began in April, opinion polls had pointed to a likely victory for the Bharatiya Janata Party and its candidate for prime minister, Narendra Modi.

title: Cannes Film Festival 2014, Part II
description: Scenes from the Cannes Film Festival photo diary of Benot Peverelli.

title: Mad Men Recap: In the Season 7 Finale, Small Steps and Great Leaps
description: Season 7, Episode 7, FinaleWhen Don and Peggy danced cheek-to-chest to My Way at the end of last weeks Mad Men, it was the capper to an episode so thoroughly satisfying it couldnt help but make the shows most diehard fans worry. Already, the final season had been broken into two  for network strategy, not artistic integrity or audience demand  and plenty fretted that it could be followed only by a plot-heavy teaser setting up the real final season: the seven episodes that will run sometime in 2015.

title: After Much Talk, Rangers Quiet Canadiens With Their Play
description: Montreal Coach Michel Therriens recent bravado was missing when he met the news media Sunday night after Martin St. Louis and the Rangers put the Canadiens on the verge of elimination.

title: In Our Pages: May 27
description: A French television news report about works on the Moselle Canal, hailed as an achievement in European cooperation in 1964. (From the archives of Frances National Audiovisual Institute)

title: Modi Is Sworn In as Prime Minister of India
description: Narendra Modi became Indias 14th prime minister on Monday, taking the oath of office and addressing foreign dignitaries, supporters of his party, political rivals and corporate leaders in front of the presidential palace in New Delhi.

title: After Major Title, Wawrinka Exits in Paris Stunner
description: PARIS  Before the French Open began, Stan Wawrinka was asked how different it was to enter a major after winning one, as he did at the Australian Open in January.

title: Thomas Piketty and Spreadsheets
description: Like Carmen Reinhart and Kenneth Rogoff before him, Thomas Piketty has had questions  raised about his analysis; in his case, his work on wealth inequality. Though I cant knowledgeably comment on the questions or the analysis, I can comment on the technology that Ms. Reinhardt, Mr. Rogoff and Mr. Piketty chose to do their work: the spreadsheet. This choice can increase the chances of error in complex analysis, but it also can make finding errors by nonexperts easier.

title: In Eighteen Hundred Sixty Four the Burying Began  Arlington Cemetery at 150
description: Where will they go when theres no more room in Arlington?

title: Pfizer Abandons Bid for AstraZeneca
description: Updated, 9:36 p.m. | On the final day for Pfizer to decide whether to abandon the plan, it said it did not intend to make an offer for AstraZeneca. Last week, the British company rejected what Pfizer had called its final offer. The cash-and-stock bid, which valued AstraZeneca at about $119 billion, would have created the worlds largest drug company.

title: Ant-Man Movie Loses Its Director
description: The creative team of Ant-Man, the Marvel movie based on that size-shifting superhero, has gotten a bit smaller. Marvel Studios announced that Edgar Wright, the British director of Scott Pilgrim vs. the World and Shaun of the Dead, would no longer be directing Ant-Man, about a costumed adventurer who can reduce himself to microscopic size and communicate with insects.

title: Members of Japanese Pop Group Are Attacked
description: The Japanese pop group AKB48 canceled planned appearances on Monday after two of its band members were attacked at an event on Sunday, The Associated Press reported.

title: Selling Democrats in Red States
description: Mark Putnam specializes in emotionally appealing TV ads for Democrats trying to get re-elected in primarily Republican states. Ken Goldstein, a professor of politics, explains why they work.

title: European Green Lanterns
description: Sitting in a room listening to EU officials reacting to the European Parliament elections  and it seems to me that theyre deep in denial. Barroso just declared that the euro had nothing to do with the crisis, that it was all failed policies at the national level; a few minutes ago he said that Europes real problem is a lack of political will.

title: Health Care Cost-Sharing Works  Up to a Point
description: My colleague Aaron Carroll wrote last week that directly charging consumers for part of their health care costs (the practice known as cost-sharing) can harm the health of poorer or sicker people. But for the rest of us, it seems to reduce spending without harming health. This is the basic conclusion of a famous 1970s experiment funded by the RAND Corporation that randomly assigned families to different levels of responsibility for medical costs.

title: Turbines Popping Up on New York Roofs, Along With Questions of Efficiency
description: A dozen construction workers gathered around a flatbed truck in Long Island City, Queens, one recent Tuesday, marveling at the final piece of a new 15-story apartment building they had just finished assembling. As a mobile crane hoisted the 20-foot-long black contraption over Pearson Street, many of the workers used their phones to film its ascent.

title: Arcade Fire Addresses Criticism of Video With Transgender Character
description: The rock group Arcade Fire has responded to criticism of a recent video that some viewers felt was insensitive to transgender people, saying that the band put careful consideration into casting and creating the video.

title: Dave Aucklys Crunched Charms
description: Our challenge this week was suggested by Kansas State professor of mathematics Dave Auckly. Dr. Auckly was inspired to create this puzzle while writing his recent paper Two-Fold Branched Covers, which appears in the current issue of the Journal of Knot Theory and its Ramifications.

title: Victoria & Albert Museum Starts Rapid Response Collecting
description: LONDON  Museums tend to take the long view when it comes to acquiring works, but the Victoria & Albert Museum here has announced that a new gallery opening this summer will be dedicated to rapid response collecting. That means the kind of items that can mostly be bought without having an acquisitions committee meeting.

title: Technology Companies Are Pressing Congress to Bolster Privacy Protections
description: WASHINGTON  A law that allows the government to read email and cloud-stored data over six months old without a search warrant is under attack from technology companies, trade associations and lobbying groups, which are pressing Congress to tighten privacy protections. Federal investigators have used the law to view content hosted by third-party providers for civil and criminal lawsuits, in some cases without giving notice to the individual being investigated.

title: Grilled Gorgonzola and Beet Green Sandwich
description: This dish is the one that inspired me to devote a week of Recipes for Health to toaster-oven vegetable and grilled cheese sandwiches. I made it one night after a day preparing enough quiche to feed 80 for a book signing. When I got home I had still more quiches to make in my own kitchen, and the last thing I wanted to do was cook dinner for myself.

title: Grilled Feta and Roasted Squash Sandwich
description: I had a hunk of butternut squash lingering in my refrigerator, and it turned out to be the perfect ingredient for a grilled cheese and vegetable sandwich. I roasted it to bring out its sweetness, and paired it with chopped fresh sage, my favorite herb to use with winter squash. The rest came together quite naturally. The sweet and earthy flavors against the salty feta are perfect. Youll have more mashed roasted squash than you need for one sandwich. Use it in another, or freeze it for another night when youre too tired to cook.

title: Grilled Goat Cheese and Broccoli Sandwich
description: Ive been finding all sorts of uses for finely chopped broccoli crowns lately (see my burgers from a couple of weeks ago). I make a broccoli and goat cheese spread for this sandwich. I briefly steam the broccoli, chop it finely and mash it with the goat cheese. Then I spread it on country bread, sprinkle with the nut and spice mix known as dukkah and top with the other slice of bread. The dukkah adds the surprise touch. Youll only use half the chopped steamed broccoli in one sandwich. But youll want to use up the rest in another.

title: Roasted Mushroom and Gruyre Sandwich
description: For this sandwich, you can also pan-fry the mushrooms, which give this sandwich a somewhat meaty quality. But in this case I used the toaster oven to roast the mushrooms. Youll need only half of the roasted mushrooms for 1 sandwich but youll find a good use for the rest of them, Im sure.

title: Grilled Goat Cheese, Roasted Pepper, and Greens Sandwich
description: The title of this recipe was getting very long, so I left the last option  roasted artichoke hearts  out of it. I included them in my sandwich because I had some shriveling artichokes in my produce bin (along with the shriveling red pepper I used) and it didnt take very long to trim and roast them. But its not a must; the peppers and goat cheese with the greens are what really stand out. I stir everything together and spread it on the bread. Its always a good idea to have a roasted pepper on hand for quick dinners like this.

title: Herb Jeffries, Bronze Buckaroo of Song and Screen, Dies at 100 (or So)
description: Herb Jeffries, who sang with Duke Ellington and starred in early black westerns as a singing cowboy known as the Bronze Buckaroo  a nickname that evoked his malleable racial identity  died on Sunday in West Hills, Calif. He was believed to be 100.

title: Podcast: Crowd-Constructing Retinas, World Science Festival, Genetics of Beer
description: Sebastian Seung wants you to help trace the connections in a mouses eye  a step toward understanding its brain, and ours. The World Science Festival opens in New York City this week and theres a little something for every mind. To understand why beer varies in taste, you need to know its yeasts.

title: Strange Brews: The Genes of Craft Beer
description: SAN DIEGO  Troels Prahl, a brewer and microbiologist at the Southern California yeast distributor White Labs, sits at his companys tasting room bar with four half-pints of beer. He describes each between thoughtful sips.

title: Image of the Day: May 26
Obama, Honoring the Fallen, Says V.A. Problems Must Be Faced
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama, just back from a surprise visit to the troops in Afghanistan, honored Americas fallen warriors in a solemn Memorial Day ceremony on Monday and acknowledged the need to confront the widening scandal at the nations veterans hospitals.

title: E.U. Debates Which Nation Will Regulate Web Privacy
description: LONDON  The new European Parliament that was voted into office over the weekend, despite having a different political makeup, is widely expected to reach a final agreement this year on stricter online privacy rules that have long been in the works.

title: Guarding Against Disease Among Pilgrims to Mecca
description: Going all the way back to a malaria epidemic in A.D. 632, the annual Muslim pilgrimage to Mecca has been vulnerable to infectious disease. Last year the number of pilgrims fell below two million, from the expected three million, because of fears over the Middle East respiratory syndrome virus, or MERS.

title: Welcoming the Newly Discovered
description: Amid the discouraging headlines about the extinction of wildlife species around the world, there is this bright spot: So many new species of animals and plants are discovered every year that no one knows the number.

title: U.S. Doctor Is Killed by Gunman in Pakistan
description: LAHORE, Pakistan  An American doctor volunteering at a hospital in eastern Pakistan was shot to death on Monday in front of his wife and 3-year-old son in the latest attack on a follower of the minority Ahmadi faith at a time of rising intolerance across the country.

title: An Amphibians Best Friend
description: Darrel R. Frost, the chief herpetology curator at the American Museum of Natural History, has done fieldwork in Ethiopia, Guatemala, Mexico, Namibia, Peru, South Africa and Vietnam. He is also a sort of gatekeeper for amphibians.

title: Veterans Fire Back at Letter by Senator
description: WASHINGTON  An open letter from a senior Republican senator to the nations veterans in which he castigates the leadership of veterans organizations prompted a brutal war of words over the Memorial Day weekend, including a promise from the Veterans of Foreign Wars that its hat in hand approach to Congress will turn more combative.

title: Finding Lightness in the Dark
description: Life without sight seems unimaginably bleak to the sighted. No matter that literate guides from Diderot to Oliver Sacks have confirmed that the blind thrive in their separate reality; the gulf between the light world and the dark one persists.

title: How to Win the Lottery (Happily)
description: If you have won the lottery, or if you plan to do so, please keep reading this column. The information is vital not just to your happiness but also to the progress of social science.

title: Freuds Intellectual Wellspring
description: Becoming Freud: The Making of a Psychoanalyst, by the English psychoanalyst, editor and writer Adam Phillips, is about the first 50 years of Freuds 83-year life. This short, dense book is partly a group of abbreviated biographical commentaries, partly about Freuds career and writings until 1906. It uses both ordinary language and literary terminology to replace traditional psychoanalytic terms and jargon, although Mr. Phillipss understanding and theorizing are familiar and generally conformable. It is also a less-than-perfect performance.

title: Young, but Willing to Take On a Challenge
description: The gifted, hard-working and game musicians of the New York Youth Symphony have played some formidable scores over the years, even Mahlers mighty Sixth Symphony. In some ways, though, Coplands Symphony No. 3 is harder to pull off in performance than many pieces that may sound a lot more difficult.

title: Fear Persists in a Divided Ukraine
description: In eastern Ukraine, fear of armed separatists led to low voter turnout in the election that propelled Petro O. Poroshenko to victory as the president-elect.

title: Syndergaard, a Top Prospect, Is Put on the Disabled List
description: Noah Syndergaard, the Mets top pitching prospect, was placed on the disabled list with a mild flexor-pronator strain in his arm, the team said Monday.

title: Look Back, in Danger
description: Peter van Agtmaels new book is a personal look at Americas recent wars, as well as his own struggles to experience and explain conflict.

title: Jordan Expels Syrias Ambassador
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Jordan ordered Syrias ambassador to leave the country within 24 hours on Monday after accusing him of repeated insults to Jordan and its leadership, institutions and citizens.

title: Protecting Newborns Against Whooping Cough
description: All pregnant women are advised to get the Tdap vaccine, which protects against tetanus, diphtheria and pertussis, or whooping cough. A small study suggests the vaccine may have benefits for newborns as well.

title: An Alien In His Body
description: Gideon Glick talks about playing Matthew, a chronically anxious 19-year-old who finds refuge in the grungy office of a newsletter aimed at long-haul truckers, in the play The Few.

title: Vision Training to Boost Sports Performance
description: The baseball hurtles toward the batter, and he must decide from its rotation whether its a fastball worth a swing or a slider about to drop out of the strike zone.

title: Hunter-Reay Takes Indy 500 Win; Johnsons Winless Streak Ends
description: Ryan Hunter-Reay made a breathtaking pass of Helio Castroneves with one lap to go and held on to win Sunday in one of the closest and fastest Indianapolis 500 races ever.

title: Ukraines Next President Vows to Restore Order and Mend Russia Ties
description: KIEV, Ukraine  The president-elect of Ukraine, Petro O. Poroshenko, vowed on Monday to restore order in the countrys east, which is besieged by pro-Russian separatist violence, but said he would not negotiate with armed rebels and instead would demand swifter results from a military campaign that has achieved only limited success.

title: Pain Medications Can Lose Their Punch
description: Q. WHY WOULD A PAIN MEDICATION LOSE ITS EFFICACY AFTER WORKING WELL FOR SEVERAL YEARS?

title: Pope Makes Plea for Peace
description: Francis made his first visit to the Holy Land, making strong symbolic gestures to promote the perspectives of the Palestinian and Israeli leaderships.

title: Reactions
description: Climate Change

title: Those Mannerisms, Not So Off-Putting Now
description: Its hard to imagine that the word yeah has ever yielded more laughs or more heartbreak than it does in the Off Broadway drama The Few, as performed by the actor Gideon Glick.

title: Candidates Vote in Egyptian Elections
description: Abdel Fattah el-Sisi, a former army field marshal, and his sole opponent, Hamdeen Sabahi, cast their ballots in the presidential elections.

title: Waggling Bees Give Their Verdict on a Landscape
description: European officials have spent more than $56 billion over the past decade in a program to mitigate landscape change and encourage environmentally friendly practices by farmers. But there is little evidence on how effective these vast expenditures have been. So researchers at the University of Sussex in Brighton, England, decided to seek the opinion of some discriminating judges of environmental quality: bees.

title: Barbara Walters Gives Archives to Sarah Lawrence College
description: Barbara Walters may no longer be on view to television audiences on a regular basis, but some day it will be possible to review the materials she accumulated in her pioneering journalism career with 20/20 hindsight (give or take the prescription in your corrective lenses).

title: Lessons of Old Are Still in the Air at the School of American Ballet
description: How does a teenager turn into a cowboy at the School of American Ballet? Its all in the chest.

title: Duke Holds Off Notre Dame to Win Third Lacrosse Title in Five Years
description: BALTIMORE  After 59 minutes, the N.C.A.A. mens lacrosse championship was, in essence, coming down to a face-off, and hobbling in a hurry down Dukes sideline on crutches, his right leg wrapped in a black cast, was Josh Dionne.

title: A Diverted Flight Offers Lessons on Keeping Cool
description: I DO a lot of international travel. I used to be annoyed by long flights, and now I look forward to them since I have time to read, work or catch up on some TV I never get to watch, like Game of Thrones. I travel so much, I blew through three seasons and am now caught up with Season 4.

title: De Blasio, at Memorial Day Events, Pays Tribute to Veterans
description: In a day of honoring the fallen, Mayor Bill de Blasio focused on veterans, noting in two emotional speeches that through their stories and tributes they kept alive the memories of those who died at war.

title: Meeting Rooms Past the Gates
description: About once a month, Therese Hampton flies from Portland, Ore., where her home office is based, to the Seattle-Tacoma International Airport, a 35-minute flight, to meet with co-workers.

title: Podcast: Science in the City
description: The World Science Festival opens in New York City this week and theres a little something for every mind.

title: Science Events: Folded Paper, Kitchen Science and the World Science Festival
description: June events at the intersection of science and culture.

title: Citizen Neuroscience
description: Crowd-sourced science has exploded in recent years. An Internet game called Eyewire, from Sebastian Seungs lab at M.I.T., asks volunteers to trace the fine details of neurons.

title: Podcast: Crowd-Constructing Retinas
description: Sebastian Seung wants you to help trace the connections in a mouses eye  a step toward understanding its brain, and ours.

title: Recruiting Help: Gamers
description: Crowd-sourced science has exploded in recent years. Foldit enlists users to help solve scientific puzzles such as how proteins are put together. Zooniverse hosts dozens of projects, including searching for planets and identifying images of animals caught on automatic cameras.

title: All Circuits Are Busy
description: H. Sebastian Seung is a prophet of the connectome, the wiring diagram of the brain. In a popular book, debates and public talks he has argued that in that wiring lies each persons identity.

title: No Real Hurry to Tell the Joke
description: Abbott set up Costello, and Burns relied on Gracie to finish the joke, but Bob Newhart is the rare straight man who gets laughs all on his own.

title: Information Not on the Label
description: If you want to know whether the bread youre about to buy was sweetened with corn syrup, you can check the label. The same is true if youre concerned about preservatives, caramel coloring or artificial flavoring. By law, all of these ingredients must be listed on food labels.

title: Behind the Cover Story: Michael Behar on Star Trek, Acupuncture and Bioelectronics
description: Michael Behar, a science and technology writer, wrote the May 25 cover story about the emerging field of bioelectronics.

title: Southern Rock, Proudly Revised
description: From Lynyrd Skynyrd to the Black Crowes to the Drive-By Truckers, Southern rockers have been acutely self-conscious about where they come from, writing songs steeped in history, local color, memories, everyday life, expectations and paradoxes. Lee Bains III & the Glory Fires, a four-man band from Alabama, proudly join the Southern-rock tradition of wild-eyed music hitched to serious deliberation. Dereconstructed, the bands second album, ponders Southern identity in a welter of cranked-up guitars, bristling drums and rasping, hollering vocals. Its pandemonium with a conscience.

title: A Performer Leaves His Company, With Jewels in His Wake
description: Hail and farewell. George Balanchines Jewels (1967)  the first big hit he created for New York City Ballet after the company moved to Lincoln Center in April 1964, and now a mainstay of international repertory  returned to the David H. Koch Theater for four performances this weekend as part of the troupes 50th-anniversary season. (It will not be danced there in 2014-15.) At its Sunday performance, the principal dancer Jonathan Stafford bade goodbye to the company. Mr. Stafford, who studied with therenowned Pennsylvania teacher Marcia Dale Weary and then School of AmericanBallet, joined City Ballet in February 1999; he has been a principal since May 2007. He has been among the most discreet, unshowy of dancers: a true but self-effacing gentleman.

title: G.E. Chief to Meet With Hollande on Alstom Deal
description: PARIS  General Electric and Siemens are going all out this week to woo France as they compete to acquire the energy business of Alstom, the struggling French conglomerate that makes high-speed TGV trains.

title: If Chairs Could Talk? These Can
description: Even when I wasnt sure what I was seeing in The Chairs, I always liked what I saw. This puppet theater response to Eugene Ionescos absurdist play is by turns potent, perplexing, inspiring and weird. Consistently, though, its quite engaging to watch.

title: Battlefield Skills at Work in a City Hospital
description: The medical crises are rapid-fire and improbable, and the doctors who deal with them are easy-to-grasp cutouts in The Night Shift, a medical drama starting on Tuesday night on NBC that is akin to beach reading. There is plenty here to get your adrenaline flowing but not much to tax your brain.

title: Amazon Strategy Raises Hackles in Germany
description: BERLIN  It was German authors, carefully monitoring their Amazon rankings, who were among the first to notice something was amiss.

title: In a Choreographers Series, a Moment to Showcase Her Influences
description: Walk into St. Marks Church in the East Village between now and June 14, and look up. About a dozen handmade flags hang from the rafters, each emblematic of a different project by DD Dorvillier, the choreographer and thoughtful iconoclast at the center of Danspace Projects latest platform, Diary of an Image by DD Dorvillier.

title: Photos on a Plane? Take Note of the Fine Print
description: LET me say upfront that I dislike the pervading notion these days that music needs to fill every formerly silent public place.

title: Diet Lures and Diet Lies
description: My home is like any other, chockablock with stuff that I wouldnt want the world to see: trashy books, cheesy clothes, a cache of scented candles so enormous you might think Im prepping for some epically smelly apocalypse.

title: When Is Medicating Toddlers the Right Intervention?
description: To the Editor:

title: From Rich Soil to Your Dinner Table
A Backup Olympic Site
description: To the Editor:

title: South Sudans Plight
description: To the Editor:

title: A Climate Crisis Is Also a Health Crisis
description: To the Editor:

title: Mets Have a Trying Day From Beginning to End
description: Ike Davis bounded through the visitors dugout at Citi Field on Monday, wearing all black, a Pirates hat and a shirt that read, Men of Steel.

title: Signs of Diplomacy as Indian Leader Is Sworn In
description: NEW DELHI  Outside the sandstone palace that was built for the viceroy of British-ruled India, before a crowd that included corporate titans, Bollywood heartthrobs and saffron-robed Hindu holy men, Narendra Modi, the son of a provincial tea-seller, was sworn in on Monday as Indias prime minister.

title: Advocates Seek to Make Courthouses Off Limits for Immigration Officials
description: Rosario Socope, a Guatemalan immigrant in the country illegally, had an unwelcome surprise waiting for her when she attended a pretrial hearing on a felony charge at a courthouse in Brooklyn this month. As she stepped out of the courtroom into a public hallway, she was approached by immigration agents seeking to deport her.

title: Applying the Lessons of Politics to Green Power
description: WASHINGTON  Over the years, Tom Matzzie  by working as a political operative on John Kerrys 2004 presidential campaign and on building the antiwar movement that helped usher President Obama into office  became convinced that the key to creating change was to make it easy for people to participate.

title: To Prepare for the World Cup, a Host City Could Use Extra Time
description: CUIAB, Brazil  The four-day annual rodeo here draws about 80,000 fans, almost twice as many as the state soccer league attracted all of last year. No local team has played in the Brazilian first division since the 1980s.

title: Djokovics Greatest Motivation Isnt on Court
description: PARIS  Novak Djokovic was safe and dry after his first-round victory at the French Open on Monday, and it was noted that he often seems to play his best when he is playing for a cause higher than tennis.

title: Dairy Queen Finds a Summer Love: The Smore
description: THEY are not long, the days of wine and roses. Nor, as Madison Avenue knows, are the days of summer selling, which are vital to companies in areas like fast food, beverages and tourism that must gather their rosebuds  and revenue  while they may. For marketers, summer typically runs from Memorial Day through Labor Day; this year, that makes 99 days to wheel and deal.

title: Really Good Books, Part II
description: On Friday, I offered some of my favorite books, as possibilities for summer reading. The books of Part Two come in two baskets, which well call Athens and Jerusalem. The Athens books fire external ambition; the Jerusalem books focus on the inner spirit.

title: Leadership on Transgender Civil Rights
description: We are closer today to creating that open, respectful, inclusive world that we want for all of our children, Marylands Democratic governor, Martin OMalley, said of the law making Maryland the 18th state to extend civil rights protections to transgender people.

title: In a New Role, a Champion of the Homeless Looks to Prove His Critics Wrong
description: Not long after Mayor Bill de Blasio appointed him as commissioner of the nations largest municipal poverty agency, Steven Banks got a fat raspberry of a hello from The New York Post.

title: Super Secure, Super Late
description: In the feverish early months of the war on terror, the administration of President George W. Bush thought big when it came to displaying the nations muscle and resolve. The White House created the Department of Homeland Security superagency from an archipelago of 22 federal departments with more than 200,000 workers.

title: Nigerian Military Says It Knows Location of Abducted Girls
description: Nigerias military knows the location of nearly 300 girls abducted from school seven weeks ago by Boko Haram extremists, the top commander of the countrys armed forces said Monday. The assertion by the commander, Air Chief Marshal Alex Badeh, was the first time the Nigerian government had publicly claimed to know the whereabouts of the missing girls, whose abduction has provoked global outrage and criticism of the Nigeria military for having failed to find and rescue them.

title: In Complaint, Activists Seek Audit of New York Police Surveillance
description: Several groups plan to file a formal complaint on Tuesday seeking an audit of the New York Police Departments intelligence gathering operations, after recent revelations that the department had been monitoring political activists, sending undercover officers to their meetings and filing reports on their plans.

title: The C.I.A.s Deadly Ruse in Pakistan
description: The use of a sham vaccination program in the governments hunt for Osama bin Laden has produced a lethal backlash in Pakistan where dozens of public health workers have been murdered and fearful parents are shunning polio vaccine for their children.

title: A Cable Merger Too Far
description: There are good reasons the Justice Department and the Federal Communications Commission should block Comcasts $45 billion acquisition of Time Warner Cable. The merger will concentrate too much market power in the hands of one company, creating a telecommunications colossus the likes of which the country has not seen since 1984 when the government forced the breakup of the original AT&T telephone monopoly.

title: Governments Await Obamas Move on Carbon to Gauge U.S. Climate Efforts
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama is expected to announce on Monday an Environmental Protection Agency regulation to cut carbon pollution from the nations 600 coal-fired power plants, in a speech that government analysts in Beijing, Brussels and beyond will scrutinize to determine how serious the president is about fighting global warming.

title: What Did the Framers Really Mean?
description: Three days after the publication of Michael Waldmans new book, The Second Amendment: A Biography, Elliot Rodger, 22, went on a killing spree, stabbing three people and then shooting another eight, killing four of them, including himself. This was only the latest mass shooting in recent memory, going back to Columbine.

title: Ouster at Rap Genius Over Comments on Shooting Manifesto
description: The authorities say that before Elliot O. Rodger killed six people near the campus of the University of California, Santa Barbara, on Friday night, he left behind a 140-page manifesto.

title: Reining In the N.S.A.
A Composers Other Book
description: With the weather veering between light rain and mist, the Mets fan sitting behind third base at Citi Field kept his score book dry under a plastic poncho, taking it out to make quick but careful annotations  a backward K, for instance, for a batter who struck out looking  with a cedar pencil.

title: U.S. Training Elite Antiterror Troops in Four African Nations
description: WASHINGTON  United States Special Operations troops are forming elite counterterrorism units in four countries in North and West Africa that American officials say are pivotal in the widening war against Al Qaedas affiliates and associates on the continent, even as they acknowledge the difficulties of working with weak allies.

title: Ibaka Has Overcome More Than Mere Injuries
description: OKLAHOMA CITY  The question was a simple one: Could Serge Ibaka play in a basketball game? His leg was painful, yes, but the swelling in his calf, where the blood pooled, had subsided, and he could move around a little bit. More important, he could see that his teammates desperately needed him.

title: Gardners 11th-Inning Catch Sets Stage for Yanks Winning Rally in 12th
description: ST. LOUIS  With some typically crafty pitching, David Robertson earned his 11th save Monday, but it was Brett Gardner who truly saved the game for the Yankees.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for May 26, 2014
As His Foundation Has Grown, Gates Has Slowed His Donations
description: Bill Gates, who as the richest American has become one of the foremost advocates of philanthropy, has reduced the pace of his own giving to the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation over the last decade.

title: A Quest to Recognize Forgotten Achievements Still Relevant in Everyday Life
description: New York City has no shortage of formally recognized historic sites, but over the last few weeks it has gained some unofficial markers: gold-colored plaques paid for and delivered by a 44-year-old man who has traveled the country to commemorate overlooked people and places of national significance, especially those connected to the realities of contemporary life.

title: The Truth Behind a Fatal G.M. Crash
description: Nearly a decade ago, Rhonda Ericksons son died in a car accident. It is now known his is one of the 13 deaths tied to General Motors ignition switch malfunction.

title: 13 Deaths, Untold Heartache, From G.M. Defect
description: BEN WHEELER, Tex.  For most of the last decade, Candice Anderson has carried unspeakable guilt over the death of her boyfriend. He was killed in 2004 in a car accident here, and she was at the wheel. At one point, Ms. Anderson, who had a trace of Xanax in her blood, even faced a manslaughter charge. She was 21.

title: Shelf Prop
description: TUESDAYS PUZZLE  Ive never constructed a this reveal is a hint to both parts of the answers of the starred clues theme, and I can only imagine how difficult it must be to find two-word entries where both words in each phrase can work within the theme constraint.

title: Bill Clears Way for Blatche to Play for the Philippines
description: Andray Blatche has never been to the Philippines. He has no Filipino roots. Blatche is from Syracuse, N.Y., about 8,000 miles from Quezon City, where the Philippine basketball team normally trains.

title: Spain: Village Votes for New Name
description: The residents of Castrillo Matajudos, which loosely translates as Little Fort of Jew Killers, have voted to change the name of their village to erase any links to the persecution of Jews and a dark chapter in Spains history. The name change was approved by 29 residents and opposed by 19, Mayor Lorenzo Rodrguez Prez said Sunday. The village has only 56 registered inhabitants. The village will be renamed Castrillo Mota de Judos, or Little Hill Fort of Jews. Historical records have so far failed to yield a definitive answer about how the village got its name. One possible explanation is that Jewish converts to Catholicism in the 17th century switched to a name that would clearly distance them from their Jewish past and reduce the risk of further persecution. Another is that a local clerk mistakenly changed mota, or hill, into mata, or kill.

title: N.Y.U. Crisis in Abu Dhabi Stretches to Wall Street
description: Martin Lipton, the superlawyer, has advised hundreds of boards of directors in the midst of crises. Now, however, Mr. Lipton is grappling with a board governance crisis of his own.

title: Unlikely Allies Uniting to Fight School Changes
description: SMYRNA, Tenn.  She is a fan of MSNBC, supports abortion rights and increased government spending in schools, and believes unions should have the right to strike. He watches Fox News, opposes abortion and is a fiscal conservative who voted three years ago to strip teachers unions of collective bargaining rights.

title: A Bet on Florida Pays Off
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  In 2008, when American businesses were almost universally hoarding cash in a struggle to survive the financial crisis, Harris Rosen made a different call.

title: Limits to Law and Information Sharing, Despite Gunmans Danger Signs
description: LOS ANGELES  Elliot O. Rodger was a young college student who had few friends, detested his roommates and spent much of his time alone, reveling in the isolation of a local golf course or the beaches near Isla Vista, where he lived.

title: A City Split Over the Mixture of Church and Sausage
description: MADISON, Wis.  Tim Metcalfe, the organizer of an annual, meaty bacchanal called the Worlds Largest Brat Fest, had a few innocent ideas for shaking up the festival this year. He added a free Sunday-morning worship service to the lineup. One outdoor stage would be devoted to bands playing Christian music. And he invited Bob Lenz, a gregarious motivational speaker, to talk about teen suicide prevention.

title: The Appeal of the Fringe
description: In the elections for the European Parliament over the weekend, many traditional, centrist political parties lost ground to smaller or upstart parties from both sides of the spectrum.

title: Memorial Day Celebrations
description: In New York, and across the country, people gathered at ceremonies, parades and barbecues.

title: Hollywood Falls for Brooklyn
description: Hundreds of productions each year are shot in Brooklyn, which offers a tantalizing array of homes and neighborhoods, and cheaper location fees than Manhattan.

title: Wrist Forces Teixeira Out
description: ST. LOUIS  Mark Teixeira reported soreness in his surgically repaired right wrist on Monday morning, leading Joe Girardi to scratch him from the lineup and raising concerns about the stability of his wrist.

title: Quotation of the Day for Tuesday, May 27, 2014
description: The European elections have delivered their truth, and it is painful.

title: Lundqvist, One Win From Cup Finals, Is Playing at the Top of His Game
description: For all the dramatics of the Rangers series against Montreal  the controversy surrounding Canadiens goalie Carey Prices knee injury; the rhetoric over head shots, suspensions and spying; and Martin St. Louiss laser shot that won Game 4 in overtime  there has been one quiet constant for the Rangers: the brilliance of goaltender Henrik Lundqvist.

title: To Hollywood, All Things Hip Lie in Brooklyn
description: The inevitable has happened.

title: Vietnamese Vessel Sinks in Clash Near Oil Rig
description: BEIJING  A Chinese fishing vessel rammed and sank a Vietnamese fishing boat near the Chinese deepwater oil rig that was placed in disputed waters off the coast of Vietnam, according to the state-run Vietnamese television network, VTV1.

title: Hot in Brooklyn
description: While Manhattan is still filmed more than any other borough, Brooklyn runs close behind. Half of the 29 television series produced in the city last season were based in Brooklyn, compared with one out of seven in the 2002-3 season.

title: Campus Killings Set Off Anguished Conversation About the Treatment of Women
description: ISLA VISTA, Calif.  A deadly attack by a gunman obsessed by grievances toward women near the campus of the University of California, Santa Barbara, has touched off an anguished conversation here and on social media about the ways women are perceived sexually and the violence against them.

title: Twitters Growth Shifts to Developing Countries
description: Twitters growth has slowed substantially in the United States and Europe, and on Friday, nervous investors sent the companys stock to its lowest closing price since it first sold shares to the public in November.

title: Word of the Day | precipitous
description: precipitous \pri-si-p-ts\ adjective

title: Is College Worth It? Clearly, New Data Say
description: Some newly minted college graduates struggle to find work. Others accept jobs for which they feel overqualified. Student debt, meanwhile, has topped $1 trillion.

title: With Turnovers for Touchdowns, LeBron James and the Miami Heat Take Command
description: MIAMI  David West, a cerebral veteran on the Indiana Pacers, spoke colorfully Monday morning about the play of LeBron James, comparing him to a free safety roaming the football field, hunting the ball.

title: Whats On Tuesday
description: 8 P.M. (HBO) THE HEAT (2013) An uppity F.B.I. hotshot (Sandra Bullock) is assigned to work with a loose-cannon Boston detective (Melissa McCarthy, above left, with Ms. Bullock)  the better to temper personality traits that her boss (Demian Bichir) believes are standing in the way of a promotion at the agency  in this comedy directed by Paul Feig (Bridesmaids). And voil! A female version of Felix and Oscar, or Bateman and Galifianakis, is born. The story is sloppy and thin, many of the jokes are strained or tired, and the level of violence is a bit jarring, A. O. Scott wrote in The New York Times. But the volatile chemistry between Ms. McCarthy and Ms. Bullock is something to behold, and carries The Heat through its lazy conception and slapdash execution.

title: Times Minute | More Violence in Ukraine
description: New tactics after Ukraines nationwide elections. Also on the Minute, a battle brews between Republicans and veterans groups and film crews take over Brooklyn.

title: Times Minute | More Violence in Ukraine
description: In the Video

title: Corrections: May 27, 2014
description: NEW YORK

title: In Expanded Program, Officers Across New York City Will Carry Antidote for Heroin Overdoses
description: Police officers across New York City will soon carry medications to reverse the effects of an overdose from heroin or opioid prescription pills, officials are set to announce Tuesday, expanding from a successful program on Staten Island to all precincts citywide.

title: Wide Support on Chinese Social Media for Boat Attack
description: Updated, 3:50 a.m. ET| As news spread in China that a Chinese fishing boat had rammed and sunk a Vietnamese fishing boat about 20 miles from a deep sea oil rig that China has placed in waters contested by both countries, the reaction in social media appeared overwhelmingly supportive  even bellicose.

title: The Dark Room Collective: Where Black Poetry Took Wing
description: Late in 1987, two young poets made the trek to New York to attend the funeral of James Baldwin at the Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine.

title: China and Vietnam Point Fingers After Clash in South China Sea
description: BEIJING  Tensions in the South China Sea escalated sharply on Tuesday as China and Vietnam traded accusations over the sinking of a Vietnamese fishing vessel in the vicinity of a Chinese oil rig parked in disputed waters off Vietnams coast.

title: Data Provide Evidence That Malaysian Plane Crashed Into Indian Ocean
description: HONG KONG  Raw satellite transmission data from the vanished Malaysia Airlines Flight 370, released Tuesday by the Malaysian government, provided further evidence that the plane crashed into the Indian Ocean after flying south and running out of fuel.

title: Lloyds Bank Sets I.P.O. of Its TSB Branch Network
description: LONDON  The Lloyds Banking Group said on Tuesday that it would proceed with an initial public offering of its TSB Banking Group unit on the London Stock Exchange next month.

title: India and Pakistan in Common Agenda
description: NEW DELHI  Pakistans prime minister, Nawaz Sharif, said on Tuesday that the foreign secretaries of Pakistan and India would meet in the near future, indicating that he sees momentum toward reviving stalled peace talks between the two nations.

title: Test Yourself | History, May 27
description: Take the Quiz

title: 6 Qs About the News | A Boat With a History in Letters and Science Awaits Its Next Chapter
description: In Salvaging Steinbecks Vessel From a Little-Known Berth Kirk Johnson reports on the current situation regarding a boat called the Western Flyer.

title: IntercontinentalExchange Set to Spin Off Euronext
description: Updated, 7:41 p.m. | The IntercontinentalExchange Group, owner of the New York Stock Exchange, said on Tuesday that it planned to spin off Euronext in an initial public offering in the second quarter of this year.

title: Russians Revealed Among Ukraine Fighters
description: DONETSK, Ukraine  For weeks, rumors have flown about the foreign fighters involved in the deepening conflict in Ukraines troubled east, each one stranger than the last: mercenaries from an American company, Blackwater; Russian special forces; and even Chechen soldiers of fortune.

title: After the Inauguration, Ministers Roles Announced
